translated: Similarly, in the division of the directions, those that are in the twelve housesüîΩby the power of the course of the moon, in the bright and dark fortnights, by the process of expansion and contraction,

original: nyi ma mig dmar mjug ring spen pa g-yas sam rgyab tu yang dag gnas pas dgra ni 'chi bar byed //
analyzed: nyi ma mig dmar mjug ring spen pa g-yas sam rgyab tu yang dag gnas pas dgra ni 'chi bar byed //
translated: the sun, Mars, Saturn, and Jupiter, respectively, are the enemies of the ascendant.

original: g-yon dang mdun du zhi ba'i rang bzhin gza' tshogs mtha' dag g-yul gyi sar ni de bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang mdun du zhi ba'i rang bzhin gza' tshogs mtha' dag g-yul gyi sar ni de bzhin kho na'o //
translated: On the right and in front, all the planets, of a peaceful nature, are in the field of battle, just as before.

original: rnal 'byor ma dang bishti drag po rlung dang bcas pa g-yas dang rgyab tu bde ba sbyin pa ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang bishti drag po rlung dang bcas pa g-yas dang rgyab tu bde ba sbyin pa ste //
translated: Yoginƒ´, Vi·π£·πáu, and Rudra, along with the wind, are on the right and behind, bestowing happiness.

original: g-yon dang mdun du 'chi ba'i rang bzhin mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pas gnyis ka'i dpung ni 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yon dang mdun du 'chi ba'i rang bzhin mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pas gnyis ka'i dpung ni 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: On the left and in front, of a deadly nature, are the even and uneven ones, who destroy the army of both.

original: tshangs ma drag mo gzhon num dang mkha' 'gro'i bdag gis 'gro ma phag mo rdo rje lag ma dang // tsamundi nyid dpal mo dag ni nor gyi tshes la 'gyur te dang po'i tshes dang dgu pa la //
analyzed: tshangs ma drag mo gzhon num dang mkha' 'gro'i bdag gis 'gro ma phag mo rdo rje lag ma dang // tsamundi nyid dpal mo dag ni nor gyi tshes la 'gyur te dang po'i tshes dang dgu pa la //
translated: BrahmƒÅ, Rudra, KumƒÅrƒ´, and the lord of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, P·πõthivƒ´, VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, VajrƒÅ·πÖgƒ´, and Ca·πá·∏çƒ´, the glorious ones, are on the lunar days of wealth, the first and ninth.

original: brgya byin du ste gnod sbyin me zur lha min gshin rje chu lha rlung dang dbang ldan sa la 'o //
analyzed: brgya byin du ste gnod sbyin me zur lha min gshin rje chu lha rlung dang dbang ldan sa la 'o //
translated: Indra, on the second, Yak·π£a, on the third, Agni, on the fourth, RƒÅhu, on the fifth, Yama, on the sixth, Varu·πáa, on the seventh, VƒÅyu, on the eighth, Kubera, on the ninth, and on the tenth, BrahmƒÅ.

original: 'di ni 'char ba dag tu byed de slar yang tshes rnams la ni brgyad gnyis dbye bas tha dad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'char ba dag tu byed de slar yang tshes rnams la ni brgyad gnyis dbye bas tha dad do //
translated: This is the rising, and again, the lunar days are differentiated by the division of the eighth and second.

original: bishti rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs la brgya byin gshin rje chu dang gnod sbyin du yang 'dir 'char 'gyur //
analyzed: bishti rnams ni dkar po'i phyogs la brgya byin gshin rje chu dang gnod sbyin du yang 'dir 'char 'gyur //
translated: The Vishtis are in the bright half of the month. Indra, Yama, Varuna, and Kubera are the lords of the Vishtis.

original: slar yang nag po'i phyogs la rtse mo can dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
analyzed: slar yang nag po'i phyogs la rtse mo can dang lha min rlung dang dbang ldan zur du rim pas so //
translated: Again, in the dark half of the month, the Vishtis are in the directions beginning with northeast, in order.

original: drag po shar nas gzhan phyed du @47a *//üîΩ'gro nyin zhag dbang gis byang du yang ste byang gi nyi ma la'o //
analyzed: drag po shar nas gzhan phyed du @47a *// 'gro nyin zhag dbang gis byang du yang ste byang gi nyi ma la'o //
translated: Rudra moves from the east to the southeast.üîΩHe moves to the north by day, to the north of the sun.

original: chu nas me ldan dag tu de ni nges par 'gro ste lho ru lho yi nyi ma dag la'o //
analyzed: chu nas me ldan dag tu de ni nges par 'gro ste lho ru lho yi nyi ma dag la'o //
translated: He moves to the south by night, to the south of the sun.

original: shar nas thun phyed dag la rlung du rab tu 'jug ste de bzhin du ni lho ru 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: shar nas thun phyed dag la rlung du rab tu 'jug ste de bzhin du ni lho ru 'gro bar byed //
translated: He moves from the east to the southwest in half a watch. He moves in the same way to the south.

original: dbang ldan chu dang me dang gnod sbyin lha min grong khyer du 'gro rlung du nyi ma nub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang ldan chu dang me dang gnod sbyin lha min grong khyer du 'gro rlung du nyi ma nub par 'gyur //
translated: He moves to the northeast, to the southeast, to the southwest, and to the northwest in the cities of Indra, Agni, Yama, and Varuna. The sun sets in the wind.

original: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan dor nas rlung dag las kyang rnam par rgyal 'gyur mtshan ma'i 'thab mo dang // 'khrug pa dag la rtsa ba'i sgra gcan gyis ni dgra yi stobs 'joms de dang mtshungs pa gzhan yod min //
analyzed: dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan dor nas rlung dag las kyang rnam par rgyal 'gyur mtshan ma'i 'thab mo dang // 'khrug pa dag la rtsa ba'i sgra gcan gyis ni dgra yi stobs 'joms de dang mtshungs pa gzhan yod min //
translated: The glorious RƒÅhu, having cast off the moon, is victorious over the winds, and there is no other equal to him in the battle and conflict with the signs.

original: dbyangs dman 'thab mo pa ni mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul la lhag ba dag gis 'joms par byed pa ste //
analyzed: dbyangs dman 'thab mo pa ni mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul la lhag ba dag gis 'joms par byed pa ste //
translated: The RƒÅhu of the battle, inferior in tone, is vanquished by the superior in tone, whether equal or unequal.

original: dbugs la gnyis kyi ming gang snying la rab tu 'jug na de ni 'khrug pa dag las rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbugs la gnyis kyi ming gang snying la rab tu 'jug na de ni 'khrug pa dag las rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: When the name of the two breaths enters the heart, he is victorious in the conflicts.

original: pho nyas brjod pa dang po'i ming de rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te phyis kyi ming de pham par 'gyur //
analyzed: pho nyas brjod pa dang po'i ming de rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te phyis kyi ming de pham par 'gyur //
translated: The name of the first messenger is victorious, the name of the latter is defeated.

original: 'du ba kha dog dbyangs la sogs pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras med ston pa nyid //
analyzed: 'du ba kha dog dbyangs la sogs pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras med ston pa nyid //
translated: The union of equal and unequal colors, tones, etc., is declared to be fruitless.

original: dus ni 'thab mo'i sa la mi bdag rnams kyi g-yas dang gal te g-yas min dag la mun can 'gyur //
analyzed: dus ni 'thab mo'i sa la mi bdag rnams kyi g-yas dang gal te g-yas min dag la mun can 'gyur //
translated: Time is the darkness for kings in the battleground, whether on the right or the left.

original: g-yul du lha yi mgon po dag ni 'phrog byed drag po dang bcas mi rnams kyis kyang 'joms par 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yul du lha yi mgon po dag ni 'phrog byed drag po dang bcas mi rnams kyis kyang 'joms par 'gyur //
translated: In battle, the gods, with Indra, are defeated by the demons, and the demons, with RƒÅhu, are defeated by the gods.

original: de phyir dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan 'khyog po drag po lha min rnams las srid @47b gsum rnam rgyal ba //
analyzed: de phyir dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan 'khyog po drag po lha min rnams las srid @47b gsum rnam rgyal ba //
translated: Therefore, the glorious RƒÅhu, the crooked one, is victorious over the three worlds, over the gods and the demons.

original: g-yul gyi dus su sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas shes par bya ste gzhan du dgra ni nyams pa med //
analyzed: g-yul gyi dus su sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas shes par bya ste gzhan du dgra ni nyams pa med //
translated: One should know that in battle he resides in the middle of the earth, otherwise the enemy is not defeated.

original: sa la rgyu skar byas nas thub pa dus kyis bsgyur ba dbang po gnod sbyin chu dang gshin rjer ni //
analyzed: sa la rgyu skar byas nas thub pa dus kyis bsgyur ba dbang po gnod sbyin chu dang gshin rjer ni //
translated: The sages, having made the lunar mansions on the earth, are displaced by time, in Indra, the Yak·π£as, the water, and Yama.

original: de yi 'khor lo 'khor bar byed de nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis mtha' dag rnams ni rig par bya //
analyzed: de yi 'khor lo 'khor bar byed de nyin zhag bgrod pa'i dbang gis mtha' dag rnams ni rig par bya //
translated: His wheel turns, and all are known by the power of the movement of the days.

original: rgyu skar gang la dus dang mun can du yang rab gyur lta ba lhung na gnyis po dag la yang //
analyzed: rgyu skar gang la dus dang mun can du yang rab gyur lta ba lhung na gnyis po dag la yang //
translated: In whatever lunar mansion the time and the darkness are strong, if the view falls on both,

original: g-yul du dgra yi sde rnams dag ni 'phral la nges par ltung ste lto yi dbus su rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yul du dgra yi sde rnams dag ni 'phral la nges par ltung ste lto yi dbus su rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: in battle the enemy troops will immediately fall, and there will be victory in the middle of the belly.

original: sgra gcan dus la gnas pa rnams ni 'chi dang bcas par 'gyur zhing dpung rnams mnyam du ltung ba ni //
analyzed: sgra gcan dus la gnas pa rnams ni 'chi dang bcas par 'gyur zhing dpung rnams mnyam du ltung ba ni //
translated: Those who abide in the time of RƒÅhu will be subject to death, and the armies will fall together.

original: lta ba'i cha la nges song rnams te brang 'gro 'gro ba'i dbang gis der ni sde rnams bcom par 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba'i cha la nges song rnams te brang 'gro 'gro ba'i dbang gis der ni sde rnams bcom par 'gyur //
translated: Those who have gone to the part of the view will be destroyed by the power of the movement of the chest.

original: lta ba'i cha ni spangs pa rnams dag rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te lto bar zhugs la gnyis po yang //
analyzed: lta ba'i cha ni spangs pa rnams dag rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te lto bar zhugs la gnyis po yang //
translated: Those who have abandoned the part of the view will be victorious, and both will enter the belly.

original: de ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i gsung la gnas pa dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya //
analyzed: de ltar dpal ldan rtsa ba'i sgra gcan bla ma'i gsung la gnas pa dus kyi 'khor lor shes par bya //
translated: Thus, one should know the glorious root RƒÅhu in the KƒÅlacakra, abiding in the speech of the guru.

original: rnal 'byor ma dang bishti drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs ni 'char ba dag dang bcas gyur ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang bishti drag po gza' tshogs dang bcas dbyangs ni 'char ba dag dang bcas gyur ba //
translated: The yoginƒ´s, Vi·π£·πáu, and the fierce planets with their hosts, together with the rising vowels,

original: de dag thams cad btang nas rgyal rigs rnams kyis srid gsum rnam rgyal gcig pu gzung bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: de dag thams cad btang nas rgyal rigs rnams kyis srid gsum rnam rgyal gcig pu gzung bar bya ba ste //
translated: all of them having been abandoned, should be taken up by the k·π£atriyas alone, the conquerors of the three worlds.

original: gang gis zla ba nyi ma za zhing skabs gsum pa dag 'jigs byed drag po'i gzugs can mig sman mdog /
analyzed: gang gis zla ba nyi ma za zhing skabs gsum pa dag 'jigs byed drag po'i gzugs can mig sman mdog /
translated: By whom the moon and sun are devoured, and the third part is the fierce one with a terrifying form, the color of collyrium,

original: sa la gang zhig nyin dang mtshan mor shar dang @48a *//
analyzed: sa la gang zhig nyin dang mtshan mor shar dang @48a *//
translated: And in the daytime and at night,üîΩ

original: nub dang lho dang byang du yang ni 'khor ba 'o //
analyzed: nub dang lho dang byang du yang ni 'khor ba 'o //
translated: The sun, which rises in the east and sets in the west, moves south and north, day and night, over the earth.

original: g-yul du pham pa'i dgra bo dag ni gal te 'phral la rdzong gi nang du zhugs par gyur pa na //
analyzed: g-yul du pham pa'i dgra bo dag ni gal te 'phral la rdzong gi nang du zhugs par gyur pa na //
translated: If the defeated enemy should suddenly enter a fortress,

original: phyi rol tu ni 'khrul 'khor bya ste rgyun chad med par rdo dang me mda' rab tu 'bab pa dang // ral gri la sogs gcod pa'i 'khrul 'khor dag dang sa sa gzhi'i gnas la gur dang cog ni dbye ba yis //
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni 'khrul 'khor bya ste rgyun chad med par rdo dang me mda' rab tu 'bab pa dang // ral gri la sogs gcod pa'i 'khrul 'khor dag dang sa sa gzhi'i gnas la gur dang cog ni dbye ba yis //
translated: then an external siege should be laid to it, with a constant rain of stones and arrows, and with a cutting engine of swords and the like, and with a wall of earth and a tent on the ground.

original: da yi rdzong ni phye mar byas te nyin zhag nyung zad dag gis gdug ba de ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: da yi rdzong ni phye mar byas te nyin zhag nyung zad dag gis gdug ba de ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: In a few days the fortress will be reduced to dust, and the wicked one will be destroyed.

original: ka ba bzhi ni brgyad gnyis khru ldan mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas nas gnas brgyad du ni phug gyur pa //
analyzed: ka ba bzhi ni brgyad gnyis khru ldan mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas nas gnas brgyad du ni phug gyur pa //
translated: In the four corners of the fortress, at a distance of eight cubits, there are four holes, some high, some low.

original: tha dad rnams ni sdong bu chu gter dus dang dus rnams kyis te rgyab tu yang ni gcig gis so //
analyzed: tha dad rnams ni sdong bu chu gter dus dang dus rnams kyis te rgyab tu yang ni gcig gis so //
translated: The different holes are connected by a tube, and at the proper time the water is let in, and the fortress is filled up.

original: rtsa bar 'khrul 'khor tshad ni lag pa bcu ru 'gyur te steng gi cha dag la ni de yi phyed; ;sgyogs mda' khru gnyis dag gis dman par 'gyur te ao log bcu yi steng gi cha ni lhag pa 'o //
analyzed: rtsa bar 'khrul 'khor tshad ni lag pa bcu ru 'gyur te steng gi cha dag la ni de yi phyed; ;sgyogs mda' khru gnyis dag gis dman par 'gyur te ao log bcu yi steng gi cha ni lhag pa 'o //
translated: The distance of the catapult is two cubits less, and the upper part is ten cubits.

original: zlum por phyed bcas khru gnyis dag ste sor mo thub pa ma nur nges pa'i bug pa gcig tu ni //
analyzed: zlum por phyed bcas khru gnyis dag ste sor mo thub pa ma nur nges pa'i bug pa gcig tu ni //
translated: The circle is two cubits and a half, and the hole is one cubit, with a margin of a finger-width.

original: khru gang dor nas sgyogs mda' rab tu gzhug ste ao log bcu yi rgyab kyi cha la gzer gyis gdab //
analyzed: khru gang dor nas sgyogs mda' rab tu gzhug ste ao log bcu yi rgyab kyi cha la gzer gyis gdab //
translated: Having reduced it by one cubit, the catapult is inserted, and the bolt is driven in at the back, ten cubits away.

original: mgo bor aa long dag la thag pa lnga bcu gdags par bya ste steng gi tshad ni zlum po phyed //
analyzed: mgo bor aa long dag la thag pa lnga bcu gdags par bya ste steng gi tshad ni zlum po phyed //
translated: At the top of the head, a rope of fifty fathoms is attached, and the upper measure is half a circle.

original: sgyogs mda'i mthar ni mdzub mo dang bcas rab tu 'jug ste gnya' non zlum po dag ni mtho yang ngo //
analyzed: sgyogs mda'i mthar ni mdzub mo dang bcas rab tu 'jug ste gnya' non zlum po dag ni mtho yang ngo //
translated: At the end of the catapult, together with a finger, it is well inserted, and the yoke is circular and high.

original: sgyogs mda'i mdzub mo la ni 'ur mthil thag @48b par bcas pa dag la nges par khru gsum dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sgyogs mda'i mdzub mo la ni 'ur mthil thag @48b par bcas pa dag la nges par khru gsum dag tu 'gyur //
translated: At the finger of the catapult, together with the palm and the rope, it is definitely three cubits.

original: de yi nang du rdo ba rab tu bcug ste stobs ldan 'then byed rnams kyis 'then par gyur pa dag //
analyzed: de yi nang du rdo ba rab tu bcug ste stobs ldan 'then byed rnams kyis 'then par gyur pa dag //
translated: Having placed a stone in it, the strong pullers pull it.

original: btang ba myur du nam mkhar 'gro ste 'phral la nges par ltung zhing khang steng sogs dang lam srang du //
analyzed: btang ba myur du nam mkhar 'gro ste 'phral la nges par ltung zhing khang steng sogs dang lam srang du //
translated: Having been released, it quickly goes into the sky and immediately falls down, having pulverized the roofs, etc., and the streets.

original: mtha' dag phye mar byas nas sa yi 'og tu 'gro ste rdo rje 'bab pa ji lta ba nyid bzhin //
analyzed: mtha' dag phye mar byas nas sa yi 'og tu 'gro ste rdo rje 'bab pa ji lta ba nyid bzhin //
translated: Having pulverized everything, it goes under the ground, just like a falling vajra.

original: de yi mdzub mo zla ba phyed pas gzhi yi gnas su tshangs pa'i ri mo ngos gnyis dag tu ni //
analyzed: de yi mdzub mo zla ba phyed pas gzhi yi gnas su tshangs pa'i ri mo ngos gnyis dag tu ni //
translated: With its half-moon finger, in the place of the base, on both sides of the Brahma line,

original: brgyad gnyis btang ba'i gnas rnams dag ste lag pa gnyis ka'i khu tshur bcings las gtang bar bya //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis btang ba'i gnas rnams dag ste lag pa gnyis ka'i khu tshur bcings las gtang bar bya //
translated: having released the eight and two places, one should release them from the clenched fists of both hands.

original: gtong pa sa la reg pa nyid de mnyam dang mi mnyam rkang pa 'khrul 'khor nang du gnas pas ni //
analyzed: gtong pa sa la reg pa nyid de mnyam dang mi mnyam rkang pa 'khrul 'khor nang du gnas pas ni //
translated: The release touches the ground, and with the feet in a cross-legged position, in the middle of the ma·πá·∏çala,

original: rang 'dod rdo ba ltung ste rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis rdzong ni rnam par gzhom pa'i don du 'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod rdo ba ltung ste rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis rdzong ni rnam par gzhom pa'i don du 'o //
translated: the stone falls as one wishes. The three ways are for the purpose of conquering the fortress.

original: gang zhig bsnun pas glang chen 'phral la nges par ltung ba de la srog chags phra mo dag ni ci //
analyzed: gang zhig bsnun pas glang chen 'phral la nges par ltung ba de la srog chags phra mo dag ni ci //
translated: What animal is there that can suddenly bring down an elephant by striking it?

original: rdzong gi steng khang la gnas dgra dbung ma lus gang dag phyi rol gnas par ltung bar byed pa ste //üîΩsa steng gnas su rdzong gi 'thab mo la ni gzhu 'dzin rnams kyis de dang lhan cig su zhig 'gran //
analyzed: rdzong gi steng khang la gnas dgra dbung ma lus gang dag phyi rol gnas par ltung bar byed pa ste // sa steng gnas su rdzong gi 'thab mo la ni gzhu 'dzin rnams kyis de dang lhan cig su zhig 'gran //
translated: The upper story of a fortress brings down upon the enemy outside all the forces within.üîΩWho would challenge the archers on the battlefield, who stand on the ground below the fortress?

original: gang du 'khrul 'khor rab bsnun rdzong der dgra bo su zhig zhugs pa dag ni gshin rje'i kha ru 'o //üîΩka ba dpung ba drug drug dag gis gnyi ga'i nang ni mnyam pa khru ni zung gi bar dag la //
analyzed: gang du 'khrul 'khor rab bsnun rdzong der dgra bo su zhig zhugs pa dag ni gshin rje'i kha ru 'o // ka ba dpung ba drug drug dag gis gnyi ga'i nang ni mnyam pa khru ni zung gi bar dag la //
translated: When the fortress is attacked by the machine, whoever enters it is food for the Lord of Death.üîΩEach of the two sides of the fortress is six cubits wide, and the middle is two cubits wide.

original: snying po re re'i nyi ma'i khru ru 'gyur te gnyi gnang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid //
analyzed: snying po re re'i nyi ma'i khru ru 'gyur te gnyi gnang ni mnyam pa lhag chad med pa nyid //
translated: Each of the two sides of the core is one cubit wide, and the middle is two cubits wide.

original: so so'i re mig kun la spang @49a *//
analyzed: so so'i re mig kun la spang @49a *//
translated: The entire area of each square is to be subtracted.

original: leb dag dang pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis kyang g-yogs pa ste //
analyzed: leb dag dang pags pa spra tshil gos rnams kyis kyang g-yogs pa ste //
translated: The fortress is covered with planks, skin, bitumen, and cloth.

original: snying po dus dang brgyad dang skyon dang sum 'gyur nyin byed kyis kyang 'khrul 'khor gcig ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: snying po dus dang brgyad dang skyon dang sum 'gyur nyin byed kyis kyang 'khrul 'khor gcig ni rab tu bya //
translated: The axle is made of the essence of the eight directions and the three faults, and is turned by the sun.

original: gnyis gnyis snying po'i bar du 'khrul pa dag kyang dpung pa rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'am kun nas so //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis snying po'i bar du 'khrul pa dag kyang dpung pa rnams kyis rgya yis btab pa'am kun nas so //
translated: The two wheels are placed between the two essences, and are marked with the two shoulders, or completely.

original: rgyab tu skya ba 'dzin pha drug ste mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pa 'am //
analyzed: rgyab tu skya ba 'dzin pha drug ste mdun nas dpung pa gnyis ka mnyam pa 'khrul 'khor 'dren pa 'am //
translated: In the back are six poles, and in front are two shoulders, which draw the machine.

original: ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni rlung gis bskyod pa ste //
analyzed: ka ba'i khung bur rab tu btsugs pa'i g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar rnams kyis ni rlung gis bskyod pa ste //
translated: The wind-blown banners are fixed in the holes of the pillars.

original: de la gzhon pa rang gi sde ni chu yi rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu yi gter la 'go //
analyzed: de la gzhon pa rang gi sde ni chu yi rdzong dag nyams pa'i don du chu yi gter la 'go //
translated: The young people of the army go to the ocean to destroy the water-fortress.

original: chu gter zur ldan stegs bu gcig la g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar dang rgyal mtshan bcas ba ka bar gdags //
analyzed: chu gter zur ldan stegs bu gcig la g-yo ba'i rlung gi dar dang rgyal mtshan bcas ba ka bar gdags //
translated: The water-fortress is placed on one side, and the moving banner and flag are placed on the pillar.

original: rgyab kyi phyogs nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pa dag gis steng du 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: rgyab kyi phyogs nas mi rnams dag gis drangs shing sa las thag pa dag gis steng du 'gro ba ni //
translated: The people in the back pull it, and it moves on the ground by ropes.

original: rlung gis rab tu bskyong par gyur pa nges par brag gi rdzong gi steng du mkha' la 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: rlung gis rab tu bskyong par gyur pa nges par brag gi rdzong gi steng du mkha' la 'gro ba ste //
translated: The wind, which is well-controlled, certainly moves in the sky above the rocky fortress.

original: de nas me yi 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra yi dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed //
analyzed: de nas me yi 'bru mar 'phangs pas dgra yi dpung dang rdzong ni thams cad kun nas sreg par byed //
translated: Then, by throwing fire-oil, the entire army and fortress of the enemy are completely burned.

original: 'khor lo'i rtsa bar gnam gdan rtse gcig pa ni gzhug cing steng du yang ni 'khor lo dag la ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsa bar gnam gdan rtse gcig pa ni gzhug cing steng du yang ni 'khor lo dag la ni //
translated: At the base of the wheel, a single-pointed sky-seat is inserted, and above that, on the wheels,

original: sor mo gnyis gnyis bar du rtsibs su 'gyur te zlum po'i mtha' ma ma lus par ni bgod par bya //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis gnyis bar du rtsibs su 'gyur te zlum po'i mtha' ma ma lus par ni bgod par bya //
translated: between two fingers, there is a spoke, and the entire round edge is divided.

original: 'khor lo khru ni phyed dang gsum par 'gyur zhing gnam gdan steng du gzhan @49b yang der ni srog shing ste //
analyzed: 'khor lo khru ni phyed dang gsum par 'gyur zhing gnam gdan steng du gzhan @49b yang der ni srog shing ste //
translated: The wheel becomes one cubit and three inches, and above the sky-seat, there is another life-tree there.

original: srog shing steng du ral gri rnon po myur bar 'khor te 'khrul 'khor gyi ni rtsa ba 'khor bas so //
analyzed: srog shing steng du ral gri rnon po myur bar 'khor te 'khrul 'khor gyi ni rtsa ba 'khor bas so //
translated: Above the life-tree, a sharp sword quickly revolves, due to the rotation of the base of the machine.

original: thag pa yis ni rlung gi 'khrul 'khor nam mkha' dag la 'gro ste rang gi phyogs nas rim pas so //
analyzed: thag pa yis ni rlung gi 'khrul 'khor nam mkha' dag la 'gro ste rang gi phyogs nas rim pas so //
translated: By means of a rope, the wind-machine moves in the sky from one's own direction in stages.

original: rdzong gi steng dang dgra yi khyim du so sor 'gro bar nges pa nyid du thag pa drangs byas nas //
analyzed: rdzong gi steng dang dgra yi khyim du so sor 'gro bar nges pa nyid du thag pa drangs byas nas //
translated: The rope is drawn tight, and the two are certain to meet, one above the fortress, the other in the enemy's house.

original: sa la tshad kyang de yis brjod par 'gyur te dgra rnams kyi na rdzong gi rtse mo 'byed pa yis //
analyzed: sa la tshad kyang de yis brjod par 'gyur te dgra rnams kyi na rdzong gi rtse mo 'byed pa yis //
translated: The measure of the ground is also indicated by this, for the enemy's fortress is to be breached from above.

original: rtse la bkod de dgra yi khang pa'i gzhi dang 'dun sa dag la me ni rab tu sbyin par bya //
analyzed: rtse la bkod de dgra yi khang pa'i gzhi dang 'dun sa dag la me ni rab tu sbyin par bya //
translated: Having placed it on the peak, one should set fire to the enemy's house and the assembly hall.

original: 'khor lo rnams kyi steng gi cha la lcags dang shing rnams dag gis khang pa chen po bkod pa ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams kyi steng gi cha la lcags dang shing rnams dag gis khang pa chen po bkod pa ni //
translated: On the upper part of the wheels, a large house is constructed with iron and wood,

original: spang leb dang ni ma he'i pags pa rnams kyi kun nas g-yogs par gyur pa zlum po rnam pa ste //
analyzed: spang leb dang ni ma he'i pags pa rnams kyi kun nas g-yogs par gyur pa zlum po rnam pa ste //
translated: covered all around with planks and buffalo hides, round in shape.

original: mi rnams dag gis bskyod par gyur pa mnyam pa'i sa la 'obs ni ji srid nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rnams dag gis bskyod par gyur pa mnyam pa'i sa la 'obs ni ji srid nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: As long as the ground is even, the people move around in the moat.

original: 'obs de bkang nas mkhar gyi rtsig pa dang ni lam srang dag tu 'phral la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'obs de bkang nas mkhar gyi rtsig pa dang ni lam srang dag tu 'phral la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: When the moat is full, it immediately enters the walls of the fortress and the streets.

original: stegs bur phur pa gnyis la nges par rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhu ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas //
analyzed: stegs bur phur pa gnyis la nges par rgyud dang bcas pa'i gzhu ni g-yo ba med par btags byas nas //
translated: On the platform, two stakes are fixed, with a bow and arrow fastened to them, unmoving.

original: rgyab tu lcags kyi phur pa gnyis la legs bkod 'khrul shing la ni sor mo lta bu phyed 'khyog rnams //
analyzed: rgyab tu lcags kyi phur pa gnyis la legs bkod 'khrul shing la ni sor mo lta bu phyed 'khyog rnams //
translated: In the back, two iron stakes are well placed, with half-bent fingers on the crossbar.

original: sor mo'i rtse mo dag la gzhu rgyud kyis ni mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams //
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mo dag la gzhu rgyud kyis ni mang zhing mnyam pa'i mda' 'am lcags mda' rnon po rnams //
translated: At the tips of the fingers, with many bowstrings, are many even arrows or sharp iron arrows.

original: g-yul gyi dus su 'phang pas go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu @50a *//
analyzed: g-yul gyi dus su 'phang pas go cha dang bcas glang chen lus po phug nas rab tu @50a *//
translated: At the time of battle, they are shot, and having pierced the bodies of the elephants with armor, they go

original: 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: deeply into the ground.

original: ka ba gnyis nis yi nang du brtan par btsugs pa thag pa rnams kyis dkris par gyur pa ste //
analyzed: ka ba gnyis nis yi nang du brtan par btsugs pa thag pa rnams kyis dkris par gyur pa ste //
translated: Two pillars are firmly planted in the ground, and are wrapped with ropes.

original: thag pa'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung tshud pa zlum po dang bcas bskor ba du mas bskor gyur pa //
analyzed: thag pa'i dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung tshud pa zlum po dang bcas bskor ba du mas bskor gyur pa //
translated: In the middle of the ropes, the handles of swords are inserted, surrounded by many circles.

original: de yi dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung nges par g-yo ba med par gzer gyis btab par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dbus su ral gri'i chang gzung nges par g-yo ba med par gzer gyis btab par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: In the middle of that, the handles of swords are firmly fixed, unmoving, with nails.

original: gzer dang thag par bcas pa g-yogs par bya zhing ral gri'i so yi rtse mo'i cha yang mnan par bya //
analyzed: gzer dang thag par bcas pa g-yogs par bya zhing ral gri'i so yi rtse mo'i cha yang mnan par bya //
translated: The sword should be covered with a cloth and a rope, and the edge of the blade should be pressed down.

original: de yi steng du bug pa'i re kha can gyi sbang leb las ni bskul bar 'gyur ba thon pa 'o //
analyzed: de yi steng du bug pa'i re kha can gyi sbang leb las ni bskul bar 'gyur ba thon pa 'o //
translated: Above it, a wooden board with a hole should be placed, through which a lever is inserted.

original: ral gri'i steng du zla ba'i dbus kyi cha la lcags las byas pa chung du zhig kyang gzhag par bya //
analyzed: ral gri'i steng du zla ba'i dbus kyi cha la lcags las byas pa chung du zhig kyang gzhag par bya //
translated: On top of the sword, in the middle of the moon, a small piece of iron should also be placed.

original: zla ba'i steng du gang gi rkang pa bzhag pa de ni 'phral la ral gri yi sa kyang gcod par byed //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du gang gi rkang pa bzhag pa de ni 'phral la ral gri yi sa kyang gcod par byed //
translated: Whoever places his foot on the moon will immediately be cut by the sword.

original: mkhar gyi sgo yi mtha' rnams dang ni mi yi bdag po'i khang par 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha 'o //
analyzed: mkhar gyi sgo yi mtha' rnams dang ni mi yi bdag po'i khang par 'khrul 'khor kho na mtshon cha 'o //
translated: At the gates of the city and in the king's palace, only machines are the weapons.

original: srog shing steng du nyi ma'i lag bas rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur te 'khor lo'i tshad la dgu cha 'o //
analyzed: srog shing steng du nyi ma'i lag bas rtsa ba'i gnas su 'gyur te 'khor lo'i tshad la dgu cha 'o //
translated: On the central pole, in the lower position, there is the sun with nine parts, the measure of the wheel.

original: zur du ka ba 'phred rdang mnyam dang mi mnyam shing rta gnas las gnyis dang phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: zur du ka ba 'phred rdang mnyam dang mi mnyam shing rta gnas las gnyis dang phyed kyi tshad kyis so //
translated: In the corners, the pillars and crossbeams are equal and unequal, with the measure of two and a half from the chariot's position.

original: cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa yi sa ste mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren byed rta 'am ma glang po rnams //
analyzed: cha phyed dag la 'thab mo pa yi sa ste mnyam dang mi mnyam 'dren byed rta 'am ma glang po rnams //
translated: The half-squares are the grounds of the battle, and the even and uneven squares are the horses and elephants that draw the chariot.

original: da nas 'khor lo'i phyed kyi sa la steng du me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa 'o //
analyzed: da nas 'khor lo'i phyed kyi sa la steng du me long do shal rgyal mtshan la sogs bkod pa 'o //
translated: Now, on the half-squares of the wheel, there are mirrors, necklaces, banners, and so forth.

original: gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zla ba lag pa rtse @50b mo can rnams rtsa ba'i gnas dang gdan rnams kyi //
analyzed: gcig phyed cha gnyis dag ste zla ba lag pa rtse @50b mo can rnams rtsa ba'i gnas dang gdan rnams kyi //
translated: One half-square is two parts, and the moon, hand, and peak are the basic places and seats.

original: zlum po phyed bcas gcig cha padma'i shing rta'i sa ni dga' ba'i dbye ba dag la mnyam bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zlum po phyed bcas gcig cha padma'i shing rta'i sa ni dga' ba'i dbye ba dag la mnyam bar 'gyur //
translated: The round with half is one part, and the lotus chariot ground is the same in the divisions of joy.

original: rten dang bcas pa 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta dang glang po'i dbang gis phyed dang bcas pa rnams gnyis kyang //
analyzed: rten dang bcas pa 'khor lo'i tshad ni rta dang glang po'i dbang gis phyed dang bcas pa rnams gnyis kyang //
translated: The measure of the wheel with its support is two and a half, by the power of the horses and elephants.

original: lha rnams kyi ni padma'i rigs te lha yi bu yis bkod pa dga' ba'i ring /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ni padma'i rigs te lha yi bu yis bkod pa dga' ba'i ring /
translated: The gods' is the lotus family, and the arrangement of the sons of the gods is the distance of joy.

original: sa ni mi rnams kyis //
analyzed: sa ni mi rnams kyis //
translated: The ground is of humans.

original: brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo'i rnams kyis rnam gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam //
analyzed: brgyad dang chu gter srog shing 'khor lo'i rnams kyis rnam gsum 'dir ni shing rta chen po phyed dang mnyam //
translated: The three here are the eight, the life-tree of the ocean, and the wheels. The great chariot is half-equal.

original: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa mi mnyam rta yang lha ma yin rnams rnam par 'joms //
analyzed: nyi ma'i shing rta mchog ni 'khor lo gcig pa mi mnyam rta yang lha ma yin rnams rnam par 'joms //
translated: The supreme chariot of the sun has one wheel, and the uneven horse also conquers the demigods.

original: g-yul du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i shing rta chen po rgyal rigs rnams kyi 'o //
analyzed: g-yul du phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba mi mnyam mnyam pa'i shing rta chen po rgyal rigs rnams kyi 'o //
translated: The great chariot of the uneven and even is for the royal class, which becomes invincible in battle.

original: steng dang mngon du phyogs pa 'joms te mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du rgyab ni 'joms pa mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: steng dang mngon du phyogs pa 'joms te mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du rgyab ni 'joms pa mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: It conquers the upper and frontal directions, and in the even and uneven battles, the rear is conquered and becomes even.

original: drug lnga chu gter mi yi cha rnams dag gis ka ba'i rtse mor bug pa mnyam par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: drug lnga chu gter mi yi cha rnams dag gis ka ba'i rtse mor bug pa mnyam par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: The holes in the top of the pillars become even with six, five, and human parts.

original: rtsa ba dag las steng du phyed kyi cha ni brtsegs ma'i dbang gis 'gyur te lha rnams gzhal med khang //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag las steng du phyed kyi cha ni brtsegs ma'i dbang gis 'gyur te lha rnams gzhal med khang //
translated: From the roots, half the part above becomes the mansion of the gods by the power of the tiers.

original: de bzhin sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rnam gsum brtsegs ma'i dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dga' ston la //
analyzed: de bzhin sa la mi bdag rnams kyi rnam gsum brtsegs ma'i dbang gis yul gyi ltad mo dga' ston la //
translated: Similarly, on the earth, by the power of the three tiers of the rulers, there is the delightful spectacle of the country's festivities.

original: khru nas khru yi bar dag gis ni phyogs rnams kun tu 'khor ba dang ldan chen po rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: khru nas khru yi bar dag gis ni phyogs rnams kun tu 'khor ba dang ldan chen po rab tu 'gyur //
translated: From one cubit to one cubit, it becomes the great circle in all directions.

original: 'khor lo'i steng du ga ba'i rtse mo dag la rnam gsum brtsegs ma'i dbang @51a *//üîΩgis khyogs rnams phyogs kun tu //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i steng du ga ba'i rtse mo dag la rnam gsum brtsegs ma'i dbang @51a *// gis khyogs rnams phyogs kun tu //
translated: On the wheel, on the tips of the spokes, are the three-stacked thrones of the eight directions.

original: brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de phyogs dang dus dang dus dag lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis brgyad dang de nas phyed de phyogs dang dus dang dus dag lag pa rten nyid sa gsum la //
translated: The eight, two, and eight again, and then half of that, in the directions, times, and half-times, are the supports of the hands, the three grounds.

original: steng dang 'og tu 'khor bar byed pa lag pas bzung ba'i 'khrul shing la ni bu mo rnams kyis bsten //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu 'khor bar byed pa lag pas bzung ba'i 'khrul shing la ni bu mo rnams kyis bsten //
translated: The girls are supported on the turning-pole held by the hands, moving above and below.üîΩThe inner and outer, above and below, are the eight directions, crooked.

original: nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du sod cing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams; ;steng dang 'og tu sbub sa ni 'khyog por 'gyur te kun nas sbubs kyi rnam pa dag gis 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol dag tu gnas pa 'og dang steng du sod cing phyogs brgyad du ni 'khyog pa rnams; ;steng dang 'og tu sbub sa ni 'khyog por 'gyur te kun nas sbubs kyi rnam pa dag gis 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: The upper and lower holes are crooked, the machine with the form of a complete cavity.

original: sbubs kyi rtse mor bum ba'i gzugs la bu ga pa yang ni sbubs kyi bug pa dag gi tshad du 'gyur //
analyzed: sbubs kyi rtse mor bum ba'i gzugs la bu ga pa yang ni sbubs kyi bug pa dag gi tshad du 'gyur //
translated: On the tip of the cavity, the form of a vase, the hole is also the size of the cavity-hole.

original: chu ni 'dren par byed cing drangs pa'i chu ni btang bar gyur pa dag kyang bum pa'i bu gnas //
analyzed: chu ni 'dren par byed cing drangs pa'i chu ni btang bar gyur pa dag kyang bum pa'i bu gnas //
translated: The water is drawn up by the water-carrying vessels, and the water that is drawn up is let out through the openings of the vessels.

original: skyed mos tshal dang ldum ra dag gi mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang ldum ra dag gi mnyam pa'i sa la gang du drangs pa der ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: The water goes to the place where it is drawn up, to the even ground of the gardens and parks.

original: rab mchog sa gzhi dag la gdug pa can rnams bsgrub pa'i don dang chos dang ldan pa rgyal don du //
analyzed: rab mchog sa gzhi dag la gdug pa can rnams bsgrub pa'i don dang chos dang ldan pa rgyal don du //
translated: On the best of grounds, the wicked are established for the sake of punishment, the righteous for the sake of kingship.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang la thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas su ni srid gsum bla mas zla ba bzang la thams cad sngon du gsungs pa gang //
translated: The first Buddha, the Guru of the three worlds, has said everything in the SukhƒÅvatƒ´vy≈´ha.

original: de yi nang nas cung zad tsam zhig 'dir ni de ring yul 'dir khyod la bdag gis gsal bar bstan //
analyzed: de yi nang nas cung zad tsam zhig 'dir ni de ring yul 'dir khyod la bdag gis gsal bar bstan //
translated: Of that, a mere fraction has been clarified by me today for you in this country.

original: zang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye //
analyzed: zang gnas bsrung ba'i don du 'di dag mtha' dag gyis shig zhe sdang chags pas min no nyi ma kye //
translated: For the sake of protecting the people, you must do all of this, O Sun, not out of hatred or attachment.

original: chang dang lan tshva'i chu gter dbus su thub ba sa yi dkyil 'khor la ni las sa @51b yang dag gnas //
analyzed: chang dang lan tshva'i chu gter dbus su thub ba sa yi dkyil 'khor la ni las sa @51b yang dag gnas //
translated: In the middle of the ocean of liquor and salt water, the sage is on the surface of the earth, and karma is well-established.

original: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la nyi ma'i dum bu rnams su mi yi bdag po rim pas 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum phrag gsum la nyi ma'i dum bu rnams su mi yi bdag po rim pas 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: The sun moves in succession over the three hundred thousand leagues of the sectors.

original: dum bu gcig la dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga ste nor 'dab ma dag dang bcas pa 'o //
analyzed: dum bu gcig la dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu lnga ste nor 'dab ma dag dang bcas pa 'o //
translated: One sector is twenty-five thousand leagues, together with the petals.

original: de yi dbus na kee la sha ste mchog gi gangs ri yis ni phyogs rnams kun tu bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de yi dbus na kee la sha ste mchog gi gangs ri yis ni phyogs rnams kun tu bskor ba'o //
translated: In the middle of that is Kailash, the supreme snow mountain, which surrounds all directions.

original: sa la kee la sha yi dum bu gangs kyi ri dang bcas pa de ni kun nas sum cha ste //
analyzed: sa la kee la sha yi dum bu gangs kyi ri dang bcas pa de ni kun nas sum cha ste //
translated: The sector of Kailash on the earth, together with the snow mountain, is one third.

original: phyi rol du ni 'dab ma re re dag kyang nyin byed yul dang gling gi yul rnams dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'dab ma re re dag kyang nyin byed yul dang gling gi yul rnams dag gis brgyan //
translated: Outside, each petal is adorned with the land of the sun and the land of the continents.

original: g-yas kyi phyed na shambha lar grags thub mchog gi gnas grong ni bye ba lhag par gnas pa ste //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyed na shambha lar grags thub mchog gi gnas grong ni bye ba lhag par gnas pa ste //
translated: To the right half is the land of Shambhala, known as the abode of the supreme sages, with more than ten million towns.

original: bye ba'i grong gis nges par bcings pa yul du 'gyur te rgyal khams grong ni 'bum phrag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bye ba'i grong gis nges par bcings pa yul du 'gyur te rgyal khams grong ni 'bum phrag rnams kyis so //
translated: A land is defined by ten million towns, and a kingdom by one hundred thousand towns.

original: gcig gnyis gsum dang chu gter dbye ba mnga' ro thub pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs dbye ba yis //üîΩphye ba mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa gzhi dag la 'khro te rnam shes ldan pas btsal bar bya //üîΩ'khor lo can dang phyed can dum bu can ni yul gyi mi pa dag phyag rgya'i lag ni de las gzhan //üîΩphyi rol tu ni dus kyi dbye ba nges par 'gyur te ji ltar 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig gnyis gsum dang chu gter dbye ba mnga' ro thub pa lnga dang 'jig rten la sogs dbye ba yis // phye ba mi dbang 'khor lo can ni sa gzhi dag la 'khro te rnam shes ldan pas btsal bar bya // 'khor lo can dang phyed can dum bu can ni yul gyi mi pa dag phyag rgya'i lag ni de las gzhan // phyi rol tu ni dus kyi dbye ba nges par 'gyur te ji ltar 'jig rten mgon gyi de bzhin no //
translated: The five Buddhas, the three, the two, the four oceans, the five continents, the seven worlds, and so on,üîΩare the divisions of the wheel-holders, the lords of the earth, who are to be sought by the wise.üîΩThe wheel-holders, the half-holders, and the quarter-holders are the lords of the people of the country, whose hands are marked with the wheel and so on.üîΩThe divisions of time are determined externally, just as they are for the lords of the world.

original: 'od zer bdun dang ri gza' thub rnams 'dir ni de bzhin snying stobs ldan pa lha yi skye gnas te //üîΩnya dang rus sbal phag pa mi yi seng+ge dang bcas mi 'u thung dang dza' med aagni dang // r'a ma nag po de ltar brgyad ni lha min rigs la @52a *//üîΩ'jigs ster rdul gyi 'byung bo'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: 'od zer bdun dang ri gza' thub rnams 'dir ni de bzhin snying stobs ldan pa lha yi skye gnas te //üîΩnya dang rus sbal phag pa mi yi seng+ge dang bcas mi 'u thung dang dza' med aagni dang // r'a ma nag po de ltar brgyad ni lha min rigs la @52a *//üîΩ'jigs ster rdul gyi 'byung bo'i skye gnas so //

translated: At the end of the thirty-two seats, the powerful asura with a life span of one hundred years is in the hand of the wheel.

original: a'a dra aa no gha dang phag ldan lha min lag 'gro'i rigs la mun pa can ni gzhan yang lnga //
analyzed: a'a dra aa no gha dang phag ldan lha min lag 'gro'i rigs la mun pa can ni gzhan yang lnga //

analyzed: byi ba dbang po gos dkar can dang sbrang rtsi'i blo gros 'joms byed brgyad pa gang de mun pa can //
translated: The mouse, Indra, Shveta, Madhu, Mati, and the eighth one, Jhinmukha, are the dark ones.

original: gsal bar ma kha'i yul gyi b'a ga da sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag skyes pa ste //
analyzed: gsal bar ma kha'i yul gyi b'a ga da sogs grong khyer du ni bdun pa yang dag skyes pa ste //
translated: The seventh one, Samyaksambuddha, was born in the city of VƒÅgƒÅ·∏ça, etc., in the country of MƒÅhi.

original: gang du 'jig rten lha min yan lag stobs dang ldan par gnas shing brtse ba med pa kla klo'i gzugs //
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten lha min yan lag stobs dang ldan par gnas shing brtse ba med pa kla klo'i gzugs //
translated: Where the asura of the world, Bala, dwells with a powerful limb, merciless, in the form of a barbarian.

original: rnga mo rta dang ba lang gsad nas khrag dang bcas pa'i sha ni cung zad btsos pa 'ba' zhig dang // ba lang sha dang dngul chu chu dang mar dang tsha ba mnyam pa 'bras dang lo ma bsres pa ni //

translated: Having killed a camel, a horse, and a bull, only a little meat with blood is cooked, and the meat of a bull, mercury, water, ghee, and salt are equal, mixed with rice and leaves.

original: gcig tu me la btsos pa nags kyi 'bras bu dag dang bcas pa gang du mi rnams ngag gi zas //
analyzed: gcig tu me la btsos pa nags kyi 'bras bu dag dang bcas pa gang du mi rnams ngag gi zas //
translated: In one place, the fruits of the forest, which are cooked in the fire and eaten by men,

original: btung ba bya rnams dag gi sgo ngar 'gyur ro mi yi bdag po de ni lha min rnams kyi gnas //
analyzed: btung ba bya rnams dag gi sgo ngar 'gyur ro mi yi bdag po de ni lha min rnams kyi gnas //
translated: are the eggs of birds for the demigods, O Lord of men.

original: thig le nus ma mig sman dag dang mkha' lding lha yi chu bo mi spyin dang ni 'dod 'jo dang // rdzong dang glog dang rig pa bzang po 'gyur med mchog gi cha dang lha yi skad dang lus med de //
analyzed: thig le nus ma mig sman dag dang mkha' lding lha yi chu bo mi spyin dang ni 'dod 'jo dang // rdzong dang glog dang rig pa bzang po 'gyur med mchog gi cha dang lha yi skad dang lus med de //
translated: The drops, the powerful ones, the eye ointment, the garu·∏ças, the divine rivers, the non-giver, the wish-fulfiller, the fortress, the lightning, the excellent knowledge, the unchanging, the supreme part, the divine language, the bodiless one,

original: yang dag rgyu ba'i gzugs 'di rnams kyis sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro rgyal ba yi ni ye shes sku //
analyzed: yang dag rgyu ba'i gzugs 'di rnams kyis sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro rgyal ba yi ni ye shes sku //
translated: these forms of perfect movement, by these, one enters the stage of the wisdom body of the Victorious Ones.

original: byung bar gyur dang byung dang 'byung 'gyur rig byed @52b rtog /
analyzed: byung bar gyur dang byung dang 'byung 'gyur rig byed @52b rtog /
translated: The past, present, and future are to be known through the Vedas and so forth.

original: ge la sogs bstan bcos mtha' dag rab smra //
analyzed: ge la sogs bstan bcos mtha' dag rab smra //
translated: All the treatises beginning with grammar are well-spoken.

original: dpal ldan rgyal po nyi ma 'ga' zhig dag gis shambha la zhes rab tu grags pa'i ka l'a pa //
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyal po nyi ma 'ga' zhig dag gis shambha la zhes rab tu grags pa'i ka l'a pa //
translated: The glorious king S≈´rya, for some time, was known as the KƒÅlapa of ≈öambhala.

original: phyogs bzhi dag ni ri yis bskor zheng mnga' yis bsgyur ba brgya yi dpag tshad rnams kyi tshad du ni //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi dag ni ri yis bskor zheng mnga' yis bsgyur ba brgya yi dpag tshad rnams kyi tshad du ni //
translated: The four sides are surrounded by mountains, and its breadth is one hundred yojanas.

original: lha yi dbang po rab mchog mi yi bdag por bzhag nas khyod ni rang gi gnas su 'gro bar gyis //
analyzed: lha yi dbang po rab mchog mi yi bdag por bzhag nas khyod ni rang gi gnas su 'gro bar gyis //
translated: Having placed the lord of the gods, the supreme one, as the king of men, you should go to your own abode.

original: dpal ldan sh'akya'i rigs la rab gsal mi yi bdag po bdun te brgyad pa dpal ldan grags pa yang //
analyzed: dpal ldan sh'akya'i rigs la rab gsal mi yi bdag po bdun te brgyad pa dpal ldan grags pa yang //
translated: There are seven glorious Shakya kings, and the eighth is the glorious Yashovarman.

original: 'di ni dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje lha yi mchog gis btung pa rdo rje'i rigs kyi rigs ldan te //
analyzed: 'di ni dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje lha yi mchog gis btung pa rdo rje'i rigs kyi rigs ldan te //
translated: This one is the son of the supreme god Shri Ma√±juvajra, born in the Vajra family.

original: rdo rje'i dbang bskur byin nas mtha' dag thub pa'i rigs rnams dag ni rigs gcig dag tu byed bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang bskur byin nas mtha' dag thub pa'i rigs rnams dag ni rigs gcig dag tu byed bar 'gyur //
translated: Having given the Vajra empowerment, he will make all the Shakya families into one family.

original: yang dag theg par mngon 'jeg lha min rigs la 'jigs ster dpal ldan grags pa phyag na mdung thung can //
analyzed: yang dag theg par mngon 'jeg lha min rigs la 'jigs ster dpal ldan grags pa phyag na mdung thung can //
translated: Approaching the true vehicle, terrifying the asura families, the glorious Yashovarman with the spear in his hand,

original: sems can rnams kyi thar ba'i slar dus la dus kyi 'khor lo rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi thar ba'i slar dus la dus kyi 'khor lo rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur //
translated: will clearly manifest as the Kalachakra for the sake of the liberation of sentient beings.

original: de yi dbus su gdan ni nyi shu rtsa lnga rim par yongs su bgrangs pa dag gi dus kyi mthar //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gdan ni nyi shu rtsa lnga rim par yongs su bgrangs pa dag gi dus kyi mthar //
translated: In the middle of that, the seats are enumerated in order, twenty-five in number, at the end of time.

original: rigs ldan rigs la lha yi dbang po lha yi mchog gis btung pa drag po'i rigs ldan 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs ldan rigs la lha yi dbang po lha yi mchog gis btung pa drag po'i rigs ldan 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The K·π£atriya of the K·π£atriya class, the king of kings, the supreme god, the K·π£atriya of the Rudra class will arise.

original: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs te bde ster zhes pa de bzhin kla klo'i rigs la mthar byed nyid //
analyzed: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs te bde ster zhes pa de bzhin kla klo'i rigs la mthar byed nyid //
translated: For the good, he is of peaceful form; for the givers of happiness, he is called TathƒÅgata. For the barbarian class, he is the destroyer.

original: rdo yi rta bcibs 'khor lo can ni phyag na mdung thung mtha' dag dgra la snun byed nyi ma'i gzi //
analyzed: rdo yi rta bcibs 'khor lo can ni phyag na mdung thung mtha' dag dgra la snun byed nyi ma'i gzi //
translated: Mounted on a stone horse, having a discus, a spear in his hand, he will strike all enemies. He is the sun.

original: @53a *// rigs ldan rigs kyi dbus su lag pas bsgyur ba'i dus kyi bu dang tsha bo dag ni 'das gyur ba //
analyzed: @53a *// rigs ldan rigs kyi dbus su lag pas bsgyur ba'i dus kyi bu dang tsha bo dag ni 'das gyur ba //
translated: In the middle of the K·π£atriya class, the sons and grandsons of the age of the hand will have passed.

original: de yi dus su nges par ma mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dus su nges par ma mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: At that time, the religion of the barbarians will certainly spread in the land of the sky.

original: ji snyed kla klo'i dbang po gdug pa ji snyed lha yi mchog gis btud pa drag po'i rigs ldan yang //
analyzed: ji snyed kla klo'i dbang po gdug pa ji snyed lha yi mchog gis btud pa drag po'i rigs ldan yang //
translated: As long as the barbarian kings are fierce, as long as they bow to the supreme god, the K·π£atriya of the Rudra class

original: de yi dus su gnyis po dag kyang sa yi steng gi gnas su 'khrug pa drag po 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dus su gnyis po dag kyang sa yi steng gi gnas su 'khrug pa drag po 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: At that time, the two kings will wage a terrible war on earth.

original: g-yul du kla klo dag la snun byed mtha' dag sa yi steng du rang gi dbung ni yan lag bzhi //
analyzed: g-yul du kla klo dag la snun byed mtha' dag sa yi steng du rang gi dbung ni yan lag bzhi //
translated: In the battle, the barbarians will be destroyed on earth by all the troops of the king.

original: dus mthar kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong nas 'khor los bsgyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus mthar kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong nas 'khor los bsgyur ba 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: At the end of the age, a universal monarch will appear from the city of Kailash, the abode of the gods.

original: drag po phung po tshogs kyi dbang po 'phrog byed dag kyang rigs ldan la ni grogs dag sbyin 'gyur te //
analyzed: drag po phung po tshogs kyi dbang po 'phrog byed dag kyang rigs ldan la ni grogs dag sbyin 'gyur te //
translated: Even the powerful lord of the Rudras will give assistance to the universal monarch,

original: rdo rta glang po'i dbang po gser gyi shing rta mi bdag phyag na mtshon ldan dpa' bo rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rta glang po'i dbang po gser gyi shing rta mi bdag phyag na mtshon ldan dpa' bo rnams kyang ngo //
translated: with his horse, elephant, golden chariot, and brave men with weapons in their hands.

original: rdo yi rta ni rlung gi shugs /
analyzed: rdo yi rta ni rlung gi shugs /
translated: The horse of stone will be swift as the wind,

original: can gyis bsgyur yon tan bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: can gyis bsgyur yon tan bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa //
translated: with various colors and qualities.

original: chang gis dregs pa'i glang chen rig byed ces pa'i 'bum phrag grangs dang shing rta 'bum phrag 'byung ba dang // aa kshoo hi n'i drug dang mi yi dbang po cod pan bcings pa'i rigs ni ro dang dgu bcu ste //
analyzed: chang gis dregs pa'i glang chen rig byed ces pa'i 'bum phrag grangs dang shing rta 'bum phrag 'byung ba dang // aa kshoo hi n'i drug dang mi yi dbang po cod pan bcings pa'i rigs ni ro dang dgu bcu ste //
translated: The six Akshauhinis, and the king with the diadem bound, will be the nine and ninety (kings) of the race of Raghu.

original: rig ldan khyab 'jug 'phrog byed dag dang bcas pa sde 'di dag gis kla klo brlag par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rig ldan khyab 'jug 'phrog byed dag dang bcas pa sde 'di dag gis kla klo brlag par byed par 'gyur //
translated: These armies, the wise, Vishnu, and the robbers, will destroy the barbarians.

original: mchog tu tsha ba'i dpa' bo rnams kyi kla klo'i @53b tshogs la bsnun bya glang po'i dbang pos glang po la //
analyzed: mchog tu tsha ba'i dpa' bo rnams kyi kla klo'i @53b tshogs la bsnun bya glang po'i dbang pos glang po la //
translated: The foremost of heroes will strike the host of barbarians with an elephant, the lord of elephants, with a stone horse, horses,

original: rdo yi rta yis rta rnams la ste mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du sa skyong rnams kyis sa skyong la //
analyzed: rdo yi rta yis rta rnams la ste mnyam dang mi mnyam g-yul du sa skyong rnams kyis sa skyong la //
translated: and kings, kings, in a battle, even and uneven.

original: rta la gnas pa zla ba chen po'i bu ni nya nu m'antha rnon po'i mtshon gyis bsnun par 'gyur //
analyzed: rta la gnas pa zla ba chen po'i bu ni nya nu m'antha rnon po'i mtshon gyis bsnun par 'gyur //
translated: The son of Mahendraka, mounted on a horse, will be struck by the sharp weapon of the fish, Manthara.

original: drag po kla klo'i dbang mgon mtha' dag lha min bdag bo byis pa'i blo la drag po'i rigs ldan gyis //
analyzed: drag po kla klo'i dbang mgon mtha' dag lha min bdag bo byis pa'i blo la drag po'i rigs ldan gyis //
translated: The lord of the barbarians, the king of the barbarians, all the lords of the barbarians, the lord of the demons, the child-minded, the fierce, the powerful,

original: dpung ni thams cad dag gis g-yul du kla klo bcom nas khyab 'jug drag po dang bcas rigs ldan ni //
analyzed: dpung ni thams cad dag gis g-yul du kla klo bcom nas khyab 'jug drag po dang bcas rigs ldan ni //
translated: Then, after the Mlecchas have been destroyed in battle by all the troops, Vishnu, together with Rudra, will go to

original: kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong khyer gang du 'khor lo can dag gnas par 'gro //
analyzed: kee la sha yi ri bo lha yis bkod pa'i grong khyer gang du 'khor lo can dag gnas par 'gro //
translated: the city of Kailash, the abode of the gods, where the Cakravartins reside.

original: de yi dus su 'dzin ma dag la mtha' dag skye bo'i rigs ni chos dang 'dod pa nor rnams rdzogs //
analyzed: de yi dus su 'dzin ma dag la mtha' dag skye bo'i rigs ni chos dang 'dod pa nor rnams rdzogs //
translated: At that time, the entire human race will be perfected in dharma, desire, and wealth.

original: 'bru rnams dgon par skye ba dang ni shing rnams 'bras bu brtan pos dud pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bru rnams dgon par skye ba dang ni shing rnams 'bras bu brtan pos dud pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The crops will grow in the wilderness, and the trees will be laden with fruit.

original: kla klo'i tshogs ni 'khor gyi skye bo dang bcas rab tu bcad nas mi yi lo ni brgya byed na /
analyzed: kla klo'i tshogs ni 'khor gyi skye bo dang bcas rab tu bcad nas mi yi lo ni brgya byed na /
translated: After a hundred human years, the hordes of Mlecchas, together with their retinues, will be completely destroyed.

original: rigs ldan grub par 'gyur te lha yis bkod pa'i pho brang mtho ba kee la sha yi rgyab tu 'o //
analyzed: rigs ldan grub par 'gyur te lha yis bkod pa'i pho brang mtho ba kee la sha yi rgyab tu 'o //
translated: The Cakravartins will be victorious, and will go to the high palace of the gods on the back of Kailash.

original: lha dang mi yi bla ma'i sras ni tshongs pa lha yi dbang po zung gi chos la 'byung ba dag /
analyzed: lha dang mi yi bla ma'i sras ni tshongs pa lha yi dbang po zung gi chos la 'byung ba dag /
translated: The sons of the divine and human gurus, the two lords of the gods, will appear in the Dharma.

original: tshangs pa rgyab tu dum bu gcig la mi yi bdag por 'gyur te sa kun la ni lha yi dbang //
analyzed: tshangs pa rgyab tu dum bu gcig la mi yi bdag por 'gyur te sa kun la ni lha yi dbang //
translated: In the part of the world behind BrahmƒÅ, there will be a king, a lord of men, who will rule over the whole earth.

original: rdzogs ldan mtshams su kla klo'i chos rnams mtha' drag srid pa gsum gyi bla ma dag gis bcad byas te //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan mtshams su kla klo'i chos rnams mtha' drag srid pa gsum gyi bla ma dag gis bcad byas te //
translated: At the end of the perfect age, the barbarian will be destroyed by the guru of the three worlds.

original: bcad nas lo ni brgyad brgya rnams su tshangs pa bzhag pa mdzad nas bde ba'i gnas su 'og bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bcad nas lo ni brgyad brgya rnams su tshangs pa bzhag pa mdzad nas bde ba'i gnas su 'og bar 'gyur //
translated: Having destroyed him, he will establish BrahmƒÅ for eight hundred years and will then go to a happy state.

original: @54a *// slar yang de nyid dbus su mi yid bdag po sras rnams dag gi rigs kyi dbye ba dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: @54a *// slar yang de nyid dbus su mi yid bdag po sras rnams dag gi rigs kyi dbye ba dag tu 'gyur //
translated: Again, in the middle of the world, there will be a lord of men, a son of the family.

original: de rnams dbus su lha min dbang po mi bdag thub pa rnams ni phal pa gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnams dbus su lha min dbang po mi bdag thub pa rnams ni phal pa gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: In the middle of them, there will be a lord of the demigods, a lord of men, and other sages.

original: kla klo rnams ni gzhom pa'i sla du lha yi bdag po dbang po bcu gnyis dag dang ldan par 'gro //
analyzed: kla klo rnams ni gzhom pa'i sla du lha yi bdag po dbang po bcu gnyis dag dang ldan par 'gro //
translated: In order to destroy the barbarians, the lord of the gods, Indra, will come with his twelve companions.

original: dum bu dum bu dag tu kla klo'i chos ni bcom nas 'khor lo can yang bde ba'i gnas su 'gro //
analyzed: dum bu dum bu dag tu kla klo'i chos ni bcom nas 'khor lo can yang bde ba'i gnas su 'gro //
translated: Having destroyed the barbarian religion piece by piece, the Cakravartin will also go to a happy state.

original: skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma'i sras ni tshangs dang lha yi dbang po rgyab dang mdun du ste //
analyzed: skabs gsum pa dang mi yi bla ma'i sras ni tshangs dang lha yi dbang po rgyab dang mdun du ste //
translated: The son of the Guru of men, in the third age, will be Brahma, the Lord of the gods, behind and in front.

original: rgyab tu tshangs pa la sogs rigs rnams rnam pa sna tshogs sa yi steng du dbye ba du mar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyab tu tshangs pa la sogs rigs rnams rnam pa sna tshogs sa yi steng du dbye ba du mar 'gyur //
translated: Behind, Brahma and the other castes will be divided into many kinds on the earth.

original: tshangs pa sogs la mi rnams lo ni brgya phrag bco brgyad dang ldan 'di dag mi rnams dag gi tshe //
analyzed: tshangs pa sogs la mi rnams lo ni brgya phrag bco brgyad dang ldan 'di dag mi rnams dag gi tshe //
translated: The life of men will be one thousand and eight hundred years, and the life of Brahma and the others will be

original: de yi phyed ni 'od srung gi 'o rab mchog sa yi steng du dpal ldan mi yi seng+ge'i phyed //üîΩdrug cus dman pa de bzhin nyid du dus bzhi so so'i dus su mi thung sogs la 'phrog byed kyi //
analyzed: de yi phyed ni 'od srung gi 'o rab mchog sa yi steng du dpal ldan mi yi seng+ge'i phyed // drug cus dman pa de bzhin nyid du dus bzhi so so'i dus su mi thung sogs la 'phrog byed kyi //
translated: half of that, five hundred and forty years. The life of the glorious Lion of Men on earth will be half of that,üîΩtwo hundred and seventy years. In the same way, the life of the kings of the Kali age will decrease by sixty

original: rigs ldan mthar ni ji srid brgya phrag gcig gi lo yi grangs kyi skye bo'i tshe ru rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs ldan mthar ni ji srid brgya phrag gcig gi lo yi grangs kyi skye bo'i tshe ru rab tu 'gyur //
translated: years every four ages, until finally the life of the kings will be ten years.

original: de ltar dum bu thams cad du yang dus bzhi'i dus su kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: de ltar dum bu thams cad du yang dus bzhi'i dus su kla klo'i chos ni rab tu 'jug pa ste //
translated: Thus, in all the sectors, the religion of the barbarians will spread in the four ages.

original: lo ni brgyad dang brgya phrag gcig tu nges par gnas te de nas kla klo'i chos ni nyams pa 'o //
analyzed: lo ni brgyad dang brgya phrag gcig tu nges par gnas te de nas kla klo'i chos ni nyams pa 'o //
translated: The period of the barbarians will last for one hundred and eight years, and then the barbarian religion will decline.

original: de nas lo ni stong phrag nyi shu lag pa brgya dang bral ba sangs rgyas chos ni rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: de nas lo ni stong phrag nyi shu lag pa brgya dang bral ba sangs rgyas chos ni rab tu 'jug /
translated: Then, for twenty thousand years, the religion of the Buddha will spread, free from the hundred hands.

original: @54b rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan rtsod pa'i dus ni nus pa'i tshad kyis sa gzhi dag la des par rgyu //
analyzed: @54b rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan rtsod pa'i dus ni nus pa'i tshad kyis sa gzhi dag la des par rgyu //
translated: The period of the four yugas, the three yugas, the two yugas, and the period of strife, are determined by the measure of the power of the earth.

original: 'jig rten khams ni bskyed pa dag dang gza' yi rgyu ba mnyam pa 'khor lo ni 'byung ba dang // klo klo rnams kyi chos ni nyams shing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas la rigs ldan gyis ni lam sbyin pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni bskyed pa dag dang gza' yi rgyu ba mnyam pa 'khor lo ni 'byung ba dang // klo klo rnams kyi chos ni nyams shing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas la rigs ldan gyis ni lam sbyin pa //
translated: The creation of the world, the equal motion of the planets, the appearance of the cakravartins, the decline of the barbarian religion, and the bestowal of the path by the k·π£atriyas in the abode of supreme bliss‚Äî

original: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis khyod la don ni ji bzhin bshad do zla ba bzang po dus gsum las //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad bdag gis khyod la don ni ji bzhin bshad do zla ba bzang po dus gsum las //
translated: all this I have explained to you, O Candrabhadra, according to the meaning of the three times.

original: slar yang khyod ni skye bo kun la phan pa'i don dang thar pa'i slad du bdag la ci zhig 'dri //
analyzed: slar yang khyod ni skye bo kun la phan pa'i don dang thar pa'i slad du bdag la ci zhig 'dri //
translated: Again, what do you ask of me for the sake of the welfare of all beings and for the sake of liberation?‚Äù

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal rus kyi 'khor lo las /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal rus kyi 'khor lo las /
translated: From the glorious Great Original Buddha, the glorious Wheel of Bone was extracted.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par bkod pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par bkod pa'i le'u ste dang po'o ////
translated: This is the first chapter on the arrangement of the world systems.

original: ming shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa dag kyang bdag gis te //
analyzed: ming shes sna tshogs tshad ni gang dag rgyal ba skyed mdzad khyod kyis bstan pa dag kyang bdag gis te //
translated: I have also heard the various measurements of the names that you, the Victorious One, have taught,

original: slar yang bdag ni mnyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi bdus su ji ltar lags //
analyzed: slar yang bdag ni mnyan par 'tshal lo srid pa gsum po mtha' dag lus kyi bdus su ji ltar lags //
translated: and I wish to hear again: How is the entire triple world contained within the body?

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas legs zhes bya ba byin nas rab gsungs pa //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Sugata gave his approval and taught:

original: sems can rnams ni thar ba'i slad du mchog gi thugs rje sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la 'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni thar ba'i slad du mchog gi thugs rje sna tshogs tshad rnams dag kyang lus la 'o //
translated: For the sake of liberating sentient beings, the various measurements of supreme compassion are also contained within the body.

original: sa dang chu me rlung dang rdo rje lha yi gzhu dang rlung rnams dang ni khyim gyi 'khor lo dang // zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan lhun po gdengs can mi dang lha yi gnas dang 'khyog po skar mar bcas //üîΩ'pho ba zla ba dag dang phyogs dang nyin @55a *//
analyzed: sa dang chu me rlung dang rdo rje lha yi gzhu dang rlung rnams dang ni khyim gyi 'khor lo dang // zla ba nyi ma sgra gcan lhun po gdengs can mi dang lha yi gnas dang 'khyog po skar mar bcas // 'pho ba zla ba dag dang phyogs dang nyin @55a *//
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, the divine bow of Indra, the wind, the wheel of the houses, the moon, the sun, RƒÅhu, Meru, the serpent, the human and divine abodes, the crooked, together with the stars,

original: dang mtshan mo tshes rnams mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ni //
analyzed: dang mtshan mo tshes rnams mtha' dag lus kyi dbus su ni //
translated: the transits, the lunar days, the directions, the days and nights, the lunar mansions, all in the middle of the body,

original: rang rang yi ges shes bya rnams gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong ba'i dbye lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rang rang yi ges shes bya rnams gsum khyab bdag bgrod pa rnal 'byor pa yis stong ba'i dbye lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur ba ste //
translated: are to be known by their respective syllables. The yogi/nƒ´, the lord of the three, should know that this body is pervaded by the aggregate of elements, which arise from eating and drinking the six tastes in their entirety.

original: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams la 'o //
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams la 'o //
translated: The six tastes are from the elements, and the aggregate of the manifest elements is in the space element.

original: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
translated: In emptiness, the wisdom of the union of the six tastes becomes the unchanging, permanent state.

original: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba rnams gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rig par bya //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba rnams gsum srid pa la gnas rang gi lus la rig par bya //
translated: Thus, the three elements earth, water, and fire are present in the body.

original: sa bon padmar gnas pa dag ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te de las chu yis sdud do phyi nas ni //
analyzed: sa bon padmar gnas pa dag ni 'dzin mas 'dzin te de las chu yis sdud do phyi nas ni //
translated: The seed is held by the womb, and is nourished by water.

original: ma yis smin par byed cing ro dang ro ni za bar byed de 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis so //
analyzed: ma yis smin par byed cing ro dang ro ni za bar byed de 'di yi 'phel ba rlung gis so //
translated: The mother ripens it, and it eats food and drink. It grows by the wind.

original: nam mkha' dag kyang 'phel ba'i go skabs sbyin byed mi yi ba dag po dus las de ltar grub pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' dag kyang 'phel ba'i go skabs sbyin byed mi yi ba dag po dus las de ltar grub pa ste //
translated: Space gives it room to grow. Thus it is formed from the elements.

original: btsa' bar gyur pa'i dus dang byis pa la sogs dus dag tu yang lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do //
analyzed: btsa' bar gyur pa'i dus dang byis pa la sogs dus dag tu yang lha yi gnas skabs rnams byed do //
translated: In the time of birth, and in the time of childhood, and so on, it experiences the states of a god.

original: sa bon dag gi sa ni gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid byed chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid //
analyzed: sa bon dag gi sa ni gsal bar lci zhing sra ba nyid byed chu ni de bzhin gsher ba nyid //
translated: The earth element of the seed makes it manifest, heavy, and solid. Water makes it moist.

original: me ni smin par byed cing rab mchog rnam pa bcu yi rlung rnams dag ni 'di yis 'phel ba 'o //
analyzed: me ni smin par byed cing rab mchog rnam pa bcu yi rlung rnams dag ni 'di yis 'phel ba 'o //
translated: Fire ripens it. The ten winds make it grow.

original: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: 'phel ba dag la slar yang nam mkha' nyid ni go skabs sbyin byed dus las de ltar bskyed pa ste //
translated: Again, in the increase, space itself gives way, and thus it is generated from time.

original: sna tshogs @55b dngos po du ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang nus pa rnams ni spro bar byed //
analyzed: sna tshogs @55b dngos po du ma dag gis lus bcas sgra dang yid dang nus pa rnams ni spro bar byed //
translated: With many things, the body is formed, and sound, mind, and potential are expanded.

original: gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang rtsa lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon srog dang bcas pa dag /
analyzed: gsang ba'i padmar khrag gi nang du gang rtsa lhung ba'i byang chub sa bon srog dang bcas pa dag /
translated: In the secret lotus, in the blood, the seed of enlightenment, along with the life force, falls into the channel.

original: nya dang rus sbal phag par 'gyur te mi yi seng+ge mi thung r'a ma r'a ma dag dang ni //
analyzed: nya dang rus sbal phag par 'gyur te mi yi seng+ge mi thung r'a ma r'a ma dag dang ni //
translated: It becomes a fish, a tortoise, a pig, a human lion, a dwarf, a ram, a ram,

original: nag po sangs rgyas mi dbang rnam bcur 'gyur te 'di dag rnams kyang gnas skabs rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: nag po sangs rgyas mi dbang rnam bcur 'gyur te 'di dag rnams kyang gnas skabs rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: a black one, a buddha, and a lord of men. These are the ten states.

original: mngal du gsum ste de bzhin btsa' ba'i dus su gcig dang byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: mngal du gsum ste de bzhin btsa' ba'i dus su gcig dang byis pa'i dus dag tu yang rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Three in the womb, one at the time of birth, and two in childhood,

original: gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan du rab tu 'gyur te rgyas pa gcig dang yang dag de bzhin gcig /
analyzed: gzhon nu lang tsho dag la gzhan du rab tu 'gyur te rgyas pa gcig dang yang dag de bzhin gcig /
translated: another in youth and adolescence, one in full maturity, and one in old age.

original: rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni mtha' ma 'o //
analyzed: rgan po nyid la zhi ba gcig ste mngal skyes rnams kyi srid pa 'chi ba nyid ni mtha' ma 'o //
translated: For the old man, there is only peace. For those born from a womb, death is the end.

original: nya la nya yi rnam par 'gyur ba nyin zhag 'ga' ste rus sbal la ni rus sbal dngos po yang //
analyzed: nya la nya yi rnam par 'gyur ba nyin zhag 'ga' ste rus sbal la ni rus sbal dngos po yang //
translated: For a fish, it is a few days in the form of a fish. For a tortoise, it is in the form of a tortoise.

original: phag pa la yang de yi skye mched nyi ma 'byung ste mi yi seng+ge la ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: phag pa la yang de yi skye mched nyi ma 'byung ste mi yi seng+ge la ni rab tu skye //
translated: For a pig, it is in the form of a pig. For a human lion, it is in the form of a human.

original: mi thung la ni byis ba'i dngos po r'a ma la yang mi bdag gnyis kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi thung la ni byis ba'i dngos po r'a ma la yang mi bdag gnyis kyi so rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: For a dwarf, it is in the form of a child. For Rama, it is in the form of two kings.

original: slar yang r'a ma la ni lhung bar 'gyur te de nyid nag po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed //
analyzed: slar yang r'a ma la ni lhung bar 'gyur te de nyid nag po la ni gsal bar sgyu dag byed //
translated: Again, for Rama, it is in the form of a fall. For Krishna, it is in the form of clear illusions.

original: sangs rgyas la yang zhi ba dang ni brtul zhugs nges pa byed de rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la yang zhi ba dang ni brtul zhugs nges pa byed de rigs ldan la ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: For Buddha, it is in the form of peace and definite spiritual practice. For Arjuna, it is in the form of death.

original: khu ba las ni rkang dang rus pa rgyus par 'gyur te rdul las bags pa khrag dang sha nyid do //
analyzed: khu ba las ni rkang dang rus pa rgyus par 'gyur te rdul las bags pa khrag dang sha nyid do //
translated: From semen, bones, marrow, and ligaments arise. From ovum, skin, blood, and flesh arise.

original: mngal gyi nang du zla ba gcig ni khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi'i ror gyur rab tu skye ba ste //
analyzed: mngal gyi nang du zla ba gcig ni khrag dang sa bon bdud rtsi'i ror gyur rab tu skye ba ste //
translated: In the womb, for one month, the embryo is nourished by blood and the seed transformed into nectar.

original: phyi nas sa bon myu gu rang gi snying @56a *//
analyzed: phyi nas sa bon myu gu rang gi snying @56a *//
translated: Then, in the heart, the seed sprouts,

original: gar rnam pa bcu yi rtsa ni shin tu phra ba'o //
analyzed: gar rnam pa bcu yi rtsa ni shin tu phra ba'o //
translated: with ten very subtle channels.

original: lte ba la yang brgyad pa brgyad ni gzhan te rkang lag gdong rnams la ni gyen du skyod par byed //
analyzed: lte ba la yang brgyad pa brgyad ni gzhan te rkang lag gdong rnams la ni gyen du skyod par byed //
translated: At the navel, there are eight other channels, which move upward to the hands, feet, and face.

original: zla ba gnyis par rdzogs par gyur pa dag la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis par rdzogs par gyur pa dag la 'dir ni rkang lag gdong gi mtshon pa cung zad do //
translated: In the second month, the hands, feet, and face are formed.

original: zla ba gsum pa rdzogs pa na ni lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo bo mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: zla ba gsum pa rdzogs pa na ni lag pa rkang pa mgrin pa dag gi mgo bo mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: In the third month, the head is formed at the level of the hands, feet, and neck.

original: phra mo'i rtsi rnams zla ba bzhi pa la ni rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su ste //
analyzed: phra mo'i rtsi rnams zla ba bzhi pa la ni rkang lag gdong dang mgrin pa dag gi phyogs su ste //
translated: In the fourth month, the subtle channels of the hands, feet, face, and neck form.

original: lnga pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za dag ste tshigs rnams dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa mkha' ro bsreg za dag ste tshigs rnams dag kyang ngo //
translated: In the fifth month, flesh, blood, bones, and marrow form, as well as the joints.

original: zla ba drug pa la yang sha dang khrag tu 'gyur te tshor ba bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal yang //üîΩsmin ma skra dang spu dang bug pa rnams kyang thub mchog la ste rtsa ni lhag mar gyur pa rnams //üîΩzla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs ni skye ba ste //
analyzed: zla ba drug pa la yang sha dang khrag tu 'gyur te tshor ba bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal yang // smin ma skra dang spu dang bug pa rnams kyang thub mchog la ste rtsa ni lhag mar gyur pa rnams // zla ba'i mjug tu nyin zhag so so'i dbang gis stong pa stong pa mig gi grangs ni skye ba ste //
