original: snying ga'i padma dpal ldan dpral bar 'byung ba phyogs dang nyin zhag ces pa zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu //
analyzed: snying ga'i padma dpal ldan dpral bar 'byung ba phyogs dang nyin zhag ces pa zla ba'i rkang pa rgyu //
translated: The glorious heart lotus arises in the forehead. The so-called directions and days are the movement of the lunar mansions.

original: longs spyod lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la dgu ldan bcu dang drug po zung dang rgyal ba zhes bya dang // de nyid ces bya zhag bdun dag nas slar yang ri bong mtshan ma gang 'dir rim pa min pas 'dor; ;thig le dag la rdzogs par byas nas snying gar rab 'jug dkar po'i phyogs la nor gyi slad du 'o //
analyzed: longs spyod lte ba'i 'khor lo dag la dgu ldan bcu dang drug po zung dang rgyal ba zhes bya dang // de nyid ces bya zhag bdun dag nas slar yang ri bong mtshan ma gang 'dir rim pa min pas 'dor; ;thig le dag la rdzogs par byas nas snying gar rab 'jug dkar po'i phyogs la nor gyi slad du 'o //
translated: Having completed the drops, it enters the heart for the sake of wealth on the bright side.

original: slar yang nag po dag la de bzhin 'gro ste rkang pa'i dbang gis lte ba'i padma dag gi bar //
analyzed: slar yang nag po dag la de bzhin 'gro ste rkang pa'i dbang gis lte ba'i padma dag gi bar //
translated: Again, it goes in the same way on the dark side by the power of the feet to the navel chakra.

original: snying ga de bzhin mgo bor rtsibs brgyad rtsibs bcu drug la nag dang dkar ba dag gi chu skyes ming //
analyzed: snying ga de bzhin mgo bor rtsibs brgyad rtsibs bcu drug la nag dang dkar ba dag gi chu skyes ming //
translated: The heart and the head have eight and sixteen spokes, respectively, with the names of the lotuses of the dark and bright [fortnights].

original: mgrin pa lte ba dag la sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsibs dang nyis 'gyur gzhan te dmar dang ser po 'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa lte ba dag la sum cu rtsa gnyis rtsibs dang nyis 'gyur gzhan te dmar dang ser po 'o //
translated: The throat and the navel have thirty-two spokes and another double that, with the colors red and yellow.

original: brgyad pa gnyis ni lte ba mgrin pa la ste mgo dang snying ga la yang dkar nag rdzogs pa 'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa gnyis ni lte ba mgrin pa la ste mgo dang snying ga la yang dkar nag rdzogs pa 'o //
translated: The two eights are at the navel and the throat, and the white and black are complete at the head and the heart.

original: aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs gang ha ya ra wa lar ldan thig le dpal ldan rnam par bcad pa yis //
analyzed: aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs gang ha ya ra wa lar ldan thig le dpal ldan rnam par bcad pa yis //
translated: The vowels a and so forth, endowed with ya, ra, la, and va, are divided by the thirty-two glorious dots.

original: phye ba drug cur 'gyur te de dag dus dang mi bdag nor dang so rnams ge sar rtse mo la 'o //üîΩthig le'i rnam @66a *//
analyzed: phye ba drug cur 'gyur te de dag dus dang mi bdag nor dang so rnams ge sar rtse mo la 'o // thig le'i rnam @66a *//
translated: They become sixty, which are the time, the ruler, the wealth, and the petals on the tip of the pistils.

original: pa dang ni rnam par bcad pas pad 'dab mchog la ka sogs sde rnams rnam phye ba //
analyzed: pa dang ni rnam par bcad pas pad 'dab mchog la ka sogs sde rnams rnam phye ba //
translated: The supreme petals of the lotus are divided by the forms of the dots and the divisions into the groups of ka and so forth.

original: nyi shu dang ni brgya phrag gcig kyang thun gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nyi ma rgyu zhing nyams par byed //
analyzed: nyi shu dang ni brgya phrag gcig kyang thun gyi bgrod pa'i dbang gis nyi ma rgyu zhing nyams par byed //
translated: They are twenty and one hundred, which are diminished by the movement of the sun through the periods.

original: phyogs la zla ba rang gi rgyu bas nyin zhag ces bya'i rkang pa dag kyang bu lon dag tu byed //
analyzed: phyogs la zla ba rang gi rgyu bas nyin zhag ces bya'i rkang pa dag kyang bu lon dag tu byed //
translated: The moon in the directions makes the so-called day-feet, which are also in debt.

original: slar yang zla ba gnyis kyis gzhan pa dag kyang nyin zhag lo yi sbyor ba dag las 'phel ba ni //
analyzed: slar yang zla ba gnyis kyis gzhan pa dag kyang nyin zhag lo yi sbyor ba dag las 'phel ba ni //
translated: Again, the other two months increase by the application of days and years.

original: rdzogs pa'i lo la nyin zhag drug tu 'gyur te gzhan yang de bzhin 'chi ba dag gis mtshams su 'phel //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i lo la nyin zhag drug tu 'gyur te gzhan yang de bzhin 'chi ba dag gis mtshams su 'phel //
translated: In a complete year, there are six days, and again, in the same way, they increase up to death.

original: rgyal po de ltar nyi ma'i bu lon nyis 'gyur 'di ni lo yi sbyor ba dag gis 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: rgyal po de ltar nyi ma'i bu lon nyis 'gyur 'di ni lo yi sbyor ba dag gis 'phel bar byed //
translated: In this way, the king, the debt of the sun increases by a double amount in the course of the year.

original: dbugs drug gis ni chu srang gcig tu rab tu 'gyur te chu srang drug cu yis kyang chu tshod do //
analyzed: dbugs drug gis ni chu srang gcig tu rab tu 'gyur te chu srang drug cu yis kyang chu tshod do //
translated: Six breaths make one pala; sixty palas make one karsha.üîΩSixty karshas make one pala; thirty palas make one dhara·πáa.

original: chu tshod drug cu nyin zhag tu 'gyur gsum gyis bsgyur ba bcu yis nyin zhag dag gis zla ba gcig /
analyzed: chu tshod drug cu nyin zhag tu 'gyur gsum gyis bsgyur ba bcu yis nyin zhag dag gis zla ba gcig /
translated: Sixty dharas make one day and night; thirty days and nights make one month.

original: zla ba drug gis kyang ni bgrod par 'gyur te gnyis kyis bsgyur ba bgrod pa lo gcig tu rab grags //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis kyang ni bgrod par 'gyur te gnyis kyis bsgyur ba bgrod pa lo gcig tu rab grags //
translated: Six months make one ayana; two multiplied by six make one year.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi tshe lo brgya las bu lon bgrod par gyur pa dus kyi rtsa yi dbang gis so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi tshe lo brgya las bu lon bgrod par gyur pa dus kyi rtsa yi dbang gis so //
translated: The debt of the human beings, who live one hundred years, increases by the power of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s of time.

original: 'jig rten gsum na lha min lha mi rnams las gang zhig rang gi lus la zla ba nyi ma dag /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na lha min lha mi rnams las gang zhig rang gi lus la zla ba nyi ma dag /
translated: In the three worlds, among the gods, demigods, and humans, who is able to place the sun and moon on his body?

original: rdzogs par nus pa'i rnal 'byor ldan pa med de zla bas rang gi rgyu bas nyin mtshan rgyu ba dang // srid par lo yi nang du rim pas nyi mas kyang ni rgyu skar thams cad rgyu ba min pa nyid //
analyzed: rdzogs par nus pa'i rnal 'byor ldan pa med de zla bas rang gi rgyu bas nyin mtshan rgyu ba dang // srid par lo yi nang du rim pas nyi mas kyang ni rgyu skar thams cad rgyu ba min pa nyid //
translated: There is no one who is endowed with the yoga of being able to complete it. By its own motion, the moon moves by day and night, and the sun, in order, moves through all the lunar mansions in a year in the world.

original: lo dang lor ni bu @66b lon dag gis de ni srid pa za ste dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig /
analyzed: lo dang lor ni bu @66b lon dag gis de ni srid pa za ste dus kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo gcig /
translated: The KƒÅlacakra hero, in years and years, eats up the years with the months.

original: chad pa gal te rtsa gcig yin na mi yi bdag po gci ba dag ni skyur ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: chad pa gal te rtsa gcig yin na mi yi bdag po gci ba dag ni skyur ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: If the one channel is cut, the lord of men will have urine and feces that are sour.

original: de tsam rnams ni nyin zhag lnga nas mchog gi cha yis 'dor te gong bu 'chad pa'i dus su 'o //
analyzed: de tsam rnams ni nyin zhag lnga nas mchog gi cha yis 'dor te gong bu 'chad pa'i dus su 'o //
translated: Those five days and nights are subtracted by the best part, at the time of the breaking of the aggregate.

original: sgra ni rna ba las te ro yang nges par kha las 'dor zhing mig 'bras mig gi dbus nas so //
analyzed: sgra ni rna ba las te ro yang nges par kha las 'dor zhing mig 'bras mig gi dbus nas so //
translated: Sound is from the ear, and taste is definitely from the mouth, and the eyeballs are from the middle of the eyes.

original: dri ni sna las mi rnams dag gis lag pa rkang pa'i lus las dro ba'i dngos po rim pa yis //
analyzed: dri ni sna las mi rnams dag gis lag pa rkang pa'i lus las dro ba'i dngos po rim pa yis //
translated: Smell is from the nose, and humans lose the hands and feet from the body by stages, and the heat element.

original: sna yi rtse mo 'phyang ba dang ni spyi bor lag pa bzhag pa de yi rang bzhin dag tu mthong //
analyzed: sna yi rtse mo 'phyang ba dang ni spyi bor lag pa bzhag pa de yi rang bzhin dag tu mthong //
translated: The tip of the nose hangs down, and the hand is placed on the head‚Äîone sees these as its nature.

original: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil la rgya skyegs tshon gyes rab tu byugs kyang dmar po nyid du byed ma yin //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil la rgya skyegs tshon gyes rab tu byugs kyang dmar po nyid du byed ma yin //
translated: Even if the palms of both hands are well anointed with red dye, they do not become red.

original: nyi ma kha dog nag po dang ni yongs su gyur pa'i ri bong 'dzin pa kha dog ser por mthong //
analyzed: nyi ma kha dog nag po dang ni yongs su gyur pa'i ri bong 'dzin pa kha dog ser por mthong //
translated: The sun is seen as black in color, and the moon, which has turned yellow, is seen as having a white spot.

original: gcin dang lus kyang bsil bar gyur na mi yi bdag po de yi nyin zhag la ni 'chi ba nyid //
analyzed: gcin dang lus kyang bsil bar gyur na mi yi bdag po de yi nyin zhag la ni 'chi ba nyid //
translated: When urine and the body become cold, the lord of men dies on that very day.üîΩA black spot appears under the tongue, and in the eyes a very fine line of BrahmƒÅ appears.

original: lce 'og nag po'i thig tu rab tu 'gyur te mig la tshangs pa'i ri mo shin tu phra mo dang // dbugs ni zla ba nyi ma'i lam du 'phro ste mi yi bdag po mkhur tshos gnyis po de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: lce 'og nag po'i thig tu rab tu 'gyur te mig la tshangs pa'i ri mo shin tu phra mo dang // dbugs ni zla ba nyi ma'i lam du 'phro ste mi yi bdag po mkhur tshos gnyis po de bzhin nyid //
translated: The breath moves in the paths of the sun and moon, and likewise in the two cheeks of the lord of men.

original: nu ma'i steng ni mchan khung du zhugs gza' yi tshogs rnams mtha' dag me steg dag dang bcas par mthong //
analyzed: nu ma'i steng ni mchan khung du zhugs gza' yi tshogs rnams mtha' dag me steg dag dang bcas par mthong //
translated: The entire host of planets enters the armpit above the breast, together with the stars.

original: mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa rengs shing 'khor ba yang ni lus la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa rengs shing 'khor ba yang ni lus la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod //
translated: The constriction of the throat and the body, and the turning of the body, are held to be the characteristics of death.

original: skye ba dang ni btsa' ba'i dus dang byis pa gzhon nu dag gi gzugs ni byed pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni btsa' ba'i dus dang byis pa gzhon nu dag gi gzugs ni byed pa gang yin pa //
translated: The form of birth, the time of delivery, and the form of the child and youth, are the activities of the one who is

original: de nyid 'jig rten dag tu slar @67a *//üîΩyang sdud par byed pa dus kyi 'khor lo can te nyi ma min //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten dag tu slar @67a *// yang sdud par byed pa dus kyi 'khor lo can te nyi ma min //
translated: the world-destroyer.

original: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams 'byung ba dang bcas mtshan mo'i cha la bcom ldan de yis zos //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma la sogs lha rnams 'byung ba dang bcas mtshan mo'i cha la bcom ldan de yis zos //
translated: The one who is the world-destroyer is not the sun, but the sun and moon, etc., are the gods who are born with him, and the Blessed One devours them in the night.

original: slar yang nyin mo'i dus su mtha' yas rnams kyang gtong bar byed de skyed pa'i rgyu ni rim pas so //
analyzed: slar yang nyin mo'i dus su mtha' yas rnams kyang gtong bar byed de skyed pa'i rgyu ni rim pas so //
translated: And again, in the day, he releases the infinite ones, and the cause of their production is in order.

original: sgra la sogs pa drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur te dbang po drug po dag kyang byed pa'o; ;lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes dang zla ba nyi ma dag kyang byed pa po //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa drug po rnams ni las su 'gyur te dbang po drug po dag kyang byed pa'o; ;lo dang zla ba phyogs dang nyin dang mtshan mo tshes dang zla ba nyi ma dag kyang byed pa po //
translated: The six, sound, etc., are the objects, and the six sense-faculties are the agents; the year, the month, the half-month, the day, the night, the lunar day, the sun, and the moon are the agents.

original: de dag sdud pa'i byed po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin //
analyzed: de dag sdud pa'i byed po gzhan du 'dir 'gyur skyed pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po ma yin //
translated: The creator of the world is not the creator of the world, since he is not the creator of the other, i.e., of the individual soul.

original: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can te yul dang rnam bral yon tan med la rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The all-pervading one, the possessor of the sky-vajra, is free from objects, is without qualities, and without nature.

original: dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: dri dang kha dog dang ni ro dang reg pa zhes dang 'dzin ma dang ni chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Smell, color, taste, and touch, earth, water, fire, and air,

original: nges par gzugs can brgyad po rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par gzugs can brgyad po rnams ni mtha' dag yul gyi tshogs pa dag ste gcig ni gtso bor 'gyur //
translated: are definitely the eight material ones, the totality of the group of objects, with one being the principal one.

original: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro ba dag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag 'di ni spro ba dag dang sdud par 'gyur te dus kyi mthu las so //
translated: This entire triple world expands and contracts by the power of time.

original: sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang stong pa dang ni chos kyi dbyings dang yid kyang mi yi bdag po gzugs med du 'gyur ro //
translated: Sound, emptiness, the realm of phenomena, and mind are the lords of men, the formless ones.

original: bdag nyid 'ching ste rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis dar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'ching ste rang bzhin la gnas yon tan rnam rtog rnams kyis dar gyi srin bu ji bzhin nyid //
translated: The self is bound, abiding in its own nature, by the qualities imagined by the silkworm itself.

original: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong par byed //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gis nges par slar yang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid dag las ni gtong par byed //
translated: I myself, for my part, will certainly return to the pure, nonconceptual mind.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal @67b dang ni bde ba byed pa ste //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang las rang bzhin yon tan la gnas sdug bsngal @67b dang ni bde ba byed pa ste //
translated: Therefore, O King, it is from oneself that one creates one‚Äôs own nature, one‚Äôs own qualities, one‚Äôs own suffering and happiness.

original: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi shes 'jig rten rmongs par byed //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par bral ba su zhig byed po ci zhig byed de mi shes 'jig rten rmongs par byed //
translated: Who is the creator? What is created? The world is confused by ignorance.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ni yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin dag gi sems //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ni yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin dag gi sems //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, space, mind, intellect, and the sense of ‚ÄúI‚Äù

original: rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas yi ge thig le la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rags dang phra mo gzhan yang rnam gsum yon tan la gnas yi ge thig le la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: are coarse, subtle, and also threefold, abiding in the qualities, divided by syllables, drops, and so forth.

original: rags pa rags pa'i dbang po rnams la rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas te phra mo'i sems la phra mo yang //
analyzed: rags pa rags pa'i dbang po rnams la rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas te phra mo'i sems la phra mo yang //
translated: The coarse, by its nature, abides in the coarse senses, and the subtle, in the subtle mind.

original: ye shes la yang ye shes sku ste rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba 'byung ba min //
analyzed: ye shes la yang ye shes sku ste rang bzhin rnam 'gyur med pa'i 'tsho ba 'byung ba 'byung ba min //
translated: And in wisdom, the wisdom body, the life of the changeless nature, is not a life of the elements.

original: aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur min dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang // dus dang sems dang blo ste rang bzhin dag kyang de bzhin gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa 'o //
analyzed: aa sogs stong pa lnga ni rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur min dpal ldan cha dang thig le n'a da dang // dus dang sems dang blo ste rang bzhin dag kyang de bzhin gzhan pa'i dbyangs ni rlung la sogs pa 'o //
translated: time, mind, and intellect. The other phonemes are the winds and so forth.

original: rags pa sde pa'i yi ge rnams ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu ste bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa sde pa'i yi ge rnams ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu ste bcu drug gzhan ni rnam 'gyur ro //
translated: The phonemes of the gross categories are the ten multiplied by three, making thirty. The others are the evolutes.

original: de dag dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min cing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med //
analyzed: de dag dbus su rdo rje can ni rang bzhin min cing rnam 'gyur min te khyab byed rang bzhin med //
translated: In their midst is the vajra holder, who is neither the nature nor the evolutes, but the pervader, the absence of nature.

original: 'khor bar bde dang sdug bsngal rang bzhin yon tan la gnas las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste //
analyzed: 'khor bar bde dang sdug bsngal rang bzhin yon tan la gnas las las skyes pa de ni za ba ste //
translated: In samsara, happiness and suffering are based on the nature, qualities, and actions. The consumer is born from karma.

original: mi rnams kyi ni las 'di dag kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rags dang phra mo zhi ba 'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni las 'di dag kyang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te rags dang phra mo zhi ba 'o //
translated: These actions of humans are also threefold: gross, subtle, and peace.

original: bdag ni byed pa po yang khyad par las te gzhan pa phyugs bdag kyang yod byed po zhes pa las //
analyzed: bdag ni byed pa po yang khyad par las te gzhan pa phyugs bdag kyang yod byed po zhes pa las //
translated: I am the agent, and the special one from karma. There is also another, the lord of cattle, who is the agent.

original: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral bar shes pa de ni las ma yin //üîΩde phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug @68a *//
analyzed: byed po bdag gam gzhan pa min te rang bzhin rnam par bral bar shes pa de ni las ma yin // de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug @68a *//
translated: The agent is neither the self nor another. Knowing that, one should understand that there is no action.

original: bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
analyzed: bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
translated: Therefore, no agent whatsoever gives or takes away the happiness and suffering of living beings.

original: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: The three kinds of karma that are done in cyclic existence give rise to their fruits in the past.

original: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
analyzed: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo gros te //
translated: This is the giver and the taker away, the delusion of the ignorant.

original: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ma yin //
analyzed: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog par byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po dag gis mthong ma yin //
translated: The body‚Äôs countless virtues are taken away by the holes of the senses, but they are not seen.

original: 'dod pa'i nus dang bya ba dang ni gsum pa ye shes nus pa 'phro ba rang gi yid la ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nus dang bya ba dang ni gsum pa ye shes nus pa 'phro ba rang gi yid la ste //
translated: The power of desire, the power of action, and the power of wisdom are projected into one‚Äôs own mind.

original: dngos po gsal ba dang ni 'jug pa dag dang ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed //
analyzed: dngos po gsal ba dang ni 'jug pa dag dang ro mnyam rgyur ni don la nye bar dmigs par byed //
translated: The clear thing, the engagement, and the equal taste are perceived in the object as the cause.

original: slar yang gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis kyang nges pa rim pas so //
analyzed: slar yang gtong ba dag ni bzhi pa srid gsum gyis btud gnyis med kyis kyang nges pa rim pas so //
translated: Again, the fourfold giving is the fourth, and the nondual is ascertained by the three existences, respectively.

original: de dag nang nas rdo rje can ni mi yi bdag po cung zad mi za gtong ba min pa nyid //
analyzed: de dag nang nas rdo rje can ni mi yi bdag po cung zad mi za gtong ba min pa nyid //
translated: Among them, the vajra-holder is the lord of men, who does not eat a little, but gives.

original: bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal bde ba rab tu sbyin por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: bdag ni byed po sdug bsngal bde ba rab tu sbyin por mi yi bdag po der ni 'gyur ba min //
translated: I am not the agent, the lord of men, who gives suffering and happiness.

original: 'ga' yang bcings dang grol bar 'gyur min mi yi bdag po sems kyi nus pa rnam par spangs nas so //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bcings dang grol bar 'gyur min mi yi bdag po sems kyi nus pa rnam par spangs nas so //
translated: No one is bound or liberated, the lord of men, having abandoned the capacity of the mind.

original: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' bum pa'i dbus nas chu ni len par byed pa na yang 'gro ba min pa ji lta ba //
translated: When taking water from the middle of a pot in space, it does not go.

original: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can ni yul dang rnam bral lus kyi dbus ngag tu yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' khyab mkha' yi rdo rje can ni yul dang rnam bral lus kyi dbus ngag tu yang de bzhin no //
translated: The all-pervading sky-vajra is free from objects, and so is the middle of the body and speech.

original: de ltar las ni yod par smra ba por 'gyur bcom ldan ston pa gcig tu de ni byed po min //
analyzed: de ltar las ni yod par smra ba por 'gyur bcom ldan ston pa gcig tu de ni byed po min //
translated: Thus, the one who speaks of the existence of karma becomes the agent, but the BhagavƒÅn, the Teacher, is not that agent at all.

original: kun mkhyen dang bo'i sangs rgyas srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can te 'khor lo can ma yin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen dang bo'i sangs rgyas srid gsum gyis btud dus kyi 'khor lo can te 'khor lo can ma yin //
translated: The Omniscient One, the Primordial Buddha, the Lord of the Three Worlds, is the Lord of the Wheel.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug @68b drag po dag kyang gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug @68b drag po dag kyang gang gi zhabs kyi chu skyes drung du lhag par skyabs 'gro ba //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva themselves take refuge at his lotus feet.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba mchog skyed yon tan med cing rnam rtog med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Supreme Victor, the Lord of the Wheel, who is free from qualities and concepts.

original: zhi ba'i bsam pa la ni lha nyid du 'gyur mi yi bdag po mun pa la ni dmyal ba nyid //
analyzed: zhi ba'i bsam pa la ni lha nyid du 'gyur mi yi bdag po mun pa la ni dmyal ba nyid //
translated: In a peaceful mind, one becomes a god; in a mind of darkness, a lord of men;

original: rdul dag la yang dud 'gro nyid de rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la //
analyzed: rdul dag la yang dud 'gro nyid de rab mchog sa yi steng du mi nyid dag ni 'dres pa la //
translated: In a mind of passion, an animal; in a mind of a mixture of the best elements, a human.

original: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
analyzed: 'byung po nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste rdul dang mun pa dang ni snying stobs phan tshun 'dres pa la'o //
translated: There are three types of beings: those with a predominance of passion, darkness, or goodness.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyi bsam pa gang zhig dran par gyur pa de ni skye bo yang dag skye //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su yid kyi bsam pa gang zhig dran par gyur pa de ni skye bo yang dag skye //
translated: At the time of death, whatever thought the mind remembers, that is what the person becomes.

original: lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis lha yi mchog gi gnas su mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba //
analyzed: lha nyid brgyad kyi dbye ba dag gis lha yi mchog gi gnas su mi nyid gcig ni ji lta ba //
translated: How is it that one man alone, by the division of the eight gods, is in the abode of the gods?

original: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gtor rnam pa nges par dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig /
analyzed: dud 'gro dag kyang chu gtor rnam pa nges par dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dmyal ba nyid ni de bzhin gcig /
translated: And the animals, too, by the offering of water, and the hell-beings, too, in the hells, are in the same way.

original: gnas 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar skye bo 'khor te las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag /
analyzed: gnas 'di rnams su ro yi 'gro bar skye bo 'khor te las kyi zhags pas nges par bcings pa dag /
translated: In these abodes, the beings of the preta world revolve, bound by the noose of karma.

original: skye ba 'bum phrag du mas thar pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du ni 'gro zhing grol ba min //
analyzed: skye ba 'bum phrag du mas thar pa mchog gi bde ba'i go 'phang du ni 'gro zhing grol ba min //
translated: For hundreds of thousands of lives they go and are not liberated to the state of the bliss of supreme liberation.üîΩThe three existences of the aggregates, elements, and faculties, the fear of existence, the five faculties of action,

original: phung po khams dang dbang po dang ni rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa las kyi dbang po lnga dag dang // de tsam dang ni las kyi skyon dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin la sogs te //
analyzed: phung po khams dang dbang po dang ni rnam gsum srid pa 'jigs pa las kyi dbang po lnga dag dang // de tsam dang ni las kyi skyon dang yon tan dang bcas yid dang blo dang ngar 'dzin la sogs te //
translated: that much, and the faults and virtues of action, the mind, the intellect, the grasping of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and so on,

original: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yi 'gro bar 'khor te phra mo'i dngos po dag gis slar //
analyzed: 'di dag gis bcings 'tsho ba dag ni ro yi 'gro bar 'khor te phra mo'i dngos po dag gis slar //
translated: by these, the living beings bound, revolve in the preta world, by subtle things again and again.

original: dngos po btang na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste gang du slar yang skye ldan min //üîΩyan lag dang bcas @69a *//üîΩrig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: dngos po btang na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab tu 'gro ste gang du slar yang skye ldan min // yan lag dang bcas @69a *// rig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: When one gives up things, one goes to the supreme place, which is inexhaustible and from which one is not born again.üîΩThe Vedas, with their texts and the recollection of their branches, and logic, with its conclusions, are not the knowledge of the world.

original: snyan dang ngags mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min //
analyzed: snyan dang ngags mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min //
translated: The other treatises composed by the poets, such as Bhavabh≈´ti, are not knowledge.

original: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab gsungs nyid //
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab gsungs nyid //
translated: Knowledge is the unchanging inner knowledge, which is taught by the sages in this world.

original: gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang du thim pa'o //
translated: In it, the three worlds are born and in it they dissolve again.

original: rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
translated: If a yogi, who has not attained yoga, dies with a very restless mind,

original: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: he is born in the world of men, in the best family of sages, endowed with yoga.

original: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun tu 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that former habituation, again the vast yoga of wisdom is fully grasped.

original: ye shes thob na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa min //
analyzed: ye shes thob na mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro gang du slar yang skye ba ldan pa min //
translated: When wisdom is attained, one goes to the supreme abode of the inexhaustible, where there is no more birth.

original: ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar //
analyzed: ye shes skye ste rgyal ba rnams kyi nyi ma nyin mo'i dus su mtshan mo phyed dang mtshan mo'i mthar //
translated: Wisdom arises‚Äîthe sun of the victors at daytime, at midnight, and at the end of the night.

original: lha min rnams ni zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu 'o //
analyzed: lha min rnams ni zla ba mtshan mo'i dus su nyi ma phyed dang nyin mo dag gi mjug tu 'o //
translated: The asuras are at the moon, at nighttime, at midday, and at the end of the day.

original: yang dag ye shes rnams nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes rnams nyams dag la tshig ni legs sbyar tha mal dag tu rab tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The words of the perfect wisdoms are transformed into ordinary Sanskrit.

original: zhi dang drag po las te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su skyes bu nyid dang tha mal dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhi dang drag po las te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su skyes bu nyid dang tha mal dag kyang ngo //
translated: From peaceful and wrathful actions, in the abodes of the three existences, one becomes a human or ordinary.

original: nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed nas nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su de dag gi ni za ba'i dus //
analyzed: nyi ma gung dang mtshan mo phyed nas nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su de dag gi ni za ba'i dus //
translated: From midday and midnight, at the times of day and night, those are the times of their meals.

original: bza' ba zan dang ba lang @69b sha ste btung ba rnam mang bcud ster dag dang sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba zan dang ba lang @69b sha ste btung ba rnam mang bcud ster dag dang sgo nga'i khu ba'o //
translated: Food is rice and beef, drink is the juice of many fruits and eggs.

original: gos ni dmar dang dkar po dag dang nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris sa 'og gnas //
analyzed: gos ni dmar dang dkar po dag dang nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa bzhin du mtho ris sa 'og gnas //
translated: Clothing is red and white, and the planets move like the sun and moon in heaven and underground.

original: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ba yang ste bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis rdo rje lha min gdan yang ngo //
analyzed: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ba yang ste bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis rdo rje lha min gdan yang ngo //
translated: Dharma is non-violence and violence, and by the power of the guru's certainty, even the vajra seat of the asuras.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi las ni 'dren mar rab tu 'gyur te tshig kyang 'dres pa sha za dag gi'o //
translated: The actions of the spirits become mixed, and the words are mixed, of the flesh-eaters.

original: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan nges par bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
analyzed: chos ni 'tshe med 'tshe ldan nges par bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis srog gcod la sogs skyon dag la //
translated: Dharma is non-violence and violence, and by the power of the guru's certainty, the faults of killing and so forth

original: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug 'gyur mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa'am //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs don du rab tu 'jug 'gyur mi yi bdag po res 'ga' dag ni ldog pa'am //
translated: are engaged for the sake of sacrifice and so forth, and sometimes the lords of men turn back.

original: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du 'o //
analyzed: bza' ba btung ba dag kyang 'dres pa nyi zla'i bgrod pa dag las lam ni 'dren ma gzhan du 'o //
translated: Food and drink are mixed, and the path is mixed from the movements of the sun and moon.

original: 'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang dang lo yi phyed dag kyang //
analyzed: 'od zer lam ni nyi ma'i snang ba dkar po nyin mo bgrod pa byang dang lo yi phyed dag kyang //
translated: The path of the rays is the white light of the sun, which travels in the north during the day and during the six months of summer.

original: zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste du ba dag gi lam //
analyzed: zla ba'i snang ba mtshan mo dag dang dkar min bgrod pa 'di ni lho ste du ba dag gi lam //
translated: The path of the moon is the light of the moon, which travels in the south during the night and during the six months of winter.

original: 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste dkar min dag kyang de bzhin lha min klu yi 'jig rten du //
analyzed: 'od zer lha rnams mtho ris su ste dkar min dag kyang de bzhin lha min klu yi 'jig rten du //
translated: The rays go to the gods in heaven, and the moon goes to the world of the asuras and nƒÅgas.

original: kun tu 'dres pa mi bdag mi yi 'jig rten du ni yi dvags dud 'gro mi rnams dag gir 'gyur //üîΩgang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
analyzed: kun tu 'dres pa mi bdag mi yi 'jig rten du ni yi dvags dud 'gro mi rnams dag gir 'gyur // gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs nges pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
translated: The mixed [rays] go to the human world, to humans, animals, and ghosts.

original: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gis 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gis 'gyur //
translated: Whoever enters the middle of any of these, bound by the noose of karma, is born in the middle of that, according to his own thoughts, in the family of that [being], by the power of his own grasping.

original: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
translated: As long as the nature of the mind is threefold, by the power of existence, with the experience of pleasure and pain,

original: de srid 'jigs rung @70a *//
analyzed: de srid 'jigs rung @70a *//
translated: for that long, there is no escape from the three worlds, which are terrifying with the fire of suffering.

original: 'khor ba 'dir 'khyams mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dir 'khyams mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang //
translated: The lord of men wanders in this sa·πÉsƒÅra, above, in the human world, and below.

original: ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs //
analyzed: ka sogs sde rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa dag kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur gang yang phyogs gsum dag gi dbyangs //
translated: The classes beginning with ka, along with the vowels, are also transformed by the qualities, in the three directions, with the sounds.

original: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams la rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: nges par sum cu'i gsal byed de dag rnams la rnam gsum bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas rgyu ba ste //
translated: Those thirty consonants are definitely traversed by the three, by the movement of death, by the power of the three.üîΩThe feet of the five planets, the feet of the sun and moon, and the feet of RƒÅhu and Ketu,

original: gza' lnga'i rkang pa nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa dag dang sgra gcan mjug ring rkang pa dang // sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'o //
analyzed: gza' lnga'i rkang pa nyi ma ri bong can gyi rkang pa dag dang sgra gcan mjug ring rkang pa dang // sum cu rtsa gnyis lo dang phyogs kyang yon tan gyis bsgyur zla ba nyi ma me yis phye ba'o //
translated: are divided by the thirty-two years and the directions, by the qualities, by the sun, moon, and fire.

original: lo gsum gyis ni phyogs rnams dag dang ri bong can gyi yon tan dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag /
analyzed: lo gsum gyis ni phyogs rnams dag dang ri bong can gyi yon tan dus kyi me yi phyogs gnyis dag /
translated: The directions and the qualities of the moon, in three years, are divided by the two directions of the time fire.

original: lo brgya las ni dman gyur lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la //
analyzed: lo brgya las ni dman gyur lhag ma'i phyogs ni nyi zla dag gi mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la //
translated: The remaining directions, less than a hundred years, are the equal and unequal courses of the sun and moon.

original: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grangs de nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dag ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten mig dang me mig grangs de nyin mtshan dus rnams gtso bo dag gis dman pa mtha' dag ste //
translated: The mundane eye, the eye of fire, the number, the day and night, the principal ones, and all the inferior ones.

original: gsal byed la sogs sde pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos //
analyzed: gsal byed la sogs sde pa dbyangs rnams dag ni nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis 'chi bas zos //
translated: The classes of consonants, etc., and the vowels are devoured by death by the power of the movement of the sun and moon.

original: phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral gza' yi chu tshod rnams dman pa //
analyzed: phyed bcas 'khor lo'i chu tshod ri bong can gyi rkang pa dang bral gza' yi chu tshod rnams dman pa //
translated: The half-hours of the wheel, minus the lunar digits, and the hours of the planets are inferior.

original: de dag rnams kyang shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gis nyin mtshan dus kyis 'chi bas zos //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang shes rab thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba dag gis nyin mtshan dus kyis 'chi bas zos //
translated: Those are also devoured by death by the division of wisdom and method, by day and night.

original: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar sde pa dbyangs bcas dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pa gsal byed rnams nyid dag dang rkang pa ni //
translated: Thus, the classes, along with the vowels and the collection of vowels, the very consonants, and the digits,

original: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni @70b gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la 'o //
analyzed: dman dang bar ma dus 'chi zla ba nyi ma'i 'chi ba dang ni @70b gsal byed lhag pa'i lha la 'o //
translated: are inferior, middling, and the death of the moon and sun, and the death of the additional deity of the consonants.

original: sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la rtsa ni gcod pa 'di //
analyzed: sum cu gnyis dang nyin zhag gcig kyang ri bong can bcas nyi ma'i bgrod la rtsa ni gcod pa 'di //
translated: Thirty-two and one day and night, along with the moon, are the cutting of the channels in the movement of the sun.

original: slar yang sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis rdo rje dang bcas phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor //
analyzed: slar yang sum cu mtshan mo gsum gyis rdo rje dang bcas phung po khams dang dbang po la sogs 'dor //
translated: Again, for thirty nights and three days, the vajra and the aggregates, elements, faculties, and so forth are cast off.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa dag dor nas dung can mar ni srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa dag dor nas dung can mar ni srog gi rlung dag nyin gcig rab 'jug ste //
translated: Having cast off the channels of the moon and sun, the life-force winds enter the conch shell for one day.

original: sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa ji srid nyid du 'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha'i khams ni rnam par chad pa ji srid nyid du 'o //
translated: For as long as the earth, water, fire, wind, and space elements are severed,

original: dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: dang por mtha' dag rgyal ba'i lus ni dngos grub rgyu ru sngags pa dag gis yang dag bsrung bar bya //
translated: first, the entire body of the Victor is truly protected by the mantra practitioner as the cause of spiritual powers.

original: lus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'ang med //
analyzed: lus med na ni dngos grub med cing skye ba 'di la mchog gi bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'ang med //
translated: Without a body, there are no spiritual powers, and there is no attainment of supreme bliss in this life.

original: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de phyir lus kyi don gyi rgyur ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su rtsa yi sbyor ba bsgom par bya //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of the body, one should meditate on the channel yoga at the appropriate time each day.

original: lus ni grub na gzhan pa'i dngos grub srid pa gsum gyi gnas su mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni grub na gzhan pa'i dngos grub srid pa gsum gyi gnas su mngag gzhug nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
translated: When the body is accomplished, other spiritual powers become servants in the three realms of existence.

original: stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya; ;de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa la ni du ba sogs lam bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan mtshams su bsgom par bya; ;de nas rtsa yi 'khor lo rnams su srog dang thur sel rlung ni brtan pa dag kyang byed pa ste //
translated: Then, the yogi should stabilize the life-force and downward-voiding winds in the cakras.

original: phyi nas zla ba nges par 'gog pa gza' bzhin byed de byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so; ;de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba 'di la thob bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas zla ba nges par 'gog pa gza' bzhin byed de byang chub sems ni rnal 'byor pa yis so; ;de nas gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa dag ni nyin zhag 'ga' yis skye ba 'di la thob bar 'gyur //
translated: Afterwards, the yogi should stop the moon like a planet, and then whatever is slightly desired will be attained in this life in a few days.

original: nyi ma zla ba 'gog pa mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste dbu ma me la rab tu zhugs /
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba 'gog pa mnyam dang mi mnyam bgrod pa la ste dbu ma me la rab tu zhugs /
translated: The stopping of the sun and moon is the equal and unequal movement, and the entry into the middle fire.

original: @71a *// srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po song na dus min 'chi ba blu ba ste //
analyzed: @71a *// srog dang thur sel gnyis po dag kyang nyin zhag dang po song na dus min 'chi ba blu ba ste //
translated: When the life-force and downward-voiding winds move on the first day, it steals untimely death.

original: lag pa dang bcas rkang ba'i sor mo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar ni srog gis kun tu gang byas nas //
analyzed: lag pa dang bcas rkang ba'i sor mo'i tshigs dang sen mo'i mthar ni srog gis kun tu gang byas nas //
translated: Having filled the fingers and toes with life-force,

original: 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug la sangs rgyas lha mo 'jigs med lag pa'i padma rnal 'byor pas ni bsgom par bya //
translated: The yogi should meditate on the lotus of the hand of the Goddess Buddha-Amitabha in the six cakras.

original: thur sel bskum na 'dod par 'gyur te lus mchog dag la rlung gi nad ni ma lus dag pa 'o //
analyzed: thur sel bskum na 'dod par 'gyur te lus mchog dag la rlung gi nad ni ma lus dag pa 'o //
translated: When the apana is contracted, it becomes the desire, and the best body becomes free from all the wind diseases.

original: srog rtsol dag ni bad kan la 'gyur slar yang de dag gtong pa mkhris pa dag gis skyon la 'o //
analyzed: srog rtsol dag ni bad kan la 'gyur slar yang de dag gtong pa mkhris pa dag gis skyon la 'o //
translated: The prana-apana becomes the phlegm, and their reversal becomes the bile disease.

original: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la 'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og ni yang dag 'gog pa bde ba byed par 'gyur te 'dus pa dag dang rims la 'o //
translated: The upward and downward movement of the prana and apana becomes the cause of happiness, and their stoppage becomes the cause of the diseases of the union of the humors and fever.

original: lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog lte ba'i rtsa bar gzhan pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du srog gi rlung ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog lte ba'i rtsa bar gzhan pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: The prana wind at the navel takes away all the diseases, and the other winds at the root of the navel.

original: bskum ste thur sel rlung ni rnam pa gsum gyi lam du bgrod pa dag dang sog nyid steng nas kyang //
analyzed: bskum ste thur sel rlung ni rnam pa gsum gyi lam du bgrod pa dag dang sog nyid steng nas kyang //
translated: The apana wind moves in the three paths by contraction, and the prana wind moves upward.

original: ji srid yang dag phrad de ma ni stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par rab 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji srid yang dag phrad de ma ni stobs dang ldan zhing lus kun la ni khyab par rab 'gyur ba //
translated: As long as the mother and the son winds meet, the body becomes strong and pervaded by the wind.

original: dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang lto bar son pa zla ba'i sbyor bas 'joms pa ste //
analyzed: dmu chu skran dang gzhang 'brum nad rnams dag kyang lto bar son pa zla ba'i sbyor bas 'joms pa ste //
translated: The water-bellies, the tumours, and the piles, when they have reached the belly, are destroyed by the union with the moon.

original: dbugs lud dang ni glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug dang mig gi nad la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: dbugs lud dang ni glo dang rnam pa gsum gyi dug dang mig gi nad la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: The catarrh, the cough, the three kinds of poison, the eye-diseases, and so on,

original: mchan khung g-yas dang g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
analyzed: mchan khung g-yas dang g-yas min las ni nu ma dag kyang stobs ldan mnan te srog ni bkag pa las //
translated: are destroyed by pressing the right and left armpits with the two hands, and by stopping the breath.

original: g-yas nas g-yon pa'i rtsar @71b ni 'phral la rab tu 'bab ste g-yon pa'i mchan khung las kyang g-yas su 'o //
analyzed: g-yas nas g-yon pa'i rtsar @71b ni 'phral la rab tu 'bab ste g-yon pa'i mchan khung las kyang g-yas su 'o //
translated: The milk in the right and left breasts is drawn by the yogi who is endowed with yoga, by the sudden flow of the current from the right to the left channel, and from the left armpit to the right.

original: zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so //
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyis kyang ni 'chi ster 'chi ltas 'phrog ste rnal 'byor ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa yis so //
translated: Even the signs of death, which bring death in half a month, are removed.

original: rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa bzung ba lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rdu 'joms //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung du gnas rkang pa bzung ba lag pa'i padmo dag ni rgyab kyi zug rdu 'joms //
translated: The vajra posture, the holding of the feet, the lotus of the hands, destroy the pain in the back.

original: steng du rkang pa dag dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: steng du rkang pa dag dang 'og tu mgo bo lus la bad kan nad rnams mtha' dag 'phrog par byed //
translated: The feet above, the head below, the whole body, carry off all the phlegm-diseases.

original: sog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'gag zhig gis ni rab 'khrug gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed //
analyzed: sog 'gog pa las nyin zhag 'gag zhig gis ni rab 'khrug gci ba'i nad dag nges par 'joms par byed //
translated: By stopping the flow of urine for a day or two, one will certainly conquer the disease of dysentery.

original: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni so yi phreng ba dag la rab brdar ba //
analyzed: tho rangs ming med dag gis chu dang bral ba'i khar ni so yi phreng ba dag la rab brdar ba //
translated: In the morning, with the nameless fingers, one should rub the gums free of water.

original: mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur slar yang nad ni 'phrog pa chu yis gtor ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: mig rnams dag gi mig sman du 'gyur slar yang nad ni 'phrog pa chu yis gtor ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: This will be an eye ointment for the eyes, and it will also remove the disease by sprinkling with water.

original: gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa'i padmas bzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba yi zug rdu 'joms //
analyzed: gan rkyal nyal nas lte ba lag pa'i padmas bzung ba dag ni ma zhu ba yi zug rdu 'joms //
translated: Lying on one‚Äôs back, holding the navel with the lotus of the hand, one will conquer the pain of indigestion.

original: 'bras rnams 'byung ba las ni nges par mar dang bcas pa'i tshva yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed //
analyzed: 'bras rnams 'byung ba las ni nges par mar dang bcas pa'i tshva yis bdugs na 'phel ba 'joms par byed //
translated: By the arising of hemorrhoids, one should certainly conquer the increase by fumigation with salt and clarified butter.

original: de nas aarka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rdu bcas gyur na //
analyzed: de nas aarka'i 'o ma byugs pas kyang ngo 'ga' zhig tshe na so srin zug rdu bcas gyur na //
translated: Then, by applying arka milk, also. When one has toothache with pain,

original: stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbubs la sogs pa dag gis 'dir zung srin bu la sogs 'joms //
analyzed: stag ldan gyi ni sa bon du ba sbubs la sogs pa dag gis 'dir zung srin bu la sogs 'joms //
translated: one should take the seeds of ≈õ·πõ·πÖgavera and so on, and here one will conquer worms and so on.

original: lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi mchog gi yus la dkar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci //
analyzed: lo phyed kyis ni sngags pa rnams kyi mchog gi yus la dkar ba'i mdze 'phrog de las gzhan lta ci //
translated: What need to mention others?

original: shes rab 'dus la rang sems lhung ba dag kyang rtag tu srog gi rlung gis 'grogs pa dag las te //
analyzed: shes rab 'dus la rang sems lhung ba dag kyang rtag tu srog gi rlung gis 'grogs pa dag las te //
translated: The one who has fallen into his own mind in the gathering of wisdom, always accompanied by the life-force wind,

original: bdun cu'i lo yi rga ba skra dkar bcas @72a *//
analyzed: bdun cu'i lo yi rga ba skra dkar bcas @72a *//
translated: will take away the old age of seventy years with its white hair,

original: pa dag kyang lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs na nges par 'phrog /
analyzed: pa dag kyang lo gnyis rab tu rdzogs na nges par 'phrog /
translated: if he is perfect in two years.üîΩIn a few days, the accomplishment of the consort will come from the path of the mind, well accompanied.

original: nyi ma 'ga' yis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng phyag rgya'i dngos grub 'gyur; ;srog rtsol rab tu bya ste snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nyi ma 'ga' yis lam dang sems ni rab tu 'grogs pa dag las de steng phyag rgya'i dngos grub 'gyur; ;srog rtsol rab tu bya ste snying ga de bzhin mgo bo dag ni ji srid me yis gdung 'gyur ba //
translated: One should practice prƒÅ·πáƒÅyƒÅma until the heart and the head are burned by fire.

original: de las steng dag tu ni bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te ma bsdams pa 'am stobs dag gis //
analyzed: de las steng dag tu ni bzang po'i padmar brgyal bar 'gyur te ma bsdams pa 'am stobs dag gis //
translated: From that, one will faint in the good lotus above, either through lack of control or through the powers.

original: gtsug tor phug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba nyid du 'gro 'gyur te //
analyzed: gtsug tor phug cing phung po dag dang khams rnams rnam par spangs nas 'chi ba nyid du 'gro 'gyur te //
translated: The cranial aperture will be pierced, and having abandoned the aggregates and elements, one will go to death.

original: phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni bde 'bras ster ba med //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'grogs pa rab nyams skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la ni bde 'bras ster ba med //
translated: The seal is not a woman, for she does not give the fruit of bliss to men in this very life.

original: phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du gsungs te nyin mtshan dus su chags pa zad pa'i don ni min pa nyid //
analyzed: phyag rgya bsgom pa'i don du gsungs te nyin mtshan dus su chags pa zad pa'i don ni min pa nyid //
translated: The seal is not for the sake of meditation, nor is it for the sake of the exhaustion of passion during the day and night.

original: gsung gi rdo rje mchod pa'i don te nges par sngags pa rnams la myos byed gsungs pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje mchod pa'i don te nges par sngags pa rnams la myos byed gsungs pa nyid ma yin //
translated: The seal is not for the sake of worshipping the Vajra of Speech, nor is it for the sake of wine for the yogins.

original: kha zas thams cad bde ba'i don te nyin zhag so so'i dus su ma zhu'i rgyur yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: kha zas thams cad bde ba'i don te nyin zhag so so'i dus su ma zhu'i rgyur yang ma gsungs so //
translated: All food is not for the sake of bliss, nor is it for the sake of indigestion at each day‚Äôs end.

original: dpal ldan spyod pa dngos grub rgyur te mtshan mo dur khrod 'khyams pa dag kyang rtsed mo'i don ma yin //üîΩmi bskyod pa ni cung zad dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed ste so yi zug rdu nyid kyi yang //
analyzed: dpal ldan spyod pa dngos grub rgyur te mtshan mo dur khrod 'khyams pa dag kyang rtsed mo'i don ma yin // mi bskyod pa ni cung zad dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed ste so yi zug rdu nyid kyi yang //
translated: The glorious conduct is not for the sake of power, nor is wandering in the charnel grounds at night for the sake of play.üîΩAkshobhya is not for the sake of a slight fever, nor is he for the sake of curing mouth diseases, nor is he for the sake of toothaches.

original: tho rangs mi bskyod rdubs pa dag ni mgo yi nad 'phrog de bzhin nyid du chu ni rdubs pas so //
analyzed: tho rangs mi bskyod rdubs pa dag ni mgo yi nad 'phrog de bzhin nyid du chu ni rdubs pas so //
translated: Akshobhya is not for the sake of inhaling at dawn, nor is he for the sake of curing head diseases, nor is he for the sake of inhaling water in the same way.

original: rna ba dag dang mig tu gcin ni dro dang grang mo rab blugs gnyis ka dag gi nad 'phrog go //
analyzed: rna ba dag dang mig tu gcin ni dro dang grang mo rab blugs gnyis ka dag gi nad 'phrog go //
translated: Urine, warm or cold, poured into the ears or the eyes, removes the diseases of both.

original: 'byung pos gzir la @72b tsha ba gsum bcas mi bskyod rdubs na bde ba ster te zos pa nyid la yang //
analyzed: 'byung pos gzir la @72b tsha ba gsum bcas mi bskyod rdubs na bde ba ster te zos pa nyid la yang //
translated: If one inhales the three hot things together, one will be happy and will be freed from the bhuta-grahas.

original: bshang ba gcin dang khu ba khrag ni mi yi sha dang bcas pa zos pas tshe ni ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bshang ba gcin dang khu ba khrag ni mi yi sha dang bcas pa zos pas tshe ni ster bar 'gyur //
translated: By eating feces, urine, semen, blood, and human flesh, one will obtain long life.

original: bsam  bcas par me tog rdubs na skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang 'phrog /
analyzed: bsam  bcas par me tog rdubs na skra dkar dang bcas rga ba dang ni lus skyes rnams kyang 'phrog /
translated: By inhaling flowers with the mind focused, one will remove gray hair and old age and the diseases of the body.

original: sgron ma lnga po sbrang bu'i skyug pa dag dang bsres pa bzos pas mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa ste //
analyzed: sgron ma lnga po sbrang bu'i skyug pa dag dang bsres pa bzos pas mtha' dag nad ni 'phrog pa ste //
translated: By eating the five nectars mixed with bee vomit, one will remove all diseases.

original: bud mad  me tog khu ba dag dang bsres pa lo gcig zos na rga ba nges par sel bam byed //
analyzed: bud mad  me tog khu ba dag dang bsres pa lo gcig zos na rga ba nges par sel bam byed //
translated: By eating for one year the mixture of the juice of a woman‚Äôs flower and the five nectars, one will certainly remove old age.

original: rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur ba dag tu 'gyur te mngar dang bska ba dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra /
analyzed: rlung 'joms lan tshva skyur ba dag tu 'gyur te mngar dang bska ba dag ni mkhris pa'i dgra /
translated: Salt and sour destroy wind; sweet and astringent are the enemies of bile.

original: bad  kan 'joms pa kha ba kun dang de bzhin tsha ba dag  kyang  sman rnams sam ni khu ba 'am //
analyzed: bad  kan 'joms pa kha ba kun dang de bzhin tsha ba dag  kyang  sman rnams sam ni khu ba 'am //
translated: All the bitter [substances] destroy phlegm, and likewise the hot [substances] are medicines or juices.

original: bad  kan 'joms pa ra yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma mkhris  pa'i dgra /
analyzed: bad  kan 'joms pa ra yi 'o ma tsha ba gsum bcas dag ste ma he'i 'o ma mkhris  pa'i dgra /
translated: Cow's milk that destroys phlegm, with the three hot [substances], and buffalo milk is the enemy of bile.

original: rlung 'joms  dag kyang rnga mo'i 'o ma rnam gsum nad 'phrog pa yi 'o ma dang ni de bzhin mar //
analyzed: rlung 'joms  dag kyang rnga mo'i 'o ma rnam gsum nad 'phrog pa yi 'o ma dang ni de bzhin mar //
translated: Camel milk destroys wind, and the three kinds of milk steal away the diseases, and likewise the ghee.

original: dz'a ti bskol ba'i chu ni dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rdu nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: dz'a ti bskol ba'i chu ni dro ba kha nad zhi bar byed de so yi zug rdu nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The warm water boiled with jƒÅti pacifies mouth diseases, and also toothaches.

original: til mar  dangs po'i chu bskol tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dag gis rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms //
analyzed: til mar  dangs po'i chu bskol tsha ba gsum dang lan tshva dag gis rna ba yi ni nad dag 'joms //
translated: The water boiled with the essence of sesame oil, with the three hot [substances] and salt, conquers the diseases of the ear.

original: mar dang 'o ma bskol bar gyur pa klu dang dmar po dag gis rtag tu sna yi nad dag 'joms //
analyzed: mar dang 'o ma bskol bar gyur pa klu dang dmar po dag gis rtag tu sna yi nad dag 'joms //
translated: Ghee and milk boiled together, with nƒÅga and rakta, always conquers the diseases of the nose.

original: karko t'i dang l'am ga li dang aindr'i bong bu'i chur bcas byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog /
analyzed: karko t'i dang l'am ga li dang aindr'i bong bu'i chur bcas byugs pas 'bras kyi phreng ba 'phrog /
translated: Karakota, lƒÅngalƒ´, indra, and donkey urine, applied, steal away the garland of boils.

original: lag pa dag ni rab 'phyang rkang ba'i padma mnyam pa dag dang srog gi rlung ni 'gog bya ste //üîΩji srid lus ni sa la rab @73a *//
analyzed: lag pa dag ni rab 'phyang rkang ba'i padma mnyam pa dag dang srog gi rlung ni 'gog bya ste // ji srid lus ni sa la rab @73a *//
translated: The hands hanging down, the lotus of the feet are even, and the life-wind is stopped.

original: tu lhung bar ma gyur pa dang tsha ba dag ni grol bar yang //
analyzed: tu lhung bar ma gyur pa dang tsha ba dag ni grol bar yang //
translated: As long as the body does not fall to the ground, and the fever is not released,

original: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la'o 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges 'joms snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du ting nge 'dzin la'o 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i tsher ma can ni nges 'joms snying ga'i padmar zla ba'i gzugs can dri med ri bong can mtshungs sna tshogs yum ni bsgoms pas so //
translated: again and again in concentration, the fear of death is destroyed by the thorns, meditating on the heart lotus, the moon-formed stainless hare-marked various mother.

original: sran chung btags nas 'thungs pas tsha bas rnam par bsnun pa'i mi rnams kyi ni tsher ma 'joms par byed //
analyzed: sran chung btags nas 'thungs pas tsha bas rnam par bsnun pa'i mi rnams kyi ni tsher ma 'joms par byed //
translated: The people afflicted by fever, having chewed and drunk the beans, destroy the thorns.

original: tsha ba'i mthar ni thod pa brdar ba mi bskyod bsres pa yis kyang 'jigs par byed pa 'phrog pa ste //
analyzed: tsha ba'i mthar ni thod pa brdar ba mi bskyod bsres pa yis kyang 'jigs par byed pa 'phrog pa ste //
translated: At the end of the fever, the skull is rubbed, and the fear-taking is also taken away by mixing with Akshobhya.

original: sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig dang ni badzra snga ma dag gi ming //
analyzed: sngags kyang chu me rlung rnams dag gi sngon du aom yig dang ni badzra snga ma dag gi ming //
translated: The mantra is also the syllable Om in front of the water, fire, and wind, and the name of the former Vajra.

original: de nyid kyis ni bsrung bar bya ste mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba la sogs rnams su 'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni bsrung bar bya ste mgo mgrin snying ga lte ba gsang ba la sogs rnams su 'o //
translated: One should protect it with that, in the head, throat, heart, navel, secret place, and so forth.

original: mnyam pa dh'a tri dh'a n+ya dang ni gzhan yang de bzhin tinti ri yi 'dab ma'i phyi ma dag /
analyzed: mnyam pa dh'a tri dh'a n+ya dang ni gzhan yang de bzhin tinti ri yi 'dab ma'i phyi ma dag /
translated: The equal one is the dhƒÅtrƒ´ fruit, and likewise the next leaf of the tinti·∏çƒ´ fruit.

original: nyi zla reg pa'i chu ni nges par dri ma bral ba dag la rkang pa'i lhag mar bskol bar bya //
analyzed: nyi zla reg pa'i chu ni nges par dri ma bral ba dag la rkang pa'i lhag mar bskol bar bya //
translated: The water of the contact of the sun and moon is definitely free of impurities, and the remainder of the foot is boiled.

original: de yi khu ba ka ra dang bsres gzhan pa'i nyin zhag dag nas zhag gsum 'thungs pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de yi khu ba ka ra dang bsres gzhan pa'i nyin zhag dag nas zhag gsum 'thungs pa 'di yis ni //
translated: Its juice mixed with sugar, and on another day, drinking for three days this

original: so ga nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis bsregs pa'i tsha ster 'phrog ste khams bdun song ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: so ga nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis bsregs pa'i tsha ster 'phrog ste khams bdun song ba dag kyang ngo //

original: gser la nyi ma khab len lcags dang pa ta las skyes lcags ni m'a kshi ka yis gdab par bya //
analyzed: gser la nyi ma khab len lcags dang pa ta las skyes lcags ni m'a kshi ka yis gdab par bya //
translated: Gold is struck by the sun, and iron born from magnetite is struck by mƒÅ·π£aka.

original: sa bon phyed kyis kyang ni dri ma dag dang bral ba'i dngul chu bsgongs pa srang ni drug tu bya //
analyzed: sa bon phyed kyis kyang ni dri ma dag dang bral ba'i dngul chu bsgongs pa srang ni drug tu bya //
translated: Even with half a seed, the purified mercury is boiled in six palas.

original: ba yi dar @73b ba drag po'i rtse mo can gyis bsad nas 'dir ni dvangs ma gzungs bar bya ba nyid //
analyzed: ba yi dar @73b ba drag po'i rtse mo can gyis bsad nas 'dir ni dvangs ma gzungs bar bya ba nyid //

original: dpal ldan gong bu khab len snod du slar yang bskol ba dag kyang ji srid phyed kyi tshad du 'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan gong bu khab len snod du slar yang bskol ba dag kyang ji srid phyed kyi tshad du 'o //
translated: The glorious pill, again boiled in a magnetic vessel, is reduced to half.

original: rab tu blangs  te dag pa'i ka ra srang brgyad yang na dgu ni da la bsre ba nyid du bya //
analyzed: rab tu blangs  te dag pa'i ka ra srang brgyad yang na dgu ni da la bsre ba nyid du bya //
translated: It is taken up and eight or nine palas of refined sugar are added to it.

original: de ni thams cad dus su bza' bar bya ste kha zas rnam spangs bgrod pa ji srid nyid du 'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad dus su bza' bar bya ste kha zas rnam spangs bgrod pa ji srid nyid du 'o //
translated: It should be eaten at all times, abandoning all other food, until the end of the life.

original: zla ba drug gis lha yi lus te skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral 'di yis 'chi med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis lha yi lus te skra dkar gnyer ma dang bral 'di yis 'chi med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: In six months, one attains the body of a god, free from grey hair and wrinkles, and becomes immortal.

original: de phyir de nyid nyi ma so so'i dus su bza' bar bya ste 'on kyang gong bus rnam par dman //
analyzed: de phyir de nyid nyi ma so so'i dus su bza' bar bya ste 'on kyang gong bus rnam par dman //
translated: Therefore, it should be eaten every day at the proper time, but not in excess of the pill.

original: sngar brjod sa bon rgyal po mnyam pa dag ste gzhan yang dbul chu la ni blugs pa phyed tsam mo //
analyzed: sngar brjod sa bon rgyal po mnyam pa dag ste gzhan yang dbul chu la ni blugs pa phyed tsam mo //
translated: The seed mentioned before is equal to the king, and half of it is added to the urine.

original: lan tshva sgyur po dag gis mnyes nas rnam pa mang po'i sman gyis ji srid gcig nyid du 'gyur ba //
analyzed: lan tshva sgyur po dag gis mnyes nas rnam pa mang po'i sman gyis ji srid gcig nyid du 'gyur ba //
translated: The alchemists, having melted it, with many kinds of medicines, transform it into gold.

analyzed: mkhris pa skyur pos mu zi sogs dang da ra da dang shi la dag kyang dngul chu mtshungs par mnye //
translated: And with the help of the acid of bile, realgar, etc., and with the help of the acid of urine, lead is melted like mercury.

original: de yis dngul gyi 'dab ma byugs pa gser nyid du 'gyur smin ma dag kyang phyed dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de yis dngul gyi 'dab ma byugs pa gser nyid du 'gyur smin ma dag kyang phyed dang ldan pas so //
translated: By that, a silver leaf, anointed, becomes gold, even the eyebrows, by being half-endowed.

original: rnon po nam mkha' las skyes aa la lan tshva ya ba ksha ra dang ni sardza rim pa yis //
analyzed: rnon po nam mkha' las skyes aa la lan tshva ya ba ksha ra dang ni sardza rim pa yis //
translated: The sharp one, born from the sky, is ala, and with the help of the acid of yavakshara and sarja,

original: 'phel ba dag kyang nyi ma nyis 'gyur ro mnyam byed pas nyi ma'i lhag ma dag ni bsreg par bya //
analyzed: 'phel ba dag kyang nyi ma nyis 'gyur ro mnyam byed pas nyi ma'i lhag ma dag ni bsreg par bya //

original: slar yang lan tshas dag pa dang ni de bzhin pa las byung ba la sogs kyis bran 'jam par 'gyur //
analyzed: slar yang lan tshas dag pa dang ni de bzhin pa las byung ba la sogs kyis bran 'jam par 'gyur //

original: dngul la sum cha byin zhing bkang ste bsnun pa dag kyang dag pa yi ni me tog nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: dngul la sum cha byin zhing bkang ste bsnun pa dag kyang dag pa yi ni me tog nyid du 'gyur //

analyzed: ae la la sogs cha shas grangs rnams rim pas yongs su bkod pa re mig lnga lnga dag la ste //

analyzed: rdzas ni le tshe sbyar ba'i grong khyer la gnas dag pa'i cha shas nyin zhag ces byas drir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dz'a ti la sogs ae la 'khro shing 'dab ma kee la sha yi grong du rim pas dgod bya ba //

analyzed: rgya skyegs sardza 'o ma pu ra si ta dag ste bdug pa'i bya ba rnams la bdug pa bya //
translated: The lac, sarja, milk, and p≈´rikƒÅ are the incense offerings.

analyzed: ga pur ka ra me tog ro dang ldan pa dag dang sen mo dag ni me yi cha shas kyis //

analyzed: de dag sbrang rtsi dang bral dri yi chu yis sbyar ba dag kyang spos kyi rang bur rab tu bya //

analyzed: lte ba dang po sidha m'u tra ri bong can dang nam mkha'i grong du khrus sbyor la dgod bya //
translated: The first navel is SiddhƒÅm≈´tra. In the city of the moon and sky, they are arranged for the ablution.

original: granthi stag dang ha re nu dang ha ta gzhan yang de bzhin dung ltar shun pa dag gi cha //
analyzed: granthi stag dang ha re nu dang ha ta gzhan yang de bzhin dung ltar shun pa dag gi cha //
translated: The granthi, tiger, hare, and hat, and also the shell, are the parts of the bark.

original: dh'a n+ya murbi @74b brgya yis mtshan dang da ma ma dhu ri ni de bzhin dril phyis dag la yang //
analyzed: dh'a n+ya murbi @74b brgya yis mtshan dang da ma ma dhu ri ni de bzhin dril phyis dag la yang //
translated: Dhana·πÉ, murvƒ´, ≈õata·πÉ, and damanaka·πÉ, dh≈´ri·πáƒ´, and also the grinding stone.

original: sngar brjod ma bzlog phal chu skyes bzhin du lus dang granthi parna dag kyang til mar la'o //
analyzed: sngar brjod ma bzlog phal chu skyes bzhin du lus dang granthi parna dag kyang til mar la'o //
translated: The body, and granthi, are as before, but not reversed, and par·πáa is in oil-cake.

analyzed: phye ma dag dang de bzhin 'gyur te lus dang ha ta btung ba bsgo dang kha la yang //
translated: The body, and hata, are in flour, and also in the preparation of drinks and on the lips.

original: shun pa po la granthi 'bras bu 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin dang dang ba sogs la yang //
analyzed: shun pa po la granthi 'bras bu 'dab ma sbyar ba'i smin dang dang ba sogs la yang //
translated: The skin, granthi, fruit, and leaf, are in the preparation of the ripe and unripe, and so on.

original: de ltar rab dbye sum cu dag gis leg spras rnam mang dri dang spos la sogs pa'i spyor ba bya //
analyzed: de ltar rab dbye sum cu dag gis leg spras rnam mang dri dang spos la sogs pa'i spyor ba bya //
translated: Thus, with thirty divisions, one should practice the various applications of scent, incense, and so on.

original: rdzas ni rnam par dag cing 'bras bu sbyar bas smin dang bsgoms pa dag ni phug pa dag gis kyang //
analyzed: rdzas ni rnam par dag cing 'bras bu sbyar bas smin dang bsgoms pa dag ni phug pa dag gis kyang //
translated: The pure substance, and the application of fruit, are in the ripe and the cooked, and also in the holes.

original: dang por brgyad cha 'dab ma'i dbang gis bska par 'gyur te de yi nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos //
analyzed: dang por brgyad cha 'dab ma'i dbang gis bska par 'gyur te de yi nyis 'gyur dag ni drag po'i spos //
translated: First, the eight parts are dry by the power of the leaf, and twice that is the strong incense.

original: phyi nas rdzas kyi tshad kyi bu ram dag kyang ba sreg par bya ste so ga'i sbyor ba dag las 'phel //
analyzed: phyi nas rdzas kyi tshad kyi bu ram dag kyang ba sreg par bya ste so ga'i sbyor ba dag las 'phel //
translated: Then, from the outside, one should burn the sugar-cane of the substance. It increases from the application of the spring.

original: rkang pa'i cha shas dung gi bdug pa sbrang rtsi dkar po dag kyang rdzas dang mnyam pa nges par sreg /
analyzed: rkang pa'i cha shas dung gi bdug pa sbrang rtsi dkar po dag kyang rdzas dang mnyam pa nges par sreg /

original: gong bu dung gi tshad de ma la ya dang yang dang g-yo ba zla ba ldan pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gong bu dung gi tshad de ma la ya dang yang dang g-yo ba zla ba ldan pa de bzhin no //
translated: The lump is the measure of the conch. It is the same with the Malaya, the moving, and the moon.

original: smin pa'i dri ni me tog bzang pro rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ji srid 'dod par bsgo par bya //
analyzed: smin pa'i dri ni me tog bzang pro rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' zhig ji srid 'dod par bsgo par bya //
translated: The smell of ripening is cooked for a few days with good flowers, for as long as desired.

original: phyi nas 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas 'bras bu gsum dang zla ba ma da chang dang bcas pas bya //
analyzed: phyi nas 'bugs pa brgya yi cha shas 'bras bu gsum dang zla ba ma da chang dang bcas pas bya //
translated: Then, one should make it with a hundredth part of the hole, the three fruits, the moon, and the madana with wine.

original: shi gru'i chu dang tsh'a ga m'u tra me tog bcud mnyam me tog las skyes mthar ni bskol bar bya //
analyzed: shi gru'i chu dang tsh'a ga m'u tra me tog bcud mnyam me tog las skyes mthar ni bskol bar bya //
translated: The water of the ≈õigru and the flower of the tsƒÅga, equal in essence, is boiled at the end of the flower.

original: zla ba gcig ni so ba'i smin par 'gyur te ri dvags dang mnyam chang dang lte ba 'bigs pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig ni so ba'i smin par 'gyur te ri dvags dang mnyam chang dang lte ba 'bigs pa'o //
translated: In one month, it ripens the teeth. It is equal to the deer, the wine, and the navel-piercing.

original: gsang ba dri la @75a *//
analyzed: gsang ba dri la @75a *//
translated: The secret smell

original: spu ti ras  sen mo g-yo ba spos kyi sbyor ba rnams la gsang ba ste //
analyzed: spu ti ras  sen mo g-yo ba spos kyi sbyor ba rnams la gsang ba ste //
translated: The secret of the unguents is in the application of the musk, camphor, and saffron.

original: de bzhin bsil ba tu ru ka dang gu ru ri bong can yang bsgo ba'i bya bar me tog go /
analyzed: de bzhin bsil ba tu ru ka dang gu ru ri bong can yang bsgo ba'i bya bar me tog go /
translated: Similarly, the secret of the flowers is in the application of the sandalwood, the moon, and the jasmine.

original: dbugs pa la ni ga pur lte ba 'bras bu gsum dang ma da'i chang ste yang dag khrus sbyor la //
analyzed: dbugs pa la ni ga pur lte ba 'bras bu gsum dang ma da'i chang ste yang dag khrus sbyor la //
translated: The secret of the bath is in the application of the camphor, the navel, the three fruits, and the wine of the madhuka flower.

original: gsang ba shun pa granthi parna nags su rgyu ba dang bcas granthi dril phyis dag la yang //
analyzed: gsang ba shun pa granthi parna nags su rgyu ba dang bcas granthi dril phyis dag la yang //
translated: The secret of the unguents is in the application of the bark, the granthiparna, and the granthi≈õukti together with the forest.

original: chu skyes dag pa rdzas kyis dman zhing mngar ba dag dang rnam par bral ba dri yi chu yis btags //
analyzed: chu skyes dag pa rdzas kyis dman zhing mngar ba dag dang rnam par bral ba dri yi chu yis btags //
translated: The secret of the water is in the application of the pure lotus substance, which is free from the bitter and the sweet, and is perfumed with fragrant water.

original: spos kyis smin pa bska pa drag po sbrang rtsi dang bcas lag skyes dag gis kham bu rim pas 'phel //
analyzed: spos kyis smin pa bska pa drag po sbrang rtsi dang bcas lag skyes dag gis kham bu rim pas 'phel //
translated: The secret of the ripening is in the application of the incense, the astringent, the pungent, and the honey, together with the hand-born.

original: kham bu gnyis ni ka ra bsregs pa dag ste ma la ya dang g-yo ba lcags dang ga pur yang //
analyzed: kham bu gnyis ni ka ra bsregs pa dag ste ma la ya dang g-yo ba lcags dang ga pur yang //
translated: The secret of the two fruits is in the application of the burnt sugar, the mƒÅlaya, the moving iron, and the camphor.

translated: Having been wrapped for several days with good flowers, mixed with fragrant water,

analyzed: 'jim pa'i thod pa 'dzag pa min pa spra tshil dang ni gos kyis bcings te brtan bar kha bcang la //

analyzed: shin tu che ba'i snod dam yang na sa 'og tu ste bye ma dag gis gang bar byas nas ni //
translated: in a very large vessel or underground, filled with sand,üîΩit becomes ripe with the practice of six months. That water, which is the principal essence of the navel,

analyzed: zla ba drug gi spyod pas smin par 'gyur te chu la gnas pa de ni lte ba'i gtso bo'i dri; ;til rnams 'dab ma bskol ba'i chu dag dang ni spos dang byug pa la sogs rnams kyis dag byas nas //
translated: having purified sesame seeds with the water boiled with leaves, incense, ointments, and so forth,

analyzed: phyi nas dz'a ti la sogs me tog rnams kyis nyin zhag 'ga' @75b zhig ji srid 'dod par bsgro bar bya //
translated: then for several days, as long as desired, it should be wrapped with jasmine and other flowers.

analyzed: 'khrul 'khor dag las til mar blangs nas mi yi bdag po mkhas pas 'ching bu'i snod du gzhag par bya //
