original: khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag las myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin pa min par 'gyur //
analyzed: khrus sam yan lag byug pa dag las myos byed me tog til mar nyid ni smin pa min par 'gyur //
translated: From the bathing or anointing of the limbs, the intoxicating flower is not ripe oil.üîΩThe earth, the sun, the moon, the eyes of Manu, desire, wealth, Rudra, the king, fire,

translated: the directions, the elements, the six openings, the lunar days, and the ocean are placed on the end of the eye.

analyzed: grangs ni re mig bzhi yi chu yi gter dang rtse mo can te dpal ldan 'khor lo mtha' dag ni //
translated: The number is the ocean of the four squares, the crest, and the glorious wheel in its entirety.

original: tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya //
analyzed: tshad kyi rgyab tu bris nas rab tu btsa' bar 'gyur ba'i dus su sbrum ma rnams la bstan par bya //
translated: Having written it on the back of the scale, it should be shown to pregnant women at the time of delivery.

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams gang dag rab gsal sa gzhi dag la brgyad pa brgyad kyi ma mor rab tu grags //
translated: Those yoginis who are well known as the eight mothers on the well illuminated ground.

analyzed: mngal zhes bya dang nyin zhag cas bya sum 'gyur dgu dang bcu ste bcu gcig gzhan ni lnga pa gsum //

analyzed: zla ba zhes dang lo zhes bya ste mtha' dag sa yi steng du de dag byis pa rab tu 'dzin //
translated: The terms ‚Äúmonth‚Äù and ‚Äúyear‚Äù are in their entirety on the earth. They are held by the child.

original: mngal du zug rdu dang ni rab tu bca' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid //
analyzed: mngal du zug rdu dang ni rab tu bca' ba'i dus su skye gnas la yang zug gzer byed pa nyid //
translated: In the womb, there is pain, and at the time of delivery, there is pain in the birth canal.

original: skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams la byis pa'i rgyud du 'gyur te nyin zhag dbang dang zla ba lo yi rab dbye las //
translated: For the born, there is the succession of childhood, due to the division of days, months, and years.

original: ma rungs gzhon nu lnga rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: ma rungs gzhon nu lnga rnams rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis tshigs mtshams dag la yang dag gnas gyur pa //
translated: The five evil youths, by the power of their natural qualities, abide in the joints.

original: thams cad rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de @76a *//
analyzed: thams cad rang gi tshes la 'jigs gyur byis pa 'dzin par byed de @76a *//
translated: All of them are fearful on their own days, and they hold the child.

original: rgyal po nges par gtong mi byed //
analyzed: rgyal po nges par gtong mi byed //
translated: The king does not necessarily release them.

original: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dir ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag zhi ba'i don du 'dir ni rnam mang dkyil 'khor khrus dang sbyin sreg dag tu 'gyur //
translated: For their pacification, here there are many ma·πá·∏çalas, ablutions, and homa rites.

original: ru rta au s'i ra dang ka se ru ste ta ka ra dang autpal 'dam skyes ge sar ni //üîΩbsil ba'i chu yis btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang mngal gyi zug rdu la rab sbyin //
analyzed: ru rta au s'i ra dang ka se ru ste ta ka ra dang autpal 'dam skyes ge sar ni // bsil ba'i chu yis btags shing rdo rje yis ni bsngags pa dag kyang mngal gyi zug rdu la rab sbyin //
translated: The root of the white lotus, the root of the blue lotus, the root of the red lotus, and the root of the white lotus.

original: mngal ni rengs na na ku la dang gtsug phud can gyi spu brgyad btags nas rab tu sbyin par bya //
analyzed: mngal ni rengs na na ku la dang gtsug phud can gyi spu brgyad btags nas rab tu sbyin par bya //
translated: If the womb is stiff, the root of the white lotus, the root of the blue lotus, the root of the red lotus, and the root of the white lotus.

original: 'o ma mar dang thug pa zan ni zho dang bu ram bcas pa nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin //
analyzed: 'o ma mar dang thug pa zan ni zho dang bu ram bcas pa nyin zhag ma rnams dag la sbyin //
translated: Milk, ghee, porridge, rice, curd, and sugar should be given on the days.

original: smin pa'i zas lnga tha dad zho dang bu ram dang bcas po li ka dang mo da ka dag dang // dri dang me tog mar me bkru ba dag kyang 'dab ma rnams kyis mtshan mo lnga ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: smin pa'i zas lnga tha dad zho dang bu ram dang bcas po li ka dang mo da ka dag dang // dri dang me tog mar me bkru ba dag kyang 'dab ma rnams kyis mtshan mo lnga ni rab tu bya //
translated: The five cooked foods, curd, sugar, pothika, and modaka, and incense, flowers, lamps, and bathing should be done on the five nights with the petals.

original: ba lang so dang lug gi rva dang ri dvags sen mo skra dang sbrul gyi shun ba dag gi spos //
analyzed: ba lang so dang lug gi rva dang ri dvags sen mo skra dang sbrul gyi shun ba dag gi spos //
translated: The powder of cow's horn, goat's horn, deer's hoof, hair, and snake's skin.

original: byis pa zla skyes rnams ni rgyas pa'i don du mtha' dag brjod pa rnams kyang gtor ma dag la 'o //
analyzed: byis pa zla skyes rnams ni rgyas pa'i don du mtha' dag brjod pa rnams kyang gtor ma dag la 'o //
translated: For the sake of growth, all the offerings are made to the children born in the month.üîΩThe five foods, the five articles of food, the meat of aquatic animals, scent, flowers, lamps,

original: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga dang chu la rgyu ba sha dang dri dang me tog mar me dang // chang dang sngar brjod spos dang bkru ba dag dang de bzhin phyogs kyi gtor ma dag ni phyogs kyi char //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga dang chu la rgyu ba sha dang dri dang me tog mar me dang // chang dang sngar brjod spos dang bkru ba dag dang de bzhin phyogs kyi gtor ma dag ni phyogs kyi char //
translated: wine, incense mentioned before, bathing, and likewise the offerings in the directions in the direction parts.

original: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sangs rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang //
analyzed: byis pa lor ni skyes pa rnams dag rab tu gsal bar sangs rgyas pa'i slad du mi yi dbang //
translated: The children born in the year are clearly for the sake of the Buddha, the Lord of men.

original: mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum du nges par rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu mchod pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mngal nas lo ni lnga pa gsum du nges par rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu mchod pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: For three years, definitely five years from the womb, they become the offerings of the yoginƒ´s.

original: yan lag skyong zhing mig dag na @76b ste kha dang lag pa rkang pa ser po nyid du yang dag 'gyur //
analyzed: yan lag skyong zhing mig dag na @76b ste kha dang lag pa rkang pa ser po nyid du yang dag 'gyur //
translated: The limbs are weak, the eyes are yellow, and the mouth, hands, and feet become yellow.

original: gcin ni kha dog ser po dag dang tsha ba zhes pa dang ni skyug dang skam dang brgyal par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcin ni kha dog ser po dag dang tsha ba zhes pa dang ni skyug dang skam dang brgyal par 'gyur //
translated: The urine is yellow, hot, and so on, and there is vomiting, dryness, and fainting.

original: mtshan ma rnams ni shes par gyur nas de rnams kyi yang mi bdag rgyur ni dkyil 'khor sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams ni shes par gyur nas de rnams kyi yang mi bdag rgyur ni dkyil 'khor sbyin sreg bya //
translated: Having understood the signs, one should perform the ma·πá·∏çala and homa for the sake of the king.

original: ma byin na ni gtong par mi 'gyur rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba la skyes ma mos kyang //
analyzed: ma byin na ni gtong par mi 'gyur rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis 'byung ba la skyes ma mos kyang //
translated: If one does not, he will not be released, even if he is born into a family of good qualities by the power of his nature.

original: gang gi yan lag thams cad dkar por 'gyur dang mi yi bdag po 'brum pa shin tu phra mo dang // mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa 'khyog cing kha dang gsang ba bshang lam dag las khrag ni zag gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gi yan lag thams cad dkar por 'gyur dang mi yi bdag po 'brum pa shin tu phra mo dang // mgrin pa lus dang bcas pa 'khyog cing kha dang gsang ba bshang lam dag las khrag ni zag gyur pa //
translated: If all the limbs become white, and the king has very small pox, and the throat and body are bent, and blood flows from the mouth, anus, and urethra,

original: de la mchod pa bya ba min te sngags pa rmongs pa rnams ni chung du nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mchod pa bya ba min te sngags pa rmongs pa rnams ni chung du nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
translated: he should not be worshipped. The deluded mantrin will become very small.

original: de ni 'chi bar 'gyur te nges par lha dang ma dang lag 'gro rnams kyis srung bar nus pa min //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bar 'gyur te nges par lha dang ma dang lag 'gro rnams kyis srung bar nus pa min //
translated: He will die, and it is certain that the gods, mother, and serpents are not able to protect him.

original: klu dang gnod sbyin gang yang gza' dang lha min rigs skyes srin po dag dang sha za rnams dang ni //
analyzed: klu dang gnod sbyin gang yang gza' dang lha min rigs skyes srin po dag dang sha za rnams dang ni //
translated: No nƒÅga, yak·π£a, or any planet, nor one born in the class of asura, rƒÅk·π£asa, or pi≈õƒÅca,

original: s'a ki nya dang bdug pa'i l'a ma mi khrag la dga' mkha' 'gro ma dang gzugs can ma dag dang // grul bum dag dang zhing skyong rnams dang tshogs kyi bdag po yi dvags ro langs dag dang grub pa dang // brjed byed dang bcas mkha' 'gro'i dpang rnams dkyil 'khor dag la mchod pa byas nas mchog bde byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: s'a ki nya dang bdug pa'i l'a ma mi khrag la dga' mkha' 'gro ma dang gzugs can ma dag dang // grul bum dag dang zhing skyong rnams dang tshogs kyi bdag po yi dvags ro langs dag dang grub pa dang // brjed byed dang bcas mkha' 'gro'i dpang rnams dkyil 'khor dag la mchod pa byas nas mchog bde byed par 'gyur //
translated: The Sakunis, the Lamas who delight in smoke, the Rakshasas, the female spirits, the Kumbhandas, the lords of the fields, the Ganas, the Pretas, the Vetalas, the Siddhas, the Apasmara-s, the Kinkaras, the Dakinis, the witnesses, having been worshipped in the mandala, will bring about the highest bliss.

original: ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor du 'gyur mi yi bdag po grong gi phyi rol du //
analyzed: ma rungs pa rnams mchod pa'i don du dkyil 'khor du 'gyur mi yi bdag po grong gi phyi rol du //
translated: For the purpose of worshipping the wicked, in the mandala, O lord of men, outside the village,

original: shing gi @77a *//
analyzed: shing gi @77a *//
translated: in a tree

original: gnas dang dur khrod dang ni lha mchog khang pa dag gam chu bo 'dus pa rnams su ste //
analyzed: gnas dang dur khrod dang ni lha mchog khang pa dag gam chu bo 'dus pa rnams su ste //
translated: grove, in a cemetery, in a temple of the supreme deity, or at the confluence of rivers,

original: khru gang dag gam gnyis dang bzhi ni dgu dang bcu gsum mi bdag lha rnams dag gi tshad kyis so //
analyzed: khru gang dag gam gnyis dang bzhi ni dgu dang bcu gsum mi bdag lha rnams dag gi tshad kyis so //
translated: one cubit, two, four, nine, or thirteen, O lord of men, according to the measure of the deities.

original: dbus su rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag las phyed kyi cha shas so //
analyzed: dbus su rtsibs brgyad 'khor lor 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis dkyil 'khor dag las phyed kyi cha shas so //
translated: In the center is an eight-spoked wheel, which is one-half of the mandala by the power of the family.

original: sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur te nges par de yi phyed kyis kha khyer dag dang do shal lo //
analyzed: sgo ni 'khor lo'i brgyad char 'gyur te nges par de yi phyed kyis kha khyer dag dang do shal lo //
translated: The door is one-eighth of the wheel; the ledge is definitely one-half of that.

original: rab dag ni kha khyer phyed de rta babs dag kyang sgo yi tshad las sum 'gyur dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rab dag ni kha khyer phyed de rta babs dag kyang sgo yi tshad las sum 'gyur dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The pure ledge is one-half of that; the archways are three times the size of the door.

original: zlu ma po'i thabs ni cha gsum padma dkar po'i rang bzhin dkar ba'i tsho na rnams dag gis bkang ba ste //
analyzed: zlu ma po'i thabs ni cha gsum padma dkar po'i rang bzhin dkar ba'i tsho na rnams dag gis bkang ba ste //
translated: The base is one-third; it is filled with white lotus petals, the nature of white foam.

original: dpal ldan tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi ni rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis rang gi mtshan ma bya //
analyzed: dpal ldan tshon lnga dag gis lha rnams kyi ni rang phyogs rigs kyi dbang gis rang gi mtshan ma bya //
translated: The glorious five colors are the directional deities, which are the family by the power of the family.

original: rdo rje dbus dang ral gri dbang por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lhor ni rin chen dmar po 'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbus dang ral gri dbang por 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lhor ni rin chen dmar po 'o //
translated: The vajra is in the center, the sword in the east, and by the power of the family, the jewel is red in the south.

original: g-yon du 'dab ma brgya dang bcas pa'i padma dkar po dag dang nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma dang // mer ni gri gug nges par padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du lcags kyu dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yon du 'dab ma brgya dang bcas pa'i padma dkar po dag dang nub tu 'khor lo'i mtshan ma dang // mer ni gri gug nges par padma'i 'dab ma la gnas lha min zur du lcags kyu dag tu 'gyur //
translated: in the southeast, a sword on a lotus petal; in the southwest, a goad;

original: rlung du rdo rje zhags par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po drag po'i 'dab ma dag la rtse gsum mo //üîΩshar gyi sgor ni ral gri nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pa dag ste lhor ni rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: rlung du rdo rje zhags par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po drag po'i 'dab ma dag la rtse gsum mo // shar gyi sgor ni ral gri nag po'i sprin dang mtshungs pa dag ste lhor ni rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o //
translated: in the northwest, a vajra noose; in the northeast, a trident, O King, on the petal of Rudra.üîΩAt the eastern gate, a sword, dark like a cloud; at the southern gate, a vajra club;

original: chu ru dpal ldan be con dag tu rab tu 'gyur te nges par byang du tho ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu ru dpal ldan be con dag tu rab tu 'gyur te nges par byang du tho ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: at the western gate, a glorious club; at the northern gate, a hammer.

original: sems kyi @77b rjes 'brang shes nas shin tu rnam pa mang po dus kyi 'khor lo dag ni ji srid par //
analyzed: sems kyi @77b rjes 'brang shes nas shin tu rnam pa mang po dus kyi 'khor lo dag ni ji srid par //
translated: Knowing the mind's inclinations, one should draw the many forms of KƒÅlacakra for as long as one lives.

analyzed: mo gsham rnams kyi bu yi don dang gdon gyis bcom pa'i mi rnams zhi rgyas don du 'di dag mdzod //
translated: For the sake of the sons of barren women and for the sake of pacifying and prospering the people afflicted by spirits, one should do this.

original: bum pa brgyad ni rin chen dang bcas 'dab ma padma'i kha dang so ma btang ba'i kham phor ni //
analyzed: bum pa brgyad ni rin chen dang bcas 'dab ma padma'i kha dang so ma btang ba'i kham phor ni //
translated: Eight vases, together with jewels, lotus leaves, and unbaked clay bowls,

original: bdun gyis chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bkrus te slar yang nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par bya //
analyzed: bdun gyis chu dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas bkrus te slar yang nyungs kar sogs kyis nges par bya //
translated: are washed with water and the five nectars, and again anointed with mustard seeds, and so forth.

original: dri dang bdug pa mar me rnam mang 'bras bu ro dang me tog dkar po dag dang gos rnams kyis //
analyzed: dri dang bdug pa mar me rnam mang 'bras bu ro dang me tog dkar po dag dang gos rnams kyis //
translated: Having made various offerings with perfumes, incense, lamps, various fruits, white foods, and white garments,

original: rnam par bkra ba'i mchod pa byas te slar yang de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya dag ni sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: rnam par bkra ba'i mchod pa byas te slar yang de nas zhi ba'i bsreg bya dag ni sbyin sreg bya //
translated: one should again perform the fire offerings for pacifying.üîΩWith firewood of milk-wood, sesame, and so forth, and the five milk products, one hundred oblations,

original: 'o ma so ba til la sogs dang 'o ma'i rkang 'thung lnga rnams dag gi yam shing mda' brgya dang // mchod yon dag dang spyan drangs zhal bsil dang ni de bzhin nyid du rjed dang mchod pa 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 'o ma so ba til la sogs dang 'o ma'i rkang 'thung lnga rnams dag gi yam shing mda' brgya dang // mchod yon dag dang spyan drangs zhal bsil dang ni de bzhin nyid du rjed dang mchod pa 'di dag ni //
translated: with water for the feet, water for welcoming, water for the mouth, and likewise, water for respectful offering,

original: rab mchog sa yi steng du ma mo rnams kyis gzir ba rnam dag zhi ba'i don du bya ba ste //
analyzed: rab mchog sa yi steng du ma mo rnams kyis gzir ba rnam dag zhi ba'i don du bya ba ste //
translated: these offerings are for the sake of pacifying the complete subjugation of the mƒÅt·πõs on the excellent surface of the earth.

original: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams mi yi bdag po dus kun du ni mchod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug rnal 'byor ma rnams mi yi bdag po dus kun du ni mchod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The thirty-six yoginƒ´s are always worshipped by the lords of men.

original: bdag med las kyi rnam smin srid pa gsum dang dus kyi 'gro ba yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel las //
analyzed: bdag med las kyi rnam smin srid pa gsum dang dus kyi 'gro ba yan lag bcu gnyis rten 'brel las //
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination, the three existences, and the time of the ripening of karma, which is devoid of a self,üîΩThe nine unmixed qualities of the Buddha, which arise from the twelve links of dependent origination, and the two truths,

original: yang dag byung dang rig byed bden pa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i dgu ni ma 'dres sangs rgyas chos rnams te; ;phung po lnga dang sku gsum lhan skyes shes dang de bzhin nyid du blun pa ma yin stong pa nyid //
analyzed: yang dag byung dang rig byed bden pa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba'i dgu ni ma 'dres sangs rgyas chos rnams te; ;phung po lnga dang sku gsum lhan skyes shes dang de bzhin nyid du blun pa ma yin stong pa nyid //
translated: The five aggregates, the three kƒÅyas, the innate pristine consciousness, and the non-ignorant emptiness of suchness,

original: 'di dag gang du brjod pa de ni nges par rdo rje can gyi bstan pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag gang du brjod pa de ni nges par rdo rje can gyi bstan pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
translated: Wherever these are explained, that is definitely the teaching of the vajra holder.

original: gang du rig byed @78a *//
analyzed: gang du rig byed @78a *//
translated: Where the Vedas

original: rang byung kha dang lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te //
analyzed: rang byung kha dang lag pa rkang pa la sogs dag kyang skye bo'i skye gnas te //
translated: are explained, the mouth, hands, feet, and so on are the birthplace of beings.

original: aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur //
analyzed: aa shva me dha dag las gzhan pa mchog gi chos med ces pa de ni tshangs pa'i bstan par 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no supreme Dharma other than the a≈õvamedha,‚Äù that is the teaching of BrahmƒÅ.

original: byed po bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang ni yon tan stong pa nyid ni mnyam pa'i chos //
analyzed: byed po bdag dang las dang dus dang rang bzhin dang ni yon tan stong pa nyid ni mnyam pa'i chos //
translated: The emptiness of the self, the agent, action, time, nature, and qualities is the equal nature.

original: byed po 'bras bu'i rgyu ste rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan pa de 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi 'o //
analyzed: byed po 'bras bu'i rgyu ste rab tu gsal zhing nges par bstan pa de 'dir khyab 'jug dag gi 'o //
translated: The agent is the cause of the result, clearly and definitively taught here in the body of Vi·π£·πáu.

original: lam drug rnams dang de nyid lnga dang mchog gi go 'phang ma lus pa yang gzhan ni sngags kyi lus //
analyzed: lam drug rnams dang de nyid lnga dang mchog gi go 'phang ma lus pa yang gzhan ni sngags kyi lus //
translated: The six paths, the five realities, and the supreme state, in their entirety, are also in the body of the mantra.

original: rig bdag dam pa'i zhi ba nyid dang rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa dag gi sbyor dang gtong ba'i dngos //
analyzed: rig bdag dam pa'i zhi ba nyid dang rnam gsum gnas na gnas pa dag gi sbyor dang gtong ba'i dngos //
translated: The self-awareness of the supreme self is peace, abiding in the three abodes, with the nature of union and release.

original: thig le'i dbye ba zhi ba nyid dang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: thig le'i dbye ba zhi ba nyid dang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa bcu gnyis mdud pa'i dbye ba ste //
translated: The divisions of the bindu are peace, and the twelve abodes in the entire body are the divisions of the knots.

original: 'di dag thams cad gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa yi bstan pa 'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gang du rab tu gyur pa de ni nges par zhi ba pa yi bstan pa 'o //
translated: Wherever all of these are fully transformed, that is the teaching of the peace tradition.

original: dbang phyug med cing las kyi rnam smin dag kyang yon tan yul rnams 'byung ba'i tshogs ni longs spyod pa //
analyzed: dbang phyug med cing las kyi rnam smin dag kyang yon tan yul rnams 'byung ba'i tshogs ni longs spyod pa //
translated: There is no ƒ™≈õvara, and the results of karma are the enjoyment of the collection of the arising of the objects of the qualities.

original: de med pa na 'bras bu med par gsal bar lha yi bla ma dag gi bstan par rig par bya //
analyzed: de med pa na 'bras bu med par gsal bar lha yi bla ma dag gi bstan par rig par bya //
translated: In the absence of that, the result is clearly non-existent. This is known as the teaching of the gods.

original: byed pos rgyu dang mi rgyu las skyes mtha' dag bskyed cing stag gzig rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu //
analyzed: byed pos rgyu dang mi rgyu las skyes mtha' dag bskyed cing stag gzig rnams kyi thar pa dag gi rgyu //
translated: The creator generates everything born from the moving and unmoving, the cause of liberation for tigers and leopards.

original: de mnyes pa las nges par mi rnams mtho ris su 'gyur de ni r'a hma na yi bstan pa 'o //
analyzed: de mnyes pa las nges par mi rnams mtho ris su 'gyur de ni r'a hma na yi bstan pa 'o //
translated: From pleasing him, one definitely becomes a god. This is the teaching of Rahmana.

original: dus gsum nyid dang rdzas ni drug ste tshig dgus bsgrubs dang srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
analyzed: dus gsum nyid dang rdzas ni drug ste tshig dgus bsgrubs dang srog ni drug gi lus la cha shas so //
translated: The three times themselves, the six substances, the nine established words, and the six life-breaths in the body are the parts.

original: @78b gzhin ni yod pa'i lus lnga brtul zhugs sngom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams //
analyzed: @78b gzhin ni yod pa'i lus lnga brtul zhugs sngom pa 'gro dang ye shes spyod pa dag gi dbye ba rnams //
translated: The five existing bodies, the vow of discipline, the divisions of movement and wisdom conduct,

original: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa 'o; ;gang du thar pa'i tshad ni steng du nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi bstan pa 'o //
analyzed: srog ni lus kyi tshad de dpag tu med pa'i srid pa dag gis rtag pa'i srog gis thar pa 'o; ;gang du thar pa'i tshad ni steng du nges par brjod pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi bstan pa 'o //
translated: the life-breath is the measure of the body, with immeasurable existences, the eternal life-breath is liberation. Where the measure of liberation is definitely stated above, that is the teaching of the Victorious Ones.

original: rig byed 'di ni rang byung min te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su rig byed sgra ni don rjod byed //
analyzed: rig byed 'di ni rang byung min te srid pa gsum gyi gnas su rig byed sgra ni don rjod byed //
translated: This Veda is not self-existent, for the sound of the Veda is the means of expressing the meaning in the three worlds.

original: tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gdong bzhi dag gis sngon ni rig byed sgra dag gis kyang don ni rab tu gsal bar byas //
translated: The four-faced BrahmƒÅ formerly made the meaning clear by means of the sounds of the Veda.

original: ci ste sgra dang don ni tha dad min na me sgra brjod pa dag gis kha ni cis mi sreg /
analyzed: ci ste sgra dang don ni tha dad min na me sgra brjod pa dag gis kha ni cis mi sreg /
translated: But if the sound and the meaning are not different, why does not the mouth burn when the sound ‚Äúfire‚Äù is uttered?

original: de phyir nges par ston pa po yod rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la yang //
analyzed: de phyir nges par ston pa po yod rig pa'i yul dang ma 'ongs don dang 'das pa dag la yang //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the teacher is certain. And the Veda is not like the sky, for it is the object of the intellect, and it has a future purpose and a past.

original: rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o /
analyzed: rig byed nam mkha' mtshungs min 'dir ni gnas kyi dbye ba dag las kha yis rab brjod byas pa'o /
translated: It is declared by the mouth that the Veda is not the same as the sky, because of the distinction of its abode.

original: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pa nyi tshe ba ste kun tu 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa 'o //
analyzed: rigs pas gnyis skyes kha yis bklags pa nyi tshe ba ste kun tu 'gro ba gzhan rnams klog pa 'o //
translated: The Veda is read by the mouth of the twice-born, but the other [Vedas] are read by anyone.

original: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'dri ba min //
analyzed: gang phyir dmangs la sogs pa'i rigs ni kun 'gro min pa'i rig byed 'di dag klog dang 'dri ba min //
translated: For the Veda is not read or written by the four castes, such as the ≈õ≈´dra, etc., because they are not all-pervading.

original: de phyir shes ldan mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir shes ldan mkhas par gyur pa'i mi rnams dag la rig byed dag ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for the wise and learned, the Vedas are not a source of valid knowledge.

original: gal te thams cad byed po dbang phyug yod na de yang 'gro ba'i las longs spyod po gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: gal te thams cad byed po dbang phyug yod na de yang 'gro ba'i las longs spyod po gzhan ma yin //
translated: If the creator is God, and if he is the enjoyer of the fruits of the actions of the world, then he is not different from the enjoyer.

original: gal te dbang phyug las kyi byed po min na de yang kun nas thams cad byed por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug las kyi byed po min na de yang kun nas thams cad byed por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If God is not the agent of action, then he is not the creator of everything.

original: 'di ni gal te byed po gzhan dag bskul na 'di ni byed po dag gi mchog @79a *//
analyzed: 'di ni gal te byed po gzhan dag bskul na 'di ni byed po dag gi mchog @79a *//
translated: If he is the creator of other agents, then he is the best of all agents.

original: tu gzhan dbang nyid //
analyzed: tu gzhan dbang nyid //
translated: He is not independent.

original: de phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug med de srog chags las ni dor nas so //
analyzed: de phyir dge dang mi dge'i 'bras ster byed po dbang phyug med de srog chags las ni dor nas so //
translated: Therefore, there is no God who gives the fruits of virtue and vice, because the fruits of action are discarded.

original: sa dang chu me rlung gi rdul phran 'dir ni gal te mkha' la byed po'i dang por yod pa min //
analyzed: sa dang chu me rlung gi rdul phran 'dir ni gal te mkha' la byed po'i dang por yod pa min //
translated: If the atoms of earth, water, fire, and air do not exist in space, then the creator does not exist at the beginning.

original: rdzas dag med pa la ni yul dang rnam par bral ba'i thams cad byed po sna tshogs mi byed do //
analyzed: rdzas dag med pa la ni yul dang rnam par bral ba'i thams cad byed po sna tshogs mi byed do //
translated: Without substance, the creator of everything, devoid of object, does not create diversity.

original: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi tshad ma mngon sum dang ni lkog tu gyur pa med //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par bral ba byed po 'di yi tshad ma mngon sum dang ni lkog tu gyur pa med //
translated: This creator, free from object and action, has no valid cognition, whether direct or indirect.

original: yang dag sbyor ba nyid las thams cad du 'gyur mi yi bdag po 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba nyid las thams cad du 'gyur mi yi bdag po 'dod pas ma yin las kyi gzugs //
translated: O lord of men, everything comes from right application, not from desire, as form comes from action.

original: yang dag sbyor ba las ni chu shel las kyang chu ru 'gyur te me long dag las dngos po'i gzugs //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba las ni chu shel las kyang chu ru 'gyur te me long dag las dngos po'i gzugs //
translated: From right application comes water from the water crystal and the reflection of an object from a mirror.

original: skyur ba'i rgyu las lce 'dzag rang gi sgra las gcig shos dag pa'i sa bon las ni myu gur 'gyur //
analyzed: skyur ba'i rgyu las lce 'dzag rang gi sgra las gcig shos dag pa'i sa bon las ni myu gur 'gyur //
translated: From the cause of sourness comes the flow of saliva, from the sound of one thing the cognition of another, and from a pure seed a sprout.

original: khab len las kyang lcags kyi thur ma dag ni g-yo bar 'gyur te 'dod pas 'di la ci yang min //
analyzed: khab len las kyang lcags kyi thur ma dag ni g-yo bar 'gyur te 'dod pas 'di la ci yang min //
translated: And from a magnet a needle moves, but not from desire.

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang sprul pa min //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa 'di ni srid pa gsum gyi gnas su su zhig gis kyang sprul pa min //
translated: No one has created the power of things in the three worlds.

original: gal te bdag ni kun tu 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te bdag ni kun tu 'gro na gnyen dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur //
translated: If the self is all-pervading, how can it experience the pain of separation from a loved one?

original: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni rtag par gyur na 'dod pa'i mda' yis bsnun pa'i gnas skabs nyid du cis rab 'gyur //
translated: If it is permanent, how can it be affected by the arrow of desire?

original: gal te bya ba dang bcas gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro //
analyzed: gal te bya ba dang bcas gyur na gnyid log dus su 'di ni rmongs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gro //
translated: If it is active, how can it be deluded when one is asleep?

original: de ltar nges par bdag @79b 'di kun 'gro khyab bdag dang ni sngon gyi bya ba dang ni bcas pa min //
analyzed: de ltar nges par bdag @79b 'di kun 'gro khyab bdag dang ni sngon gyi bya ba dang ni bcas pa min //
translated: Thus, the self is certainly not all-pervading, nor is it the universal lord, nor is it associated with prior action.

original: bdag med 'byung ba yod cing dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de byed pa po yis rnam par dman //
analyzed: bdag med 'byung ba yod cing dge dang mi dge'i 'bras bu yod de byed pa po yis rnam par dman //
translated: There is no self, but there is the effect of good and bad actions, and the agent is not diminished.

original: 'gro ba po med ma lus thar ba'i slad du 'gro ba yod cing 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med //
analyzed: 'gro ba po med ma lus thar ba'i slad du 'gro ba yod cing 'ching ba yod de bcings pa med //
translated: There is no goer, but there is going for the sake of the complete liberation of the world; there is bondage, but not the bound.

original: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med dag kyang yod de skad cig rnam bral rang bzhin med pa dag gi srid pa yod //
translated: There is existence and nonexistence of things, but not in the nature of momentariness; there is existence of the self, but not in the nature of momentariness.

original: 'di dag bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ste lha dang gdengs can rnams kyi don bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ste lha dang gdengs can rnams kyi don bcas tshig gis 'joms mi 'gyur //
translated: These are my true words, which cannot be destroyed by the words of gods and demons.

original: gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams //
analyzed: gang zhig de nyid gang zag ces bya lus la gnas par smra ba de ni rang bzhin dag gis nyams //
translated: The one who says that the person is in the body is destroyed by his own nature.

original: kun rdzob dag gi don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa 'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag gi don ni smra ba po yang don dam ma rig med pa dag tu 'dod pa 'o //
translated: The one who says that the meaning of the conventional is the ultimate is destroyed by his own words.

original: srid gsum mtha' dag rnam par shes pa nyid du smra ba po yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par byed //
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' dag rnam par shes pa nyid du smra ba po yang rnam par shes pa 'dod par byed //
translated: The one who says that the three worlds are consciousness is destroyed by his own consciousness.

original: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra bo phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par yang 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig snying rje stong nyid gnyis su med pa smra bo phyogs nyams de ni ma nyams par yang 'gyur //
translated: The one who says that compassion and emptiness are not two is destroyed by his own position.

original: skye bo sngon gyi las rnams nyams su myong 'gyur 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la 'o //
analyzed: skye bo sngon gyi las rnams nyams su myong 'gyur 'di la byas pa rnams ni skye ba gzhan la 'o //
translated: People experience the karma of their past actions. Those who do actions in this life will experience them in another life.

original: gal te de lta yin na lus ni 'jig par mi 'gyur mi rnams skye ba gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na lus ni 'jig par mi 'gyur mi rnams skye ba gzhan dag gis //
translated: If that is so, the body will not be destroyed. People will not be born in other lives.

original: dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur dang thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: dpag med srid pa dag gis 'khor ba las ni 'byung bar 'gyur dang thar par 'jug pa med pa nyid //
translated: There will be no escape from the infinite cycle of existence and no entry into liberation.

original: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa 'o //üîΩgal te 'byung ba gcig tu @80a *//
analyzed: 'di dag stag gzig rnams kyang nges par 'dod par 'gyur te gzhan pa'i rigs kyis rab tu dman pa 'o // gal te 'byung ba gcig tu @80a *//
translated: The Persians also believe this, but their doctrine is inferior to the others.

original: gyur pas chang gi nus pa bzhin du dbang bcas sems su rab 'gyur na //
analyzed: gyur pas chang gi nus pa bzhin du dbang bcas sems su rab 'gyur na //
translated: If the elements were to combine in a single unit, as in the case of the power of alcohol, and if the senses were to become mind,

original: shing rnams dag la ci phyir mir 'gyur sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' sbyor phyir ro; ;'di dag rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med na 'byung ba yang dag sbyor ba'i nus pa mchog tu rdzun //
analyzed: shing rnams dag la ci phyir mir 'gyur sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' sbyor phyir ro; ;'di dag rnams la skye bo'i nus pa med na 'byung ba yang dag sbyor ba'i nus pa mchog tu rdzun //
translated: why would trees not become human beings? Because of the combination of earth, water, fire, air, and space. If the elements were to combine, but the power of the person were lacking, this would be a great lie.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa'i tshig 'di dag ni mi rnams dag la bde ba'i 'bras bu ster min lam nyams so //
translated: These beautiful words of yours do not give the result of happiness to men, but are a loss of the path.

original: srog ni lus kyi tshad dag yin na gal te lag pa rkang pa bcad pas nyams par 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: srog ni lus kyi tshad dag yin na gal te lag pa rkang pa bcad pas nyams par 'gyur ram ci //
translated: If life is the measure of the body, would it be lost if a hand or a foot were cut off?

original: rtag pa dag ni lus kyi mthu las phra mor 'gyur zhing sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: rtag pa dag ni lus kyi mthu las phra mor 'gyur zhing sbom por yang ni rab tu 'gyur ram ci //
translated: Would the permanent become subtle or gross from the power of the body?

original: 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde pa dag gi gnas su 'gro /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i las las grol ba gang zhig 'jig rten steng na gnas pa bde pa dag gi gnas su 'gro /
translated: He is free from the works of transmigration, and he goes to the abodes of the gods in the world of the living.

original: 'jig rten gsum yang phra rab dag gis gang zhig bkod pa de ni dus kyis rtag tu rtag pa min //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum yang phra rab dag gis gang zhig bkod pa de ni dus kyis rtag tu rtag pa min //
translated: The three worlds are filled with atoms, but they are not permanent, because they are subject to time.

original: zhes pa la sogs ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la bstan pa rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs ye shes slad du dus kyi 'khor los sa la bstan pa rab tu gsal mdzad pa //
translated: Thus the Kalacakra, in order to attain knowledge, has illuminated the earth.

original: 'jam  dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
analyzed: 'jam  dang sra dang gzhan pa'i bag chags stobs kyis skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste //
translated: The mind of men follows the force of the impressions of softness, hardness, and the like.

original: sems ni nges par dngos po'i mtshon gyis nye bar bzhag pa dag las shes bzhin tshon ldan nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sems ni nges par dngos po'i mtshon gyis nye bar bzhag pa dag las shes bzhin tshon ldan nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: The mind is certainly colored by the objects that are placed before it.

original: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor pa yis sun mi dbyung //
analyzed: gang yin de phyir rang gzhan rigs su gyur pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang rnal 'byor pa yis sun mi dbyung //
translated: Therefore the yogin should not reject any dharma, whether of his own or another's sect.

original: chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral @80b ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gden pa 'o //
analyzed: chos ni sems can phan pa yul dang rnam par bral @80b ba dag ste chos min dag kyang gden pa 'o //
translated: Dharma is the benefit of sentient beings, and it is free from objects; adharma is also true.

original: 'tshe ba rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
analyzed: 'tshe ba rig byed tshad ma can ni bde ba'i 'bras bu mi ster dus kun du ni sdug bsngal ster //
translated: The violence of the Vedas, which is not a valid means of knowledge, does not give the fruit of happiness, but always gives suffering.

original: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can bde la rjes su chags //
analyzed: dam pa'i byams ldan rmongs pa'i tshig las mchog gi bde ba byed cing sems can bde la rjes su chags //
translated: The love of the good, which is the opposite of the words of the ignorant, gives the highest happiness and is attached to the happiness of beings.

original: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa sgom par phyir //
analyzed: de phyir sems can don ni gcig pu dag dang mi bdag yid kyis rang bzhin med pa sgom par phyir //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of beings alone, the king should meditate on the nature of mind.

original: lha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang pos steng du ni 'khor los bsgyur //
analyzed: lha mi'i bla ma nga ni mtho ris 'jig rten dag tu dbang pos steng du ni 'khor los bsgyur //
translated: I, the lord of gods and men, am in the heavenly worlds above as a universal monarch,

original: sa 'og dag tu klu ri rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun tu 'gro dang mchog pa  ste //
analyzed: sa 'og dag tu klu ri rgyal po gdengs can rigs kyis btud dang kun tu 'gro dang mchog pa  ste //
translated: in the underworld as a naga king, a serpent-hooded one, bowed to by the serpent-hooded ones, all-pervading, supreme,

original: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rig byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song //
analyzed: ye shes sangs rgyas thub dbang 'gyur med mchog dang khyab bdag rnal 'byor rnams kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor dang // rig byed aom gyi yi ge gtsang ma dag ste rgyal po dngos po kun gyis bdag la skyabs su song //
translated: the unchanging supreme sage, the lord of the buddhas, the all-pervading one, the vajra yogi of the yogis, the pure syllable Om of the Vedas, the king, I have taken refuge in all things.

original: khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
analyzed: khyod ni ma dang khyod ni pha ste khyod ni 'gro ba'i bla ma khyod ni gnyen dang grogs bzang yang //
translated: You are the mother, you are the father, you are the guru of the world, you are the friend and the good companion.

original: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phun sum tshogs pa yang //
analyzed: khyod ni mgon po khyod ni byed po phan dang sdig 'phrog khyod ni go 'phang phun sum tshogs pa yang //
translated: You are the protector, you are the creator, you are the one who takes away the good and the bad, you are the one who is endowed with the perfect state.

original: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom po khyod nyid do //
analyzed: khyod ni 'ba' zhig gnas dang khyod ni yon tan mchog gi gnas te skyon rnams bcom po khyod nyid do //
translated: You are the only one who abides, you are the abode of the supreme qualities, you are the one who has conquered the faults.

original: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi //
analyzed: khyod ni dman pa rnams kyi mgon dang yid bzhin nor bu rgyal ba'i dbang po khyod la bdag skyabs mchi //
translated: You are the protector of the lowly, you are the wish-fulfilling jewel, I go for refuge to you, the lord of the victorious ones.

original: dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo chen po las //
analyzed: dpal ldan dang po'i sangs rgyas las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo chen po las //
translated: Extracted from the glorious original Buddha, the glorious great Kalachakra.

original: nang nges pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: nang nges pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
translated: Chapter 2: The Inner Ascertainment.

original: @81a *// lus la sna tshogs tshad dang nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams dang ni //
analyzed: @81a *// lus la sna tshogs tshad dang nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus dang zla ba 'pho ba'i dbye ba rnams dang ni //
translated: The body, with its various measurements, the times of day and night, and the divisions of the lunar mansions,

original: rtsa rnams kyi ni phra mo'i grangs dang rang bzhin dag la skyes bu mu stegs rnams kyi 'dod pa dang // rig byed dang ni byed po la sogs dbye ba bdag gis thos pas dkyil 'khor dag ni bstan du gsol //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi ni phra mo'i grangs dang rang bzhin dag la skyes bu mu stegs rnams kyi 'dod pa dang // rig byed dang ni byed po la sogs dbye ba bdag gis thos pas dkyil 'khor dag ni bstan du gsol //
translated: the divisions of the Vedas, the creator, and so forth‚Äîplease teach the ma·πá·∏çalas that I have heard.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas bde bar gshegs pas dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rab tu gsungs //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Sugata fully taught the ma·πá·∏çala of the KƒÅlacakra.

original: dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing rdo rje theg par lhag par gnas //
analyzed: dang por yang dag bsten bya bla ma dag kyang dam tshig ldan zhing rdo rje theg par lhag par gnas //
translated: First, one should rely upon a guru who is endowed with samaya and is well-established in the Vajra Vehicle.

original: de nyid bsgoms shing ma chags dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam la zhugs //
analyzed: de nyid bsgoms shing ma chags dri ma dag dang rnam par bral zhing bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam la zhugs //
translated: Meditating on reality, free from attachment and impurities, and engaged in the path of patience,

original: slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog cing de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la lam ni sbyin byed dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa 'phrog cing de nyid las ni tshangs spyod ldan //
translated: he bestows the path upon the disciples, removes the fear of hell, and is endowed with pure conduct.

original: bdud rnams la ni rdo rje dbyug pa de yang 'dzin ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab grags pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams la ni rdo rje dbyug pa de yang 'dzin ma'i gzhi la rdo rje sems dpar rab grags pa'o //
translated: The vajra-club is for the demons, and the vajra is well-known as the foundation of the earth.

original: nga rgyal dang ldan khro bas zil mnan dam tshig rnams bral rdzas la brkam zhing thos pa dag kyang med //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ldan khro bas zil mnan dam tshig rnams bral rdzas la brkam zhing thos pa dag kyang med //
translated: He is haughty, overcome by anger, divorced from the commitments, greedy for substances, and also lacking in learning.

original: slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni slu ba don du gnyer zhing mchog gi bde ba'i gnas las sems nyams dbang ma bskur //
translated: He is intent on deceiving the disciples, his mind is weak in the state of supreme bliss, and he has not been initiated.

original: longs spyod dag la kun chags bag med rtsub mo'i tshig dang bcas shing dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa //
analyzed: longs spyod dag la kun chags bag med rtsub mo'i tshig dang bcas shing dbang po'i don du 'dod ldan pa //
translated: He is attached to enjoyments, careless, harsh in speech, and desirous for the sake of the senses.

original: de nyid dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa rnams kyis @81b rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya //
analyzed: de nyid dmyal ba bzhin du slob ma mkhas pa rnams kyis @81b rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyur ni spang bar bya //
translated: The wise disciples should abandon him as if he were hell, for the sake of perfect enlightenment.

original: zab cing rgya che la sems bla ma'i nges pa la dga' gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan yon tan shes //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che la sems bla ma'i nges pa la dga' gtong ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan yon tan shes //
translated: He is profound and vast, delights in the ascertainment of the guru's mind, has the nature of generosity, and knows the qualities.

original: thar pa don gnyer rgyud la gus shing g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed //
analyzed: thar pa don gnyer rgyud la gus shing g-yo ba min pa'i sems ldan de nyid thob pa shin tu sbed //
translated: That very one who has a mind that is devoted to and unmoving in the pursuit of liberation, is to be attained with great secrecy.

original: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams slob ma de nyid bla ma shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis bsdu bya ba //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams kyi grogs nyams slob ma de nyid bla ma shin tu mkhas pa rnams kyis bsdu bya ba //
translated: The friend of the wicked, that very disciple, is to be gathered by the very wise guru.

original: shes rab dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur te gzhan zhes bya ba slar yang 'bring po bsod nams dag gi rgyur //
analyzed: shes rab dbang la sogs pa'i rgyur te gzhan zhes bya ba slar yang 'bring po bsod nams dag gi rgyur //
translated: For the sake of the initiation of wisdom and so forth, and for the sake of the other, that is, the middling, merits,

original: nag po'i mthar ni dkar po'i chags la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas; ;sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya //
analyzed: nag po'i mthar ni dkar po'i chags la gzhan la phan pa'i bla mas dkyil 'khor dag ni bzhengs byas nas; ;sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bdun rnams ni bsod nams don du bu rnams dag la sbyin par bya //
translated: at the end of the dark [fortnight], the guru, who is devoted to the white [fortnight], having erected the ma·πá·∏çala, bestows the seven initiations that steal away the stains of sin for the sake of merit upon the disciples.

original: yang na mtha' dag yon tan gter ni bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / le mchod par bya //
analyzed: yang na mtha' dag yon tan gter ni bstan pa'i slad du rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / le mchod par bya //
translated: Or else, for the sake of revealing the treasure of all good qualities, the yoginƒ´s and the yogins should be worshipped.

original: mchod pa med na lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag las bla mas bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa med na lo gcig tu ni rgyud kyi rgyal po dag las bla mas bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: If there is no worship, the king of tantras should not be taught by the guru for one year.

original: dbang gi don du sa ni yongs brtag nags dang grang khyer grong rdal grong gi phyogs kyi cha dag dang // thab khung rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang ni bum pa dang bcas rdul tshon sbyin sreg phur bu la sogs dang // slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang rgyal pa'i bdag po mchog gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dag //
analyzed: dbang gi don du sa ni yongs brtag nags dang grang khyer grong rdal grong gi phyogs kyi cha dag dang // thab khung rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang ni bum pa dang bcas rdul tshon sbyin sreg phur bu la sogs dang // slob ma rnams ni bsdu ba dag dang gang yang rgyal pa'i bdag po mchog gi dkyil 'khor bri ba dag //
translated: and having gathered the disciples, and also having drawn the supreme ma·πá·∏çala of the Lord of Victors,

original: shes nas slob dpon kyis ni dge dang mi dge'i 'bras slad zhi ba la sogs mtha' dag rab tu bya //üîΩsa yi rigs ni yon @82a *//
analyzed: shes nas slob dpon kyis ni dge dang mi dge'i 'bras slad zhi ba la sogs mtha' dag rab tu bya // sa yi rigs ni yon @82a *//
translated: the master should perform all the pacifying and so on for the sake of the virtuous and non-virtuous results.

original: tan dbang gis rnam bzhir 'gyur ba dmangs rigs rje 'u rgyal po bram ze ste //
analyzed: tan dbang gis rnam bzhir 'gyur ba dmangs rigs rje 'u rgyal po bram ze ste //
translated: The types of ground become four due to the power of the qualities: ≈õ≈´dra, vai≈õya, k·π£atriya, and brahmin.

original: nag dang ser dang dmar ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa dkar ba'i kha dog rnams kyis rig par bya //
analyzed: nag dang ser dang dmar ba dang ni ri bong 'dzin pa dkar ba'i kha dog rnams kyis rig par bya //
translated: They should be known by the colors black, yellow, red, and white like the moon.

original: rul pa chu skyes padma'i dri dang mchog gi dri rnams rim pas nor gyi blo gros dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rul pa chu skyes padma'i dri dang mchog gi dri rnams rim pas nor gyi blo gros dag tu 'gyur //
translated: The smells of rottenness, lotus, and the supreme smell become the minds of wealth in order.

original: skyur dang lan tshva dmangs rigs mngar dang tsha ba rje dang mi bdag gzhan pa dag ni gnyis skyes so //
analyzed: skyur dang lan tshva dmangs rigs mngar dang tsha ba rje dang mi bdag gzhan pa dag ni gnyis skyes so //
translated: Sour and salty are for the ≈õ≈´dra caste; sweet and pungent are for the k·π£atriya and master.

original: dkar po dag ni zhi dang rgyas pa la ste sprin nag dang mtshungs bsad dang bskrad pa dag la yang //
analyzed: dkar po dag ni zhi dang rgyas pa la ste sprin nag dang mtshungs bsad dang bskrad pa dag la yang //
translated: White is for pacifying and increasing; black is for killing and expelling.

original: dmar po dbang dang dgug pa la ste mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa rengs dang rmongs pa la yang 'gyur //
analyzed: dmar po dbang dang dgug pa la ste mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa rengs dang rmongs pa la yang 'gyur //
translated: Red is for controlling and summoning; yellow is for paralyzing and confusing.

original: las kyi cha ni thams cad dag la ljang khur gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs //
analyzed: las kyi cha ni thams cad dag la ljang khur gyur te lnga pa dang ni mtha' ma dag gi rigs //
translated: Green is for all types of activities; the fifth and last are the families.

original: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //üîΩdbang ldan dang ni byang gi sa gzhi dag la zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag tu 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: ro dang dri rnams thams cad dang ldan mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya // dbang ldan dang ni byang gi sa gzhi dag la zhi ba dang ni rgyas pa dag tu 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The yogin should know that all tastes and smells are the treasure of qualities.üîΩIn the northeast and north, there is pacifying and increasing;

original: me yi mtshams dang shar gyi char ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par bsad pa dag dang bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: me yi mtshams dang shar gyi char ni rab tu gsal zhing nges par bsad pa dag dang bskrad pa'o //
translated: in the southeast and east, there is clear and certain killing and expelling.

original: bden bral dang ni lho phyogs su yang gsal bar rtag tu dbang du bya dang dgug pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: bden bral dang ni lho phyogs su yang gsal bar rtag tu dbang du bya dang dgug pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: In the southwest and south, one should always clearly summon and attract.

original: rlung gi mtshams dang nub kyi phyogs su nges par mchog gi mi bdag rangs pa dang ni rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams dang nub kyi phyogs su nges par mchog gi mi bdag rangs pa dang ni rmongs pa'o //
translated: In the northwest and west, one should certainly delight and confuse the best of men.

original: thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dag tu nges par rab tu 'gyur te zlum po dang ni @82b chu gter zur //
analyzed: thab khung grong gi phyogs brgyad dag tu nges par rab tu 'gyur te zlum po dang ni @82b chu gter zur //
translated: In the eight directions of the village, the hearth is certainly excellent: round, with a water-pitcher spout,üîΩhalf-moon, five-cornered, seven-cornered by the power of natural qualities, three-cornered,

original: zla kham zur lnga pa dang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zur bdun pa dang zur ni gsum pa dang // zur drug pa dang zur brgyad par 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis de dag rnams kyi snying po'i mtshan ma ni //
analyzed: zla kham zur lnga pa dang rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis zur bdun pa dang zur ni gsum pa dang // zur drug pa dang zur brgyad par 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis de dag rnams kyi snying po'i mtshan ma ni //
translated: six-cornered, and eight-cornered. By the power of the family, their essential signs are:

original: padma 'khro lo gri gug ral gri mda' zhes bya dang rdo rje lcags kyu lcags sgrog dag dang sbrul //
analyzed: padma 'khro lo gri gug ral gri mda' zhes bya dang rdo rje lcags kyu lcags sgrog dag dang sbrul //
translated: lotus, wheel, flaying knife, sword, arrow, vajra, iron hook, and chain.

original: gcig gnyis phyed dang gcig ni khru ste mkha' dus mkha' mig mkha' me mkha' dus dag ni sor du 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig gnyis phyed dang gcig ni khru ste mkha' dus mkha' mig mkha' me mkha' dus dag ni sor du 'gyur //
translated: One, two, and one and a half cubits are the measures of space, time, space, eye, space, fire, and space.

original: phyed kyi yan lag drug gi cha shas nyi ma nyi ma'i cha shas dag gis zabs dang kha khyer dang // mchu dang mtshan ma'i phreng bar 'gyur te kha khyer dag gi steng du rigs kyi dbang gis kun nas so //
analyzed: phyed kyi yan lag drug gi cha shas nyi ma nyi ma'i cha shas dag gis zabs dang kha khyer dang // mchu dang mtshan ma'i phreng bar 'gyur te kha khyer dag gi steng du rigs kyi dbang gis kun nas so //
translated: The garland of signs is on the width, and on the outside of the width, the petals of the lotus are on the top, for the sake of the family, in all cases.

original: kha khyer phyi rol du yang chu skyes 'dab ma rnams mdzod mi bdag zhi rgyas la ste gzhan la min //
analyzed: kha khyer phyi rol du yang chu skyes 'dab ma rnams mdzod mi bdag zhi rgyas la ste gzhan la min //
translated: For peace and increase, not for the others.

original: yang na las ni thams cad la yang rdo rjer 'gyur te sa la phur ba dag gi dbye ba brgyad //
analyzed: yang na las ni thams cad la yang rdo rjer 'gyur te sa la phur ba dag gi dbye ba brgyad //
translated: Or else, for all actions, it is a vajra, with eight divisions, the stakes in the ground.

original: n+ya gro dha dang aa shvadtha ka rus lcags seng ldeng las skyes ts'u ta bil pa aarka skyes //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha dang aa shvadtha ka rus lcags seng ldeng las skyes ts'u ta bil pa aarka skyes //
translated: Born from the nyagrodha, the a≈õvattha, the iron-wood tree, the sƒÅl tree, the ca·πÉpaka, the bilva, the arka,

original: de bzhin shel gyi bum pa dang ni dngul mchog rang bzhin dpal ldan thod pa dag dang lcags kyi dang // zangs zhes bya dang gser gyi bum pa rab gsal nges par shing las skyes dang sa yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin shel gyi bum pa dang ni dngul mchog rang bzhin dpal ldan thod pa dag dang lcags kyi dang // zangs zhes bya dang gser gyi bum pa rab gsal nges par shing las skyes dang sa yi rang bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, a crystal vase, and a silver one, a skull-cup, an iron one, a copper one, a golden vase, a very clear one, certainly born from a tree, and one made of earth.

original: zlum po brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i bcu yis dpangs dang sor gnyis dag gi mchu //
analyzed: zlum po brgyad gnyis sor du brjod de gnyis kyis bsgyur pa'i bcu yis dpangs dang sor gnyis dag gi mchu //
translated: The height is ten finger-breadths, and the lips are two finger-breadths.üîΩThe throat is six finger-breadths, and the mouth is eight finger-breadths.

original: drug gi mgrin pa sor brgyad kha ste ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar zhi @83a *//
analyzed: drug gi mgrin pa sor brgyad kha ste ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar zhi @83a *//
translated: It is white like the moon, peaceful, and full.

original: rgyas dag la'o gzhan la min //
analyzed: rgyas dag la'o gzhan la min //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: snga dro nas ni thun brgyad po rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su zhi dang rgyas pa sogs la 'gyur //
analyzed: snga dro nas ni thun brgyad po rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su zhi dang rgyas pa sogs la 'gyur //
translated: From morning, the eight periods are for the times of the days for pacifying, enriching, and so forth.

original: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su las brgyad dag ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: de bzhin de yi thun phyed dag la nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su las brgyad dag ni rab tu bya //
translated: Likewise, in the half periods of that, the eight activities are to be performed in the times of day and night.

original: nyi ma gung dang mtshan phyed dag ni nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhi ba dag la spang bar bya //
analyzed: nyi ma gung dang mtshan phyed dag ni nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su zhi ba dag la spang bar bya //
translated: At midday and midnight, the pacifying [activities] are to be abandoned in the times of day and night.

original: dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa dag ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed de bzhin nyid du rab tu grags //
analyzed: dus sbyor gdug pa'i gza' rnams gnas pa dag ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed de bzhin nyid du rab tu grags //
translated: The periods and the evil planets are abiding. They are the bringers of the fear of death, just as it is well known.

original: 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mda' brgya zhi dang rgyas pa dag la bsad pa la ni mi rus so; ;dbye ba la ni bya rog mjug ma seng ldeng las skyes kengshu ka ni dgug dang dbang la 'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas yam shing mda' brgya zhi dang rgyas pa dag la bsad pa la ni mi rus so; ;dbye ba la ni bya rog mjug ma seng ldeng las skyes kengshu ka ni dgug dang dbang la 'o //
translated: For pacifying and enriching, one should offer one hundred oblations of sticks with milk. For killing, one should use human bone. For separating, one should use the tail of a crow. For summoning and enthralling, one should use khadira wood.

original: bil ba smyo byed dag ni khru phyed mda' brgya'i grangs rnams rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa dag la ste //
analyzed: bil ba smyo byed dag ni khru phyed mda' brgya'i grangs rnams rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa dag la ste //
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, one should use bilva wood, half a cubit long, in the number of one hundred oblations.

original: 'o ma mar dang khrag dang zhag dang rdul dang rdo rje chu dang mchil ma chang rnams bsreg bya ste //
analyzed: 'o ma mar dang khrag dang zhag dang rdul dang rdo rje chu dang mchil ma chang rnams bsreg bya ste //
translated: One should offer oblations of milk, clarified butter, blood, marrow, semen, urine, saliva, and beer.üîΩOne should offer oblations of durva grass, grains, meat, poison, and likewise black mustard seeds, red flowers,

original: dur ba 'bru dang sha dang dug dang bcas pa dag dang de bzhin ske tshe me tog dmar po dang // bil ba rnying pa'i phreng ba dang ni gser bzang me tog rnams nyid zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'o //
analyzed: dur ba 'bru dang sha dang dug dang bcas pa dag dang de bzhin ske tshe me tog dmar po dang // bil ba rnying pa'i phreng ba dang ni gser bzang me tog rnams nyid zhi ba la sogs rnams la 'o //
translated: old bilva garlands, and excellent golden flowers for pacifying and so on.

original: gshin rje bden bral zur dang char bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin drag po dbang po dag dang me ru ni //
analyzed: gshin rje bden bral zur dang char bcas rlung dang gnod sbyin drag po dbang po dag dang me ru ni //
translated: In the directions of Yama, Nair·πõti, Varuna, VƒÅyu, Yak·π£a, Rudra, and Agni,

original: slob dpon dag gi gdan du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag la 'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dag gi gdan du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po zhi ba la sogs las rnams dag la 'o //
translated: The teacher becomes the seat of the master, and the lord of men, in the rites of pacification, etc.

original: tshon ni las gnyis dag la 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma la @83b yang dkar nag nyi ma ser po'o //
analyzed: tshon ni las gnyis dag la 'gyur te gtso bo'i padma la @83b yang dkar nag nyi ma ser po'o //
translated: The colors are for the two rites: the lotus of the chief deity is white, and the sun is yellow.

original: phyi rol du ni sangs rgyas dbye bas lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang rnams dag tu tshon gyis sa //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni sangs rgyas dbye bas lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang rnams dag tu tshon gyis sa //
translated: Outside, the colors are for the directions of the gods, Yama, Water, and the Gandharvas, by the division of the Buddhas.

original: thab khung dag gam dkyil 'khor la ni rigs kyi dbang gis phyogs rnams su yang tshon ni gdab par 'gyur //
analyzed: thab khung dag gam dkyil 'khor la ni rigs kyi dbang gis phyogs rnams su yang tshon ni gdab par 'gyur //
translated: In the hearth or in the mandala, the colors are also cast in the directions by the power of the family.

original: dgod pa la sogs bsang gtor la sogs rang gi snying kha'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro ba 'o //
analyzed: dgod pa la sogs bsang gtor la sogs rang gi snying kha'i rdo rje dag las lha rnams spro ba 'o //
translated: The emission, etc., and the sprinkling, etc., are the emission of the deities from the vajra in one's heart.

original: shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bong dag ni bcu gnyis kyang //
analyzed: shel la sogs pa'i mchod yon snod la padma nor gyi 'dab ma mthe bong dag ni bcu gnyis kyang //
translated: The offering-water vessel of crystal, etc., has a lotus and a wealth-leaf, and the thumbs are twelve.

original: yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i snod de khyor ba dag kyang bsreg bya dag la 'o //
analyzed: yu ba'i rtse mor snyim pa'i snod de khyor ba dag kyang bsreg bya dag la 'o //
translated: The vessel of the cupped hands at the tip of the handle is also the ladle for the burnt offerings.

original: zhi dang drag po chags dang bcas par 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha ni rengs pa dag gi sku //
analyzed: zhi dang drag po chags dang bcas par 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lha ni rengs pa dag gi sku //
translated: The deities of the wrathful and peaceful families are respectively white and black, and the deities of the desire family are white with a black luster.

original: de bzhin las gnyis dag la rab tu gsal zhing nges par dkyil 'khor la yang lhag pa'i lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin las gnyis dag la rab tu gsal zhing nges par dkyil 'khor la yang lhag pa'i lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the deities of the two action families are clearly distinguished in the mandala, and the deities of the lotus family are the predominant deities in the mandala.

original: rnam pa lnga ni rgyal ba'i dbang po gang phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas phung po khams sogs kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni rgyal ba'i dbang po gang phyir rnam gsum srid pa la gnas phung po khams sogs kyi //
translated: The five aspects of the victorious lords are due to the three existences, the aggregates, elements, and so forth,

original: dbye ba yis te de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur //
analyzed: dbye ba yis te de las kyang ni lha rnams dkyil 'khor dag la rdul tshon rnam pa lnga ru 'gyur //
translated: and from them the deities in the mandala become the five colors of the colored powders.

original: thig skud khru ni brgyad bar 'gyur ta sum sgril slob dpon gyi ni lag pa'i mthe bo'i nas gcig gis //
analyzed: thig skud khru ni brgyad bar 'gyur ta sum sgril slob dpon gyi ni lag pa'i mthe bo'i nas gcig gis //
translated: The chalk line is eight cubits long, triple-twisted, and one span long for the master‚Äôs hand.

original: spoms su 'gyur pa rnam pa gsum gyi lam na gnas pa'i thig skud gcig ste gzhan pa ma yin no; ;zhi ba la sogs dag la rim pa yongs su bkod pa skyil krung rdo rje lha min tsog pu dang // skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis dang bshang lam rkang par gnas pa dag kyang las kyi @84a *//
analyzed: spoms su 'gyur pa rnam pa gsum gyi lam na gnas pa'i thig skud gcig ste gzhan pa ma yin no; ;zhi ba la sogs dag la rim pa yongs su bkod pa skyil krung rdo rje lha min tsog pu dang // skyil krung phyed pa dbye ba gnyis dang bshang lam rkang par gnas pa dag kyang las kyi @84a *//
translated: In the case of pacifying and so forth, the arrangement of the stages is the vajra posture, the half-vajra posture, and the posture of the demigods,

original: dbye bas gdan //
analyzed: dbye bas gdan //
translated: divided into two, and also the posture of the anus and feet, divided by action.

original: shel dang mu tig dang ni mi dang bong bu'i so 'am rus pa dag dang bo de tse dang ni //
analyzed: shel dang mu tig dang ni mi dang bong bu'i so 'am rus pa dag dang bo de tse dang ni //
translated: Crystal, pearl, human, donkey teeth or bones, and bodhidruma,

original: padma zhes bya dbang mig lung thang bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis sngags bzlas pa la phreng bar 'gyur //
analyzed: padma zhes bya dbang mig lung thang bde gshegs rigs kyi dbang gis sngags bzlas pa la phreng bar 'gyur //
translated: and lotus, are called rosaries for mantra recitation, by the power of the Tathagata family.

original: dri zhim me tog dkar po dang ni tsha ba dang bcas nag po dag dang dmar dang ser pos mchod //
analyzed: dri zhim me tog dkar po dang ni tsha ba dang bcas nag po dag dang dmar dang ser pos mchod //
translated: White fragrant flowers, and with heat, black, red, and yellow are for worship.

original: bsil dang bshang ba sha yi spos ni sbrang rtsi khrag ldan dag dang drag po'i sbos dang bska ba 'o //
analyzed: bsil dang bshang ba sha yi spos ni sbrang rtsi khrag ldan dag dang drag po'i sbos dang bska ba 'o //
translated: Cool, feces, meat incense, honey, blood, fierce incense, and astringent.

original: 'khrul 'khor n+ya gro dha 'dab dur khrod ro yi ras dang gro ga'i 'dab dang aarka'i 'dab ma la //üîΩshi ri khanda s'a li btags pa dag dang dur khrod sar gnas sol ba khrag dang dug dang ni //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor n+ya gro dha 'dab dur khrod ro yi ras dang gro ga'i 'dab dang aarka'i 'dab ma la // shi ri khanda s'a li btags pa dag dang dur khrod sar gnas sol ba khrag dang dug dang ni //
translated: On a wooden board, a leaf of the banyan tree, a cloth from a corpse, a birch bark, or an arka leaf,üîΩone should draw with the juice of red arsenic, blood, poison,

original: kha che tsandan dmar dang 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba yung ba bab blas bri par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: kha che tsandan dmar dang 'bras bu gsum gyi khu ba yung ba bab blas bri par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: and red sandalwood from Kashmir, or with soot, lac, or ink, on a cloth from a charnel ground,

original: dur ba bsil rus mjug sgro gser dang seng ldeng las skyes bil ba skyes dang aarka smyug gu 'o //
analyzed: dur ba bsil rus mjug sgro gser dang seng ldeng las skyes bil ba skyes dang aarka smyug gu 'o //
translated: a quill from a corpse, a peacock feather, or a quill from a wing, or with a golden or khadira pen,üîΩon a potsherd, a skull, or a brick, with the three sweet things, blood, and beeswax,

original: kham phor dpal ldan thod par mngar gsum khrag dang spra tshil gong bu so phag dag gi dbus su ni; ;rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ba dag dang ro khang sa gzhi me yis gdung dang sa dag la //
analyzed: kham phor dpal ldan thod par mngar gsum khrag dang spra tshil gong bu so phag dag gi dbus su ni; ;rlan dang bcas pa'i gnas ni gtsang ba dag dang ro khang sa gzhi me yis gdung dang sa dag la //
translated: in a moist place, a clean place, a charnel ground, on heated ground, or on earth.

original: 'khrul 'khor gzhag par bya bar 'gyur te dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis sngags pa yis ni rig par bya //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gzhag par bya bar 'gyur te dge dang mi dge'i dbang gis sngags pa yis ni rig par bya //
translated: One should place the yantra there, and the mantrin should know it by its auspicious or inauspicious indications.

original: zla ba glang chen yi dvags rda mo ri dvags rta dang phyugs dang rus sbal lus la rim pas so //
analyzed: zla ba glang chen yi dvags rda mo ri dvags rta dang phyugs dang rus sbal lus la rim pas so //
translated: The moon, elephant, ghost, dog, deer, horse, cow, and tortoise bodies are in order.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis phyogs kun tu @84b gnas mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg bya ste //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje rnams kyis phyogs kun tu @84b gnas mtha' dag bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg bya ste //
translated: The glorious vajra-holders should completely burn the hosts of demons in all directions.

original: phyi nas 'khro lo rtsibs bcu dag la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas 'khro lo rtsibs bcu dag la phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas khro bo'i tshogs ni bsgom par bya //
translated: Then, on the ten spokes of the wheel, in the cardinal and intermediate directions, one should visualize the hosts of wrathful ones.

original: 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang dus kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbus su gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag dang dus kyi zhal ldan khro bo'i dbang po rdo rje shugs //
translated: In the center of the wheel, with two extra hands and four faces, is the wrathful lord Vajravega.

original: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de nas bla ma'i nges pa dang ldan gang zhig cung zad 'dod pa sgrub pa po yis bsgrub par bya //
translated: Then, the adept who possesses the certainty of the guru and desires a little accomplishment should practice.

original: rdo rje gsum gyis sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas ra ba gsum ni ring du mthong pa'i mtha' ru ste //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyis sa yi dkyil 'khor la gnas ra ba gsum ni ring du mthong pa'i mtha' ru ste //
translated: On the surface of the earth, the three fences are seen in the distance by the three vajras.

original: tho rangs nas ni grib ma'i mtha' ru sa gzhi'i gnas las nam mkha' dag la rdo rje brtseg pa 'o; ;dbus su chu skyes nyi ma'i khru ste lte pa gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang dus kyi khrur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tho rangs nas ni grib ma'i mtha' ru sa gzhi'i gnas las nam mkha' dag la rdo rje brtseg pa 'o; ;dbus su chu skyes nyi ma'i khru ste lte pa gdan dang bcas pa dag kyang dus kyi khrur 'gyur ro //
translated: In the center, the lotus and sun are one cubit, and the seat is one cubit in time.üîΩAbove that, the yogƒ´, free from faults, should meditate.

original: de yi steng du bdag nyid nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya; ;sa yi phyogs rnams su 'dir dang po rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste //
analyzed: de yi steng du bdag nyid nyes pa dag dang rnam par bral ba rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya; ;sa yi phyogs rnams su 'dir dang po rdo rje gsum gyis zhing skyong rnams la gtor ma sbyin bya ste //
translated: In the directions of the ground, here first, with the three vajras, one should offer sacrificial cakes to the field protectors.

original: phyi nas rdo rje bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas rdo rje bzhi yis phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas bdud kyi tshogs ni nges par bsreg par bya //
translated: Then, with the four vajras, in the directions and quarters, one should definitely burn the hosts of demons.

original: sa yi lha mo spyan drangs chu dang bcas pa'i me tog dag gis 'di la mchod yon rab tu sbyin //
analyzed: sa yi lha mo spyan drangs chu dang bcas pa'i me tog dag gis 'di la mchod yon rab tu sbyin //
translated: Having invoked the goddess of the earth, one should offer a welcome drink to her with water and flowers.

original: de la gsol ba btab ste phyi nas sa yi gnas la dag pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa mdzod //
analyzed: de la gsol ba btab ste phyi nas sa yi gnas la dag pa dag ni ji ltar 'dod pa mdzod //
translated: Having requested her, one should then purify the site of the earth as one wishes.

original: rgyal bas lha yi bdag po dang bcas bdud ni bcom pa dag la lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
analyzed: rgyal bas lha yi bdag po dang bcas bdud ni bcom pa dag la lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //
translated: The Victorious One, having conquered the powerful hosts of Mara for the sake of enlightenment, said to the Goddess: You are my witness!

original: de phyir khyod ni mchod par bya zhing lha mchog gis btud @85a *//
analyzed: de phyir khyod ni mchod par bya zhing lha mchog gis btud @85a *//
translated: Therefore, you are to be worshipped, O Goddess, and bowed to by the best of gods.

original: bzhes shig bzhes shig bdag gi mchod yon no //
analyzed: bzhes shig bzhes shig bdag gi mchod yon no //
translated: Accept, accept my libation!

original: ji ltar rgyal bas byang chub slad du bdud kyi sde ni stobs ldan dag kyang rab tu bcom gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal bas byang chub slad du bdud kyi sde ni stobs ldan dag kyang rab tu bcom gyur pa //
translated: Just as the Victorious One, for the sake of enlightenment, completely defeated the powerful hosts of Mara,

original: de bzhin bdag gis kyang ni slob ma rnams la dbang bskur slad du bdud rnams nyams ba dag tu bya //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis kyang ni slob ma rnams la dbang bskur slad du bdud rnams nyams ba dag tu bya //
translated: in the same way, I too, for the sake of conferring initiation on my disciples, will defeat the Maras.

original: gang dag phyogs rnams kun na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnam bral btsun mo dang bcas pa //
analyzed: gang dag phyogs rnams kun na sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' nyes pa rnam bral btsun mo dang bcas pa //
translated: All the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who are free from faults, together with their queens, in all the directions,

original: de dag rnams kyi mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur slad du bdag la bskyang du gsol //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur slad du bdag la bskyang du gsol //
translated: may they, with their supreme compassion, protect me in the mandala for the sake of conferring initiation.

original: de dag kun la gsol ba btab nas seng ldeng rang bzhin sra ba'i phur bu dag gis sa la gdab //
analyzed: de dag kun la gsol ba btab nas seng ldeng rang bzhin sra ba'i phur bu dag gis sa la gdab //
translated: Having made this request to them all, one should drive in the stakes made of k~s~mari wood with the mantra:

original: phyogs kyi khro bo mtshon cha ldan pa rnams ni phyogs kyi cha ru bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
analyzed: phyogs kyi khro bo mtshon cha ldan pa rnams ni phyogs kyi cha ru bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
translated: The wrathful ones with weapons in the directions should be placed in the directional parts for the sake of protection.

original: zug rdu sol ba dang bcas rva ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed sa yi snying por nges par zhugs gyur na //
analyzed: zug rdu sol ba dang bcas rva ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed sa yi snying por nges par zhugs gyur na //
translated: The spike with charcoal, the horn, the destroyer of death, is certainly placed in the heart of the earth.üîΩIn those places, the qualities are impaired by power, and therefore they should be purified.

original: gnas de dag tu yon tan dbang gis rnam par nyams par 'gyur te de yis phyir na sbyang par bya; ;sa la rin chen dung dang ma ching bu dag ni rnam rgyal bde byed dkyil 'khor dag gi don du ste //
