translated: is the vajra sign of all. Or it is the lotus of space, the mother of the Lord of Victors.

original: zhal dang gsang ba dag kyang thab khung rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te rgyal po phyi dang lus la 'o //
analyzed: zhal dang gsang ba dag kyang thab khung rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te rgyal po phyi dang lus la 'o //
translated: The mouth and the secret are the two hearths, the king and the body.

original: thabs kyi phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor dag la khro bo'i rgyal po lha mor bcas pas srung ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: thabs kyi phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor dag la khro bo'i rgyal po lha mor bcas pas srung ba byas nas ni //
translated: The mandala of the ten directions of the method is protected by the king of wrathful ones together with the goddesses.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje dag gis bsang ba sogs dang chur bcas me tog rnams kyis @92b me la mchod yon nyid //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje dag gis bsang ba sogs dang chur bcas me tog rnams kyis @92b me la mchod yon nyid //
translated: The glorious vajra purifies, and so forth, and the fire is worshipped with flowers and water.

original: de yi rnal 'byor ldan pas sbyin par byas te rang snying padmar zla ba'i steng du bsgoms nas so //
analyzed: de yi rnal 'byor ldan pas sbyin par byas te rang snying padmar zla ba'i steng du bsgoms nas so //
translated: The one possessing this yoga should offer it, having meditated on it on a moon in the lotus of one's heart.

original: zhal gcig kha dog dkar po dus kyi phyag gi padma g-yon na ril ba chu skyes dag dang ni //
analyzed: zhal gcig kha dog dkar po dus kyi phyag gi padma g-yon na ril ba chu skyes dag dang ni //
translated: One-faced, white, with a lotus in the left hand of the time mudra, and a water-born conch in the left,

original: g-yas na dbyug pa bgrang phreng ral pa shin tu ser skya dmar ser mig ldan gos dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: g-yas na dbyug pa bgrang phreng ral pa shin tu ser skya dmar ser mig ldan gos dang bcas pa ste //
translated: with a staff and rosary in the right, with tawny-red hair, red eyes, and garments,

original: me yi snying gar zla ba'i steng du dri med 'phro byed dza las lcags kyu nges par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: me yi snying gar zla ba'i steng du dri med 'phro byed dza las lcags kyu nges par bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on a hook definitely arising from the ja syllable on a moon in the heart of the fire, radiating stainless light.

original: de yis bkug pa'i kun 'gro ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la shin tu ro mnyam dag tu mdzod //
analyzed: de yis bkug pa'i kun 'gro ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la shin tu ro mnyam dag tu mdzod //
translated: The all-pervading gnosis being summoned by that, one should make it completely of the same taste as one‚Äôs body.

original: de ltar thab la yang ni yang dag 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin me ni spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar thab la yang ni yang dag 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin me ni spyan drang ngo //
translated: Thus, the fire is completely transformed, and the fire is summoned in the same way, O lord of men.

original: mchog sbyin lag pa dag gi mthe bo yis kyang me yi zhal du sbyin sreg dag ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: mchog sbyin lag pa dag gi mthe bo yis kyang me yi zhal du sbyin sreg dag ni rab tu bya //
translated: With the thumb of the boon-granting hand, one should perform the fire sacrifice into the mouth of the fire.

original: gtso bo'i rdo rje yan lag gis kyang mda' brgya'i yam shing 'bru dang dur ba mar dang 'o ma yis //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rdo rje yan lag gis kyang mda' brgya'i yam shing 'bru dang dur ba mar dang 'o ma yis //
translated: With the principal vajra limb, one should also offer a hundred oblations of sticks, grains, and durva grass with ghee and milk.

original: skyil krung du gnas rab tu zhi zhing g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan gsang sngags rig pa sngags kyi sku //üîΩslob dpon las kyi rdo rje can gyis slar yang me la bsreg blugs dag ni nges par sbyin par bya //
analyzed: skyil krung du gnas rab tu zhi zhing g-yo ba med pa'i sems ldan gsang sngags rig pa sngags kyi sku // slob dpon las kyi rdo rje can gyis slar yang me la bsreg blugs dag ni nges par sbyin par bya //
translated: Seated cross-legged, with a peaceful and unwavering mind, the mantra body of the mantra adept,üîΩthe master, the vajra worker, should again definitely offer oblations into the fire.

original: rim pa yis ni sbyin sreg byas nas 'thor 'thung dag kyang de bzhin me dang bdag nyid dag la yang //
analyzed: rim pa yis ni sbyin sreg byas nas 'thor 'thung dag kyang de bzhin me dang bdag nyid dag la yang //
translated: Having performed the fire sacrifice in stages, one should also offer water and food to the fire and oneself.

original: dri la sogs dang spos dag phul nas rang snying padmar ye shes me ni gshegs su gsol bar  bya //
analyzed: dri la sogs dang spos dag phul nas rang snying padmar ye shes me ni gshegs su gsol bar  bya //
translated: Having offered incense and so forth, one should request the wisdom fire to enter one's lotus heart.

original: phyi nas slob ma la ni dbang bskur dpal ldan bla ma mtha' dag yon tan gter gyis nges par sbyin //
analyzed: phyi nas slob ma la ni dbang bskur dpal ldan bla ma mtha' dag yon tan gter gyis nges par sbyin //
translated: Afterwards, one should bestow the empowerment upon the disciple, the glorious guru, the treasure of all good qualities.

original: dang por @93a *//
analyzed: dang por @93a *//
translated: First,

original: bdud rtsi lnga ni rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa dag pa'i slad du 'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga ni rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa dag pa'i slad du 'o //
translated: the five nectars are consecrated by the supreme Victorious One's vajra for the sake of purity.

original: rang gi sngags kyis sbyin sreg grub cing rdul tshon btab ste sngags kyi mtshan la rab tu bkod pa na //
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyis sbyin sreg grub cing rdul tshon btab ste sngags kyi mtshan la rab tu bkod pa na //
translated: Having performed the fire offering with one's mantra and sprinkled the colored sand, one should establish the name of the mantra.

original: zur du shel gyi bum pa dkar po skud pa lnga yis dkris pa rnams ni yang dag gzhag par bya //
analyzed: zur du shel gyi bum pa dkar po skud pa lnga yis dkris pa rnams ni yang dag gzhag par bya //
translated: To the side, one should place white crystal vases wrapped with five-colored thread.

original: slob dpon shar gyi zhal du rdo rje padma las skyes rab bgrod khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag gis //
analyzed: slob dpon shar gyi zhal du rdo rje padma las skyes rab bgrod khro bo'i rgyal po rnams dag gis //
translated: The master, with the wrathful kings born from the vajra and lotus in his mouth,

original: spyan drangs nas ni ye shes 'khor lo rdul tshon dag la ro mnyam du bya dbang gi don du 'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs nas ni ye shes 'khor lo rdul tshon dag la ro mnyam du bya dbang gi don du 'o //
translated: having invited the wisdom wheel, should make it of the same taste as the colored sand for the sake of empowerment.

original: lha dang lha mo rnams ni thams cad bdag gi ming ni sngon du aom zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo rnams ni thams cad bdag gi ming ni sngon du aom zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: All the gods and goddesses have my name at the beginning, preceded by Om.

original: sbyin sreg la ni sv'ah'a'i mtha' sngags snying po de bzhin nyid de mchod pa dag la na ma: 'i mtha'//
analyzed: sbyin sreg la ni sv'ah'a'i mtha' sngags snying po de bzhin nyid de mchod pa dag la na ma: 'i mtha'//
translated: In the case of homa, the essence mantra ends with Svaha; in the case of offerings, with Namas.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: lcags kyu la sogs rim pas yongs su bkod rnams spyan drang gzhug dang bcing ba dang // mnyes la 'o mchod yon sbyin pa la yang ai dam grihna grihna aargham kam me zhes par 'gyur //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: lcags kyu la sogs rim pas yongs su bkod rnams spyan drang gzhug dang bcing ba dang // mnyes la 'o mchod yon sbyin pa la yang ai dam grihna grihna aargham kam me zhes par 'gyur //
translated: Ja Hum Vam Ho are the seed syllables of the hook and so forth, which are arranged in order. They are used for inviting, entering, binding, and delighting. For offering water for welcoming, the mantra is Idam Griha Na Arghkam Khamme.

original: rgyas pa la ni sv'ah'a'i mtha' yi sngags su 'gyur te mi bdag zhi ba la 'di na ma: 'i mtha'//
analyzed: rgyas pa la ni sv'ah'a'i mtha' yi sngags su 'gyur te mi bdag zhi ba la 'di na ma: 'i mtha'//
translated: For increasing, the mantra ends with Svaha. For pacifying, O King, it ends with Namas.

original: dgug pa la ni boo shat mtha' ru 'gyur te boo shat mtha' yang dbang la de bzhin nyid du ni //
analyzed: dgug pa la ni boo shat mtha' ru 'gyur te boo shat mtha' yang dbang la de bzhin nyid du ni //
translated: For summoning, the mantra ends with Vaushat. For enthralling, it ends with Vaushat as well.

original: h'um yig mtha' can mngon spyod la ste rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis phat mtha' phur bus gdab sogs la'o //
analyzed: h'um yig mtha' can mngon spyod la ste rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis phat mtha' phur bus gdab sogs la'o //
translated: For destroying, it ends with Hum. For striking with a kƒ´la and so forth, it ends with Phat, according to the nature of the qualities.

original: dkar dang dmar dang nag po mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa dag ste las kyi dbye ba dag @93b gis sngags //
analyzed: dkar dang dmar dang nag po mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa dag ste las kyi dbye ba dag @93b gis sngags //
translated: White, red, and black, and supreme gold, by the division of action.

original: shar du dpal ldan thugs kyi rdo rje dag ni sprin nag dang mtshungs byang du sku yi rdo rje dang // lho ru gsung gi rdo rje nub tu yang ni rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa ye shes rdo rje ste; ;dkar dang dmar dang ser po dag ni rigs kyi dbang gis sa yi cha la khyab par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: shar du dpal ldan thugs kyi rdo rje dag ni sprin nag dang mtshungs byang du sku yi rdo rje dang // lho ru gsung gi rdo rje nub tu yang ni rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa ye shes rdo rje ste; ;dkar dang dmar dang ser po dag ni rigs kyi dbang gis sa yi cha la khyab par byed par 'gyur //
translated: In the east, glorious Vajra Mind, like a black cloud; in the north, Vajra Body; in the south, Vajra Speech; and in the west, also in one's own family direction, Vajra Wisdom, white, red, and yellow, pervade the ground by the power of the families.

original: rlung me chu dang sa yi lha rnams dag gi skye ba'i gnas ni mi bdag ai ri au li 'o //
analyzed: rlung me chu dang sa yi lha rnams dag gi skye ba'i gnas ni mi bdag ai ri au li 'o //
translated: The abodes of the gods of wind, fire, water, and earth are the vowels.

original: aom a'a: h'um ni phyag rgya gsum ste sv'ah'a'i tshig dang bcas pa ring po'i dbye ba las kyang lnga //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ni phyag rgya gsum ste sv'ah'a'i tshig dang bcas pa ring po'i dbye ba las kyang lnga //
translated: Om, ah, hum are the three seals, along with the word svaha, and also five by the division of the long ones.

original: h'um a'a: aom ho rang gi zhal rnams gzhan pa dag kyang de bzhin gzhom du med pa lnga par 'gyur //
analyzed: h'um a'a: aom ho rang gi zhal rnams gzhan pa dag kyang de bzhin gzhom du med pa lnga par 'gyur //
translated: Hum, ah, om, ho, are one's own faces, and the others are also thus, becoming the five invincible ones.

original: aa sogs dang bcas hram yig drug ste ro rkang na ma: sogs kyi dpal ldan yan lag drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: aa sogs dang bcas hram yig drug ste ro rkang na ma: sogs kyi dpal ldan yan lag drug tu 'gyur //
translated: The six syllables beginning with A and ending with HRAUM are the six limbs of the glorious one.üîΩThe syllable PHREM is the Prajnaparamita, and the mantra of the tenfold summit is that of the Jinas.

original: phrem gyi yi ge sna tshogs yum gyi 'gyur te rnam bcu brtsegs pa'i sngags ni rgyal ba dag gi 'o; ;h'um yig ye shes sa bon snying po dag kyang brtsegs pa chen po'i sngags ni zhal dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: phrem gyi yi ge sna tshogs yum gyi 'gyur te rnam bcu brtsegs pa'i sngags ni rgyal ba dag gi 'o; ;h'um yig ye shes sa bon snying po dag kyang brtsegs pa chen po'i sngags ni zhal dang bcas pa ste //
translated: The syllable HUM is the seed of gnosis, and the mantra of the great summit is that of the face.

original: h'um yig la sogs yan lag drug po sku yi rdo rje dang por ldan pa 'di ni nye snying ngo //
analyzed: h'um yig la sogs yan lag drug po sku yi rdo rje dang por ldan pa 'di ni nye snying ngo //
translated: The six limbs beginning with HUM, endowed with the first of the Vajra Body, are the quintessence.

original: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi phreng ba'i sngags ni de bzhin gzhan te las kyi dbye ba du ma yis //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi phreng ba'i sngags ni de bzhin gzhan te las kyi dbye ba du ma yis //
translated: The garland mantras of the gods and goddesses are different, according to the many divisions of action.

original: rnam mang du 'gyur shes par bya ste dus 'khor dkyil 'khor 'dir ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis so; ;rin chen gser zla me tog dang ni rnam pa mang po'i gos dang dri dang spos dang mar me dang // dril bu me long bla re dang ni rnam mang 'bras bu dan sogs dang gar dang rol mo yis //
analyzed: rnam mang du 'gyur shes par bya ste dus 'khor dkyil 'khor 'dir ni rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis so; ;rin chen gser zla me tog dang ni rnam pa mang po'i gos dang dri dang spos dang mar me dang // dril bu me long bla re dang ni rnam mang 'bras bu dan sogs dang gar dang rol mo yis //
translated: Bells, mirrors, canopies, and various fruits, banners, and so on, with dance and music,

original: @94a *// rnam bkra mchod pa byas te gzhan pa rnam bcu dag kyang bdag nyid nus pas ji ltar gsungs ba bzhin //
analyzed: @94a *// rnam bkra mchod pa byas te gzhan pa rnam bcu dag kyang bdag nyid nus pas ji ltar gsungs ba bzhin //
translated: Having made colorful offerings, one should also make the other ten offerings as much as one is able, as taught.

original: slob dpon dag gi zhabs kyi rtsa bar mchog gi bu yis yon ni dag pa'i slad du dbul bar bya //
analyzed: slob dpon dag gi zhabs kyi rtsa bar mchog gi bu yis yon ni dag pa'i slad du dbul bar bya //
translated: The supreme son should offer the fee at the feet of the master for the sake of purifying.

original: dge ba gsum gyi rdzas dang bdag nyid bu dang bu mo dang bcas rigs las skyes pa'i gzhon nu ma //
analyzed: dge ba gsum gyi rdzas dang bdag nyid bu dang bu mo dang bcas rigs las skyes pa'i gzhon nu ma //
translated: The substances of the three virtues, oneself, sons, and daughters, and young maidens born into the family,

original: de ring nyid nas mi bzad 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag ni rgyal ba rnams la skyabs su lhag par mchi //
analyzed: de ring nyid nas mi bzad 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag ni rgyal ba rnams la skyabs su lhag par mchi //
translated: From this very day, those who are terrified by the unbearable samsara go for refuge to the victors.

original: khyed kyi zhabs kyi chu skyes nges par srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog dag la lus ngag sems ni dag pas so //
analyzed: khyed kyi zhabs kyi chu skyes nges par srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog dag la lus ngag sems ni dag pas so //
translated: With a pure body, speech, and mind, you must definitely take refuge in the lotus feet of the one who steals the fear of existence.

original: zhes pa gser bcas me tog dag gis mandal byas nas bla ma la ni gsol ba gdab par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pa gser bcas me tog dag gis mandal byas nas bla ma la ni gsol ba gdab par 'gyur //
translated: Having made a ma·πá·∏çala of flowers with gold, one should supplicate the guru.

original: 'dod pa'i rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya bla ma dag kyang spyi bos gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya bla ma dag kyang spyi bos gzung bar bgyi //
translated: One should also hold on one‚Äôs crown the guru, the desire-vajra, the bell, and the mudra.

original: rin chen la ni sbyin pa sbyin bgyi 'khor lo 'di la rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig bskyang bar bgyi //
analyzed: rin chen la ni sbyin pa sbyin bgyi 'khor lo 'di la rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig bskyang bar bgyi //
translated: One should give gifts to the jewel, and one should maintain the pledge of the supreme victor on this wheel.

original: ral gri la ni mchod pa bgyi ste gsal bar chu skyes rigs la sngom pa dag ni bskyang bar bgyi //
analyzed: ral gri la ni mchod pa bgyi ste gsal bar chu skyes rigs la sngom pa dag ni bskyang bar bgyi //
translated: One should make offerings to the sword, and one should maintain the vow of the clear lotus family.

original: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la byang chub bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i slad du rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la byang chub bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
translated: For the sake of liberating sentient beings, I should generate enlightenment in the family that generates the victors.

original: slob ma khrus byas dri yis rjes byugs brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan shar gyi sar ni bzhag byas te /
analyzed: slob ma khrus byas dri yis rjes byugs brtul zhugs nges pa dang ldan shar gyi sar ni bzhag byas te /
translated: Having bathed the disciple and anointed him with scent, having placed him in the east with a firm vow,

original: dngos grub don du so shing rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rje dag gis mngon par bsngags pa rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: dngos grub don du so shing rgyal ba mchog gi rdo rje dag gis mngon par bsngags pa rab sbyin bya //
translated: For the sake of spiritual powers, one should give the tooth stick, consecrated with the mantra of the supreme victor Vajra.

original: lce la'ang bdud rtsi nges par rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig dag gis spos ni dbab pa'i @94b don du'o //
analyzed: lce la'ang bdud rtsi nges par rgyal ba mchog gi dam tshig dag gis spos ni dbab pa'i @94b don du'o //
translated: One should also place nectar on the tongue, consecrated with the mantra of the supreme victor's pledge, for the sake of descent of the deity.

original: sngags ni h'um gi yi ge gcig ste aa ra la dang bcas pa khro bo'i gtso bo bskul ba 'o //
analyzed: sngags ni h'um gi yi ge gcig ste aa ra la dang bcas pa khro bo'i gtso bo bskul ba 'o //
translated: The mantra is the single syllable h≈´·πÉ, along with ƒÅra la, invoking the chief of wrathful ones.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po phebs na mtshon chas mdzes pa'i lag pa dag gis bdud kyi tshogs la sdigs byed cing //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po phebs na mtshon chas mdzes pa'i lag pa dag gis bdud kyi tshogs la sdigs byed cing //
translated: When the king of wrathful ones arrives, with hands adorned with weapons, he threatens the hosts of demons.

original: g-yon brkyang la sogs stabs rnams dang ni rnam mang bcing ba dag gis rdo rje'i gar gyis gar byed de //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang la sogs stabs rnams dang ni rnam mang bcing ba dag gis rdo rje'i gar gyis gar byed de //
translated: With the dance steps such as left leg extended and so forth, and with various bindings, he performs the vajra dance.

original: bzhad dang h'um gi yi ge 'dres pa dgra la 'jigs pa ster ba dang ni rdo rje'i glu yang byed //
analyzed: bzhad dang h'um gi yi ge 'dres pa dgra la 'jigs pa ster ba dang ni rdo rje'i glu yang byed //
translated: With the mixed laughter and h≈´·πÉ syllable, he bestows fear on the enemy and also sings the vajra song.

original: ngo tsha med cing dogs pa med par 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lha gzhan dag kyang zhi ba 'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med cing dogs pa med par 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis lha gzhan dag kyang zhi ba 'o //
translated: He becomes shameless and fearless, and even other deities become pacified due to the power of qualities.

original: sku phebs pas ni rnal 'byor ldan pa rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sku yi bya ba byed pa ste //
analyzed: sku phebs pas ni rnal 'byor ldan pa rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sku yi bya ba byed pa ste //
translated: By the descent of the Body, the possessor of Yoga becomes the agent of the action of the Body by the power of the natural qualities.

original: gsung phebs pas ni lha dang 'byung po lha min rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i smra ba po ru 'gyur //
analyzed: gsung phebs pas ni lha dang 'byung po lha min rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i smra ba po ru 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of the Speech, he becomes the speaker who is victorious over the gods, the spirits, and the titans.

original: thugs phebs pas ni gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa dag dang byung dang 'byung ba thams cad shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: thugs phebs pas ni gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa dag dang byung dang 'byung ba thams cad shes par 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of the Mind, he knows the thoughts of others, the past and the future.

original: ye shes phebs pas sangs rgyas bla ma yi yang bla ma rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pur 'gyur //
analyzed: ye shes phebs pas sangs rgyas bla ma yi yang bla ma rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pur 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of the Gnosis, he becomes the sole teacher who possesses the magic power of the Buddha, the Guru of the Gurus.

original: sa phebs pas ni rnal 'byor pa dag ri dang mtshungs par 'gyur te chus kyang bsil ba rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sa phebs pas ni rnal 'byor pa dag ri dang mtshungs par 'gyur te chus kyang bsil ba rab tu 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of the Earth, the yogi becomes like a mountain, and is also cooled by water.

original: mi phebs pas ni sreg par 'gyur te rlung gis kyang ni de bzhin skam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mi phebs pas ni sreg par 'gyur te rlung gis kyang ni de bzhin skam pa dag tu rab tu 'gyur //
translated: By the non-descent, he is burned, and is also dried up by the wind.

original: stong pa phebs pa sa mi snang bar 'gyur sa steng du ni mkha' la spyod pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa phebs pa sa mi snang bar 'gyur sa steng du ni mkha' la spyod pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of the Void, he becomes invisible on the surface of the earth, and becomes a sky-goer.

original: de bzhin gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rim pa yis ni rig par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis rim pa yis ni rig par bya //
translated: Likewise, all things, such as form, should be known in order by the power of the nature and qualities.

original: dbab @95a *// pa la ni nges par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po sngags pa rnams kyis sgom pa'i stobs dang ni //
analyzed: dbab @95a *// pa la ni nges par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po sngags pa rnams kyis sgom pa'i stobs dang ni //
translated: The descent is certain, O lord of men, by the power of meditation of the mantrin,

original: bsnyen pa'i dbye ba dang ni rnam mang dam tshig sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis 'ga' zhig dag gi tshe //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dbye ba dang ni rnam mang dam tshig sngags kyi bzlas pa sogs kyis 'ga' zhig dag gi tshe //
translated: By the division of the approach, and by the many kinds of mantra recitation and so forth, at some time

original: sangs rgyas ro myang byed pas bdud rtsi'i dbang las dkyil 'khor 'ga' zhig tu ni mchog gi bu la 'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ro myang byed pas bdud rtsi'i dbang las dkyil 'khor 'ga' zhig tu ni mchog gi bu la 'o //
translated: The supreme son is empowered in some ma·πá·∏çala by the taste of the nectar of the buddhas.

original: rang byin rlabs pas dman pa rnam mang srid bdag gis sngags pa rnams la dngos grub yod pa min //
analyzed: rang byin rlabs pas dman pa rnam mang srid bdag gis sngags pa rnams la dngos grub yod pa min //
translated: By self-consecration, there is no accomplishment for the mantrin of the many inferior lords of existence.

original: phebs pa btang ste phyi nas mgo bo dang ni snying ga spyi gtsug lte ba dag dang mgrin pa dang // gsang bar rgyal ba dang ni rang gi rigs kyi sar gnas rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: phebs pa btang ste phyi nas mgo bo dang ni snying ga spyi gtsug lte ba dag dang mgrin pa dang // gsang bar rgyal ba dang ni rang gi rigs kyi sar gnas rang gi rdo rje gsum gyis bsrung bar bya //
translated: Having sent forth, one should protect the head, heart, crown of the head, navel, throat, and the secret place with one‚Äôs own three vajras, abiding in the stage of the victor and one‚Äôs own family.

original: lus la ser po'i gos dag byin te mig ni bsgribs par gyur pa'i slob ma 'dir ni gzhug par bya //
analyzed: lus la ser po'i gos dag byin te mig ni bsgribs par gyur pa'i slob ma 'dir ni gzhug par bya //
translated: And, having given him yellow garments, he should be made to enter here, with his eyes covered, as a disciple.

original: kun rdzob don du brtul zhugs rab mchog bgrod pa dag la bgrod pa de dag nyid ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: kun rdzob don du brtul zhugs rab mchog bgrod pa dag la bgrod pa de dag nyid ni sbyin par bya //
translated: The five virtues of the yogin are: To travel on the road of the best of observances for the sake of the relative, to give oneself to those who travel that road,

original: 'tshe dang mi bden gzhan gyi bud med spang bya gzhan gyi nor dang chang gi btung ba de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'tshe dang mi bden gzhan gyi bud med spang bya gzhan gyi nor dang chang gi btung ba de bzhin nyid //
translated: To avoid violence, untruth, and another's wife, and also another's property and intoxicating drinks.üîΩ These five sins destroy the fetters of the world and one's own virtue.üîΩ The name of the Guru of gods and men, who appeared at such a time, should be given to him.üîΩ This is the word of the chief of the various (sects), which destroys the fear of the world, and you also should protect it.üîΩ The five vices of the yogin are: Gambling, eating forbidden food, reading bad books, worshipping the spirits, and the worship of the Asuras.

original: 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa dag ste rang gi dge ba 'joms byed sdig pa lnga po 'di dag go /
analyzed: 'khor bar rdo rje'i zhags pa dag ste rang gi dge ba 'joms byed sdig pa lnga po 'di dag go /
translated: The five virtues are: To travel on the road of the best of observances for the sake of the relative, to give oneself to those who travel that road,üîΩ To avoid violence, untruth, and another's wife, and also another's property and intoxicating drinks.üîΩ These five sins destroy the fetters of the world and one's own virtue.

original: gang zhig gang gi dus su byung ba lha dang mi yi bla ma de yi mtshan gyis rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi dus su byung ba lha dang mi yi bla ma de yi mtshan gyis rab sbyin bya //
translated: The name of the Guru of gods and men, who appeared at such a time, should be given to him.

original: sna tshogs gtso bo'i bka' 'di srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste khyod kyis kyang ni bskyang bar bya //
analyzed: sna tshogs gtso bo'i bka' 'di srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa dag ste khyod kyis kyang ni bskyang bar bya //
translated: This is the word of the chief of the various (sects), which destroys the fear of the world, and you also should protect it.üîΩ The five vices of the yogin are: Gambling, eating forbidden food, reading bad books, worshipping the spirits, and the worship of the Asuras.üîΩ The five virtues are: To travel on the road of the best of observances for the sake of the relative, to give oneself to those who travel that road,üîΩ To avoid violence, untruth, and another's wife, and also another's property and intoxicating drinks.üîΩ These five sins destroy the fetters of the world and one's own virtue.

original: cho lo kha na ma thob bcas pa'i zas dang tshig ngan klog dang 'byung bo lha min dbang po'i chos //
analyzed: cho lo kha na ma thob bcas pa'i zas dang tshig ngan klog dang 'byung bo lha min dbang po'i chos //
translated: The name of the Guru of gods and men, who appeared at such a time, should be given to him.üîΩ This is the word of the chief

original: ba lang byis pa @95b bud med skyes pa rnams dang lha mi'i bla ma gsod pa lnga ni mi bya 'o //
analyzed: ba lang byis pa @95b bud med skyes pa rnams dang lha mi'i bla ma gsod pa lnga ni mi bya 'o //
translated: One should not kill cows, children, women, men, or the gurus of gods and men.

original: grogs po rje bo rnams dang lha dang mi yi bla ma dge 'dun yid brtan rnams la 'khu ba yang //
analyzed: grogs po rje bo rnams dang lha dang mi yi bla ma dge 'dun yid brtan rnams la 'khu ba yang //
translated: One should not betray friends, masters, gods, men, gurus, or the Sa·πÖgha.

original: dbang po rnams ni chags bdag dang de ltar srid pa'i bdag po dag gi brtul zhugs nyi shu lnga //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni chags bdag dang de ltar srid pa'i bdag po dag gi brtul zhugs nyi shu lnga //
translated: The sense faculties are the lords of existence, and thus the vows of the lords of existence are twenty-five.

original: dpal ldan sngags kyis mngon par ba sngags te lag pa'i padma sbyar bar me tog gcig ni rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: dpal ldan sngags kyis mngon par ba sngags te lag pa'i padma sbyar bar me tog gcig ni rab sbyin bya //
translated: Having recited the glorious mantra, one should offer a flower with the gesture of the lotus hand.

original: dang por lan gsum bskor te lag pa'i padma sbyar ba dag las dkyil 'khor du ni me tog dor //
analyzed: dang por lan gsum bskor te lag pa'i padma sbyar ba dag las dkyil 'khor du ni me tog dor //
translated: First, having circumambulated three times, one should cast the flower into the ma·πá·∏çala with the gesture of the lotus hand.

original: gang gi gnas su me tog bzang po lhung ba de ni mi yi bdag po de yi rigs su nges //
analyzed: gang gi gnas su me tog bzang po lhung ba de ni mi yi bdag po de yi rigs su nges //
translated: The place where the good flower falls, that is the family of that lord of men.

original: phyi nas dbang ni bdun po dag nang rnam gsum 'dir na ji bzhin bla med yang dag rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: phyi nas dbang ni bdun po dag nang rnam gsum 'dir na ji bzhin bla med yang dag rab sbyin bya //
translated: After that, the seven empowerments, which are threefold here, should be perfectly given according to the unsurpassed rite.

original: klu dang bzhi yi nor bu gser gyi bum pa dag gam rgyal po sa yi rang bzhin rin chen bcas //
analyzed: klu dang bzhi yi nor bu gser gyi bum pa dag gam rgyal po sa yi rang bzhin rin chen bcas //
translated: The vases of the four nƒÅgas, gold, and jewels, or the king, earth, and jewels.

original: sman dang dri dang ldan pa'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis lha mo rnams kyi khrus bya 'o //
analyzed: sman dang dri dang ldan pa'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis lha mo rnams kyi khrus bya 'o //
translated: The goddesses are bathed with the victorious and extremely victorious vases, with medicine and scent.

original: sangs rgyas rab tu dbye bas cod pan sbyin te mchog gi bla mas nus ma rnams kyi dar dpyangs nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rab tu dbye bas cod pan sbyin te mchog gi bla mas nus ma rnams kyi dar dpyangs nyid //
translated: The supreme guru gives the crown, the ribbon of the yoginƒ´s, by the division of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje dril bu nyi zla las te brtul zhugs dag kyang dbang por bcas pa'i yul gyis sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu nyi zla las te brtul zhugs dag kyang dbang por bcas pa'i yul gyis sbyar bar bya //
translated: The vajra and bell are from the sun and moon, and the observances are applied with the sense objects.

original: khro bo rnams kyis byams sogs ming ste gsal bar rgyal ba'i bdag pos rjes gnang 'dogs bcas rab tu sbyin //
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyis byams sogs ming ste gsal bar rgyal ba'i bdag pos rjes gnang 'dogs bcas rab tu sbyin //
translated: The wrathful ones have the names of love, and so on, and the clear permission of the victor is given with the name.

original: rdo rje dril bu rab tu byin nas rab mchog snying rje dag gis dag pa'i chos ni bstan par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu rab tu byin nas rab mchog snying rje dag gis dag pa'i chos ni bstan par bya //
translated: Having given the vajra and bell, the pure Dharma is taught with the supreme compassion.

original: nges par rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni srog gcod bya ste ral gri la yang bden pa min pa'i tshig /
analyzed: nges par rdo rje'i rigs dag la ni srog gcod bya ste ral gri la yang bden pa min pa'i tshig /
translated: Certainly, one should kill for the vajra family, and lie for the sword family.

original: rin chen @96a *//
analyzed: rin chen @96a *//
translated: For the jewel family, one should take the wealth of others, and for the lotus family, one should take the wives of others.

original: la ni gzhan nor dbrog bya mchog gi padma'i rigs nyid la yang gzhan gyi bud med dbrog /
analyzed: la ni gzhan nor dbrog bya mchog gi padma'i rigs nyid la yang gzhan gyi bud med dbrog /
translated: In the Lotus family, one should steal the supreme lotus, that is, another‚Äôs wife.

original: chang dang sgron ma sangs rgyas rnams dang bzang po'i yul rnams mtha' dag 'khor lo la ni brten par bya //
analyzed: chang dang sgron ma sangs rgyas rnams dang bzang po'i yul rnams mtha' dag 'khor lo la ni brten par bya //
translated: In the Wheel family, one should rely on the beer, the lamp, the buddhas, and all the excellent objects.

original: gnos pa mo sogs mtha' dag bud med rnams ni gri gug la yang mkha' yi padmar smad mi bya //
analyzed: gnos pa mo sogs mtha' dag bud med rnams ni gri gug la yang mkha' yi padmar smad mi bya //
translated: In the Vajra family, one should not despise any woman, even a low-caste woman, or the lotus of the sky.

original: sems can don gyi slad du nor dang bcas pa'i lus 'di sbyin par bya ste khyod kyis bsrung mi bya //
analyzed: sems can don gyi slad du nor dang bcas pa'i lus 'di sbyin par bya ste khyod kyis bsrung mi bya //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, one should give this body, along with one‚Äôs wealth, and one should not protect it.

original: rigs kyi bu kye sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan du mtha' yas bskal pas min par rgyal bas gsungs //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu kye sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba gzhan du mtha' yas bskal pas min par rgyal bas gsungs //
translated: O son of good family, the Victorious One has said that buddhahood is attained in another way, not through infinite eons.

original: chu ni sgrol ma la sogs lha mo cod pan zhes pa rgyal ba dpa' bo 'dir dpyangs nus ma rnams //
analyzed: chu ni sgrol ma la sogs lha mo cod pan zhes pa rgyal ba dpa' bo 'dir dpyangs nus ma rnams //
translated: The goddesses TƒÅrƒÅ and so forth, whose crowns are the buddhas, are the heroines who are able to be suspended here.

original: rdo rje dril bu nyi zla dag dang brtul zhugs dag kyang yul te ming ni byams sogs sbyor ba'o; ;rjes gnang rdzogs pa'i byang chub dbal mi srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu nyi zla dag dang brtul zhugs dag kyang yul te ming ni byams sogs sbyor ba'o; ;rjes gnang rdzogs pa'i byang chub dbal mi srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms dus kyi 'khor lo rjes su rig pa ste //
translated: The vajra, the bell, the sun and moon, the observances, and the object, the name, which is the union with Maitreya, and so forth.

original: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bskur bdun po 'di dag dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dri ma 'phrog pa'i dbang bskur bdun po 'di dag dkyil 'khor du ni yang dag rab sbyin bya //
translated: These seven empowerments, which bestow the consecration that seizes the immaculate, should be perfectly bestowed in the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: dbang bdun dag gis mngon par dbang bskur dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi ni dbang phyug nyid du bsgyur //
analyzed: dbang bdun dag gis mngon par dbang bskur dge ba'i dbang gis sa bdun gyi ni dbang phyug nyid du bsgyur //
translated: By the seven empowerments, one is consecrated, and by the power of the virtue, one is transformed into the lord of the seven levels.

original: bum pa gsang bas mngon par dbang bskur slar yang phyir mi ldog pa sogs su nges par rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: bum pa gsang bas mngon par dbang bskur slar yang phyir mi ldog pa sogs su nges par rab tu 'jug /
translated: Having been consecrated with the secret and the vase, one definitely enters into the stage of irreversibility, and so forth.

original: shes rab ye shes dag gis mngon par dbang bskur srid pa'i  'jigs pa 'joms @96b pa'i 'jam dbyangs nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes dag gis mngon par dbang bskur srid pa'i  'jigs pa 'joms @96b pa'i 'jam dbyangs nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Having been consecrated with the wisdom-knowledge, one becomes Ma√±jugho·π£a, who conquers the fear of existence.

original: gal te g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung na dmyal bar 'gro ste 'di dag sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gal te g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis rtsa ba'i ltung ba byung na dmyal bar 'gro ste 'di dag sdug bsngal lo //
translated: If one commits a root downfall through the power of deceit, one goes to hell. These are the sufferings.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te yon tan ldan pa dbang bdun la gnas dag gi 'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te yon tan ldan pa dbang bdun la gnas dag gi 'o //
translated: One becomes pure of the root downfalls, and one who possesses the qualities abides in the seven empowerments.

original: bum pa gsang ba la ni gal te brtul zhugs nges pa'i dbang gis gong ma la ni dag pa med //
analyzed: bum pa gsang ba la ni gal te brtul zhugs nges pa'i dbang gis gong ma la ni dag pa med //
translated: If one is in the vase or secret empowerment, there is no purification in the higher ones through the power of the definite conduct.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung pa byung ba gang zhig dag pa'i slad du slar yang dkyil 'khor 'dir ni 'jug bya ste //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung pa byung ba gang zhig dag pa'i slad du slar yang dkyil 'khor 'dir ni 'jug bya ste //
translated: One who has a root downfall should enter this mandala again for the sake of purification.

original: rjes su gnang ba thob nas slar yang tshogs kyi 'dus bar thu bo'i ming ni chung ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba thob nas slar yang tshogs kyi 'dus bar thu bo'i ming ni chung ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Having obtained permission, one again becomes the youngest in the gathering of the assembly.

original: dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs pa las bu rnams kyi ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba ri bong 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dkrugs pa las bu rnams kyi ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba ri bong 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: The root downfall of the sons occurs through disturbing the mind of the glorious guru, the rabbit.

original: de yi bka' la 'gongs pas gzhan du 'gyur te nges par de bzhin spun la khros pas gsum pa 'o //
analyzed: de yi bka' la 'gongs pas gzhan du 'gyur te nges par de bzhin spun la khros pas gsum pa 'o //
translated: Through transgressing his words, it becomes the other, and likewise the third is through anger toward a brother.

original: byams pa btang bas bzhi par 'gyur te byang chub sems ni rab tu nyams pa las kyang mda' ru 'gyur //
analyzed: byams pa btang bas bzhi par 'gyur te byang chub sems ni rab tu nyams pa las kyang mda' ru 'gyur //
translated: By abandoning love, one becomes the fourth, and the bodhicitta is the arrow that has fallen away.

original: drug pa grub pa'i mtha' la smod pa ri bo dag kyang ma smin mi la gsang ba byin las so; ;phung po nyon mongs pa las klu ru 'gyur te slar yang dgu pa dag pa'i chos la ma dad gang //
analyzed: drug pa grub pa'i mtha' la smod pa ri bo dag kyang ma smin mi la gsang ba byin las so; ;phung po nyon mongs pa las klu ru 'gyur te slar yang dgu pa dag pa'i chos la ma dad gang //
translated: By disparaging the philosophical tenets, one becomes the sixth, the mountain, by giving the secret to the unripe person. By the aggregates and the afflictions, one becomes the nƒÅga, and again the ninth, by lack of faith in the pure Dharma.

original: sgyu yi byams pa dang ni ming sogs bral ba bde ba ster la rtog pa phyogs dang drag po 'o; ;dag pa'i sems can dag la skyon brjod pa las nyi ma dam tshig thob pa gtong pa las kyang gzhan //üîΩbud med thams cad la smod nges par ma nur 'gyur te rdo rje'i theg par gnas @97a *//
analyzed: sgyu yi byams pa dang ni ming sogs bral ba bde ba ster la rtog pa phyogs dang drag po 'o; ;dag pa'i sems can dag la skyon brjod pa las nyi ma dam tshig thob pa gtong pa las kyang gzhan // bud med thams cad la smod nges par ma nur 'gyur te rdo rje'i theg par gnas @97a *//
translated: By the love of deception and the bestowal of happiness free from names, etc., one becomes the conceptual direction and Rudra. By declaring the faults of pure sentient beings, one becomes the sun. By giving up the commitments, one becomes the other.

original: pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: pa rnams la'o //
translated: By disparaging all women, one becomes the tortoise. By disparaging those who abide in the Vajra Vehicle, one becomes the camel.

original: klu dang bzhi yi nor bu gser gyi bum pa dag gam rgyal po sa yi rang bzhin rin chen bcas //
analyzed: klu dang bzhi yi nor bu gser gyi bum pa dag gam rgyal po sa yi rang bzhin rin chen bcas //
translated: By the nƒÅga and the four, the jewel, the golden vase, or the king, the nature of the earth, with jewels,

original: sman dang dri dang ldan pa'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis gdan gyi dbus su khrus bya ste //
analyzed: sman dang dri dang ldan pa'i rgyal dang rnam rgyal bum pa dag gis gdan gyi dbus su khrus bya ste //
translated: The king and the victorious vase, filled with medicine and perfume, are used to bathe the disciple in the center of the seat.

original: klu dag gis ni dpal ldan cod pan bcing ste nor 'dab padmar bzhi yis dar dpyangs bcing bar bya //
analyzed: klu dag gis ni dpal ldan cod pan bcing ste nor 'dab padmar bzhi yis dar dpyangs bcing bar bya //
translated: The glorious diadem is tied by the Nagas, and the silk ribbons are tied by the four lotus petals.

original: phyag rgya la ni dpal ldan bum pa yis te 'dir ni padma dang bral re kha lnga po spangs //
analyzed: phyag rgya la ni dpal ldan bum pa yis te 'dir ni padma dang bral re kha lnga po spangs //
translated: The glorious vase is used for the seal, but here the lotus is omitted and the five lines are abandoned.

original: dang po chu dag la ni dge bsnyen nyid du 'gyur te bum pa la yang dge tshul dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: dang po chu dag la ni dge bsnyen nyid du 'gyur te bum pa la yang dge tshul dag tu 'gyur //
translated: First, in the water, he becomes a layman, and in the vase he becomes a novice.

original: gsang ba'i dbang la dge slong dang ni gong ma'i byed pa la yang gnas brtan zhes par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang la dge slong dang ni gong ma'i byed pa la yang gnas brtan zhes par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: In the secret initiation he becomes a bhikshu, and in the higher actions he becomes a sthavira.

original: phyag rgya dar dpyangs cod pan dag dang rdo rje mchod phyir thogs ni bla ma mchog gis sbyin par bya //
analyzed: phyag rgya dar dpyangs cod pan dag dang rdo rje mchod phyir thogs ni bla ma mchog gis sbyin par bya //
translated: The seal, the silk ribbons, and the diadem are given by the supreme guru, and the vajra and the bell are given by the supreme vajra master.

original: de dag slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa nyid //
analyzed: de dag slob dpon slad du rang gi rgyal ba'i rigs kyi dbang gis phyag rgya rnam par dag pa nyid //
translated: For the sake of the master, the pure seal is given by the power of one's own buddha family.

original: steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so //
analyzed: steng du bla re bkod cing sa yi mthil gyi gnas dag tu yang ri mo gsum ni kun nas so //
translated: Above, a canopy is arranged, and on the floor three lines all around.

original: de rnams zur du nor bu gsar gyi bum par chur bcas skud pa dang ldan padma'i kha rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams zur du nor bu gsar gyi bum par chur bcas skud pa dang ldan padma'i kha rnams so //
translated: In those, in the corners, are new jeweled vases with water and thread, and lotus mouths.

original: dung sogs gser gyi snod dang yang na dngul gyi rang bzhin dag tu dri yi chu ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: dung sogs gser gyi snod dang yang na dngul gyi rang bzhin dag tu dri yi chu ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: In golden vessels such as conch shells, or of silver nature, the water of scent is prepared.

original: snying por gser gyi rang bzhin gsal ba'i gdan dag rab tu bkod de de la khrus ni brtsam par bya //
analyzed: snying por gser gyi rang bzhin gsal ba'i gdan dag rab tu bkod de de la khrus ni brtsam par bya //
translated: In the center, a golden natural clear seat is well arranged, and on that the bathing is begun.

original: me tog sogs dang dri yi til mar nyi ma me yis min pa dag gis lha la byug par bya //
analyzed: me tog sogs dang dri yi til mar nyi ma me yis min pa dag gis lha la byug par bya //
translated: With flowers, etc., and scented oil, not from the sun or fire, the deity is anointed.

original: phyi ma rnams kyis dril phyis byas nas sbrang @97b rtsi mar dang zho dang 'o ma chu yis bkru bar bya //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams kyis dril phyis byas nas sbrang @97b rtsi mar dang zho dang 'o ma chu yis bkru bar bya //
translated: With the latter, having polished, one should wash with honey, butter, curd, milk, and water.

original: don grub rnams dang mar me dag dang rnam mang 'bras bu mchog gis 'di la nges par byabs nas ni //
analyzed: don grub rnams dang mar me dag dang rnam mang 'bras bu mchog gis 'di la nges par byabs nas ni //
translated: Having certainly bathed this with the Accomplisher of Aims, lamps, and many excellent fruits,

original: de yi gnas nas bskyod par bya ste sku yang dmar po'i gos dag gis ni yang dag g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yi gnas nas bskyod par bya ste sku yang dmar po'i gos dag gis ni yang dag g-yogs pa'o //
translated: One should move from that place, and the body should be well covered with red garments.

original: dpal ldan dkyil 'khor mthar ni mnyam pa'i sa yi gnas la rgyal ba'i cha yis re kh'a lnga byas te //
analyzed: dpal ldan dkyil 'khor mthar ni mnyam pa'i sa yi gnas la rgyal ba'i cha yis re kh'a lnga byas te //
translated: At the end of the glorious ma·πá·∏çala, on the level ground, one should draw five lines with the victor‚Äôs part.

original: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa rang rigs phyogs su gnas ba'i mtshan ma lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa rang rigs phyogs su gnas ba'i mtshan ma lnga yis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the center, there is an eight-petaled lotus, adorned with the five insignia of one‚Äôs own family, situated in the directions.

original: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya ba zhal gyi padma nub tu phyogs pa'i lha dang lha mo 'am //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gzhag par bya ba zhal gyi padma nub tu phyogs pa'i lha dang lha mo 'am //
translated: In the center of that, one should place the face of the lotus facing west, the deity or goddess,

original: mchod rten sogs dang glegs bam dag gam thang sku zhes pa'ang de bzhin de la mngon phyogs bsngags pa 'o //
analyzed: mchod rten sogs dang glegs bam dag gam thang sku zhes pa'ang de bzhin de la mngon phyogs bsngags pa 'o //
translated: or the st≈´pa, and so on, or the book, or the painting, likewise facing it, praised.

original: rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje stong pa'i rang bzhin dag tu byas nas ni //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje stong pa'i rang bzhin dag tu byas nas ni //
translated: The supreme victor, together with the vajra of body, speech, and mind, should be made of the nature of emptiness.

original: phyi nas sngar brjod sbyor pa dag gis zla nyid rdo rje las skyes dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas sngar brjod sbyor pa dag gis zla nyid rdo rje las skyes dus kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: Then, later, by the previously mentioned procedure, one should meditate on KƒÅlacakra born from the moon, sun, and vajra.

original: rig pa'i lha mo sogs dang sangs rgyas a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes rang rang sa bon gyis bskyed rnams //
analyzed: rig pa'i lha mo sogs dang sangs rgyas a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes rang rang sa bon gyis bskyed rnams //
translated: The goddesses of awareness and so forth, and the buddhas born of the families of ƒÄlikƒÅli, are generated from their respective seed syllables.

original: snying mgrin lte ba gsang ba mgo dang gtsug tor 'khor lo dag la rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya //
analyzed: snying mgrin lte ba gsang ba mgo dang gtsug tor 'khor lo dag la rigs kyi dbang gis bsgom par bya //
translated: They should be visualized in the wheels of the heart, throat, navel, secret place, head, and crown, according to the family.

original: de ltar nges pa nyid du bsgom par bya ste slar yang mtha' dag lha rnams dag gi lus la yang //
analyzed: de ltar nges pa nyid du bsgom par bya ste slar yang mtha' dag lha rnams dag gi lus la yang //
translated: In this way, one should visualize them with certainty, and then again, in the bodies of all the deities,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po dag gis srid med srid mnyam ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste gzhug pa dag dang ni //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po dag gis srid med srid mnyam ye shes sems dpa' bkug ste gzhug pa dag dang ni //
translated: the kings of wrathful ones summon the wisdom beings, who are nonexistent yet equal to existence, and cause them to enter.

original: bcing dang mnyes pa dang ni ro mnyam byed pa dag kyang lha rnams kyi ni rang gi lus la bya //
analyzed: bcing dang mnyes pa dang ni ro mnyam byed pa dag kyang lha rnams kyi ni rang gi lus la bya //
translated: They bind them, delight them, and make them of the same taste, also in the bodies of the deities.

original: de nas slob dpon nyid kyis zhal ni rab tu @98a *//
analyzed: de nas slob dpon nyid kyis zhal ni rab tu @98a *//
translated: Then the master himself, with a very clear face,

original: gsal bar byas pa'i lha la phyag dag 'tshal bar bya //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pa'i lha la phyag dag 'tshal bar bya //
translated: should pay homage to the deities.

original: aa sogs ka sogs dag las lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs yon tan la gnas sa bon gang //
analyzed: aa sogs ka sogs dag las lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs yon tan la gnas sa bon gang //
translated: The seed syllables of the gods and goddesses, abiding in their respective families and qualities, are from the vowels and consonants.

original: rang gi sa bon de ni snying gi dbus su zla nyi kha sbyor la gnas sku gsung thugs ldan par //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de ni snying gi dbus su zla nyi kha sbyor la gnas sku gsung thugs ldan par //
translated: His seed is in the center of the heart, on the joined sun and moon, endowed with body, speech, and mind.

original: mtha' dag lus la gnas ba'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan gyis yan lag dpe byad mkha' dang brgyad kyis te //
analyzed: mtha' dag lus la gnas ba'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan gyis yan lag dpe byad mkha' dang brgyad kyis te //
translated: The thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks of his body, which are present in their entirety, are on the petals, and the petals are on the pages of the scriptures.

original: yi ge rnams kyis phye ba de nyid rab gsal 'dab ma 'dab mar glegs bam rnams la bsgom par bya //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyis phye ba de nyid rab gsal 'dab ma 'dab mar glegs bam rnams la bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on that very clear reality, divided by the syllables.

original: mchod rten snying por dpal ldan 'khor lo rdo rje nor bu padma dag dang byang du ral gri nyid //
analyzed: mchod rten snying por dpal ldan 'khor lo rdo rje nor bu padma dag dang byang du ral gri nyid //
translated: In the heart of the stupa is the glorious wheel, and in the north is the sword, and in the east is the jewel, and in the south is the lotus.

original: bgrang phreng la ni h'um ge yi ge nor bu yongs su bgrang ba rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams //
analyzed: bgrang phreng la ni h'um ge yi ge nor bu yongs su bgrang ba rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad rnams //
translated: On the rosary is the syllable h≈´·πÅkƒÅra, and the counting of the jewel is the marks and minor marks.

original: dril bu'i sku la dbyangs ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu rnams dag dang ka sogs sde rnams rdo rje la //
analyzed: dril bu'i sku la dbyangs ni gsum gyis bsgyur ba'i bcu rnams dag dang ka sogs sde rnams rdo rje la //
translated: On the body of the bell are the ten vowels transformed by the three vowels, and the ka group, etc., are on the vajra.

original: de dag kho na mchod phyir thogs la bcu yis bsgyur ba nor gyi dpe byad rnams ni stod g-yogs la //
analyzed: de dag kho na mchod phyir thogs la bcu yis bsgyur ba nor gyi dpe byad rnams ni stod g-yogs la //
translated: Those very same are on the sacred thread, and the ten transformed by the ten are the minor marks of wealth, on the upper garment.

original: ka sogs sde par dbyangs dang bcas pa mkha' ro yon tan rnams ni pus 'khyud dag la bsgom par bya //üîΩham ha: dpal ldan rna cha la ste aam aa: zhes pa zung ni mgul rgyan ska rags dag la 'o //
analyzed: ka sogs sde par dbyangs dang bcas pa mkha' ro yon tan rnams ni pus 'khyud dag la bsgom par bya // ham ha: dpal ldan rna cha la ste aam aa: zhes pa zung ni mgul rgyan ska rags dag la 'o //
translated: The vowels and consonants with the sounds of space, etc., should be meditated on the thighs.üîΩThe pairs ha and ha, and a and a, are on the earrings, and the pairs a and a, and a and a, are on the necklace and belt.

original: de bzhin du yang aa yig zung ni gdu bu dag la 'gyur te rkang gdub dag la ha h'a yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang aa yig zung ni gdu bu dag la 'gyur te rkang gdub dag la ha h'a yang //
translated: The pairs a and a, and a and a, are on the bracelets, and the pairs ha and ha are on the anklets.

original: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa stong pa'i rnam pa lnga po dag ni thal ba dag la bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mtha' dag lus la gnas pa stong pa'i rnam pa lnga po dag ni thal ba dag la bsgom par bya //
translated: The five aspects of emptiness, which are located in the entire body, should be meditated on the ashes.

original: rang lus ye shes rnam par dag las rdo rje gsum dang bcas pa'i phung po khams la sogs pa @98b  lha rnams kyi ni rang gi snying ga'i padmar rang rang sa bon dag gi rim pas dgod par bya //
analyzed: rang lus ye shes rnam par dag las rdo rje gsum dang bcas pa'i phung po khams la sogs pa @98b  lha rnams kyi ni rang gi snying ga'i padmar rang rang sa bon dag gi rim pas dgod par bya //
translated: The deities of the aggregates, elements, etc., together with the three vajras, which are from the pure gnosis of one‚Äôs own body, should be arranged in one‚Äôs heart lotus in the order of their respective seed syllables.

original: sa bon bkod na rab tu gnas par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mchod rten sku gzugs sogs la 'o //
analyzed: sa bon bkod na rab tu gnas par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mchod rten sku gzugs sogs la 'o //
translated: When the seed syllables are arranged, they are consecrated, O lord of men, as in the case of st≈´pas and images.

original: nye bar bsdu ba'i dus su lag pa'i rdo rje dag gis rang gi lus la sa bon gzhug par bya //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba'i dus su lag pa'i rdo rje dag gis rang gi lus la sa bon gzhug par bya //
translated: At the time of the conclusion, one should cause the seed syllables to enter one‚Äôs body with the vajra hands.

original: 'di dang dang po ru yang ri mor bris ba'i thang sku rnams kyi me long la ni khrus su 'gyur //üîΩphyi nas dri dang sbos dang shin tu dri bzang me tog rnams dang glu dang rol mo dag dang ni //
analyzed: 'di dang dang po ru yang ri mor bris ba'i thang sku rnams kyi me long la ni khrus su 'gyur // phyi nas dri dang sbos dang shin tu dri bzang me tog rnams dang glu dang rol mo dag dang ni //
translated: This and the first [are] the bathing [rites] for the mirror of the painted scrolls.üîΩAfterwards, one should worship the deity with perfumes, incense, very fragrant flowers, songs, music,

original: gar dang rnam mang mchog gi gos dang rnga yab dang ni gdugs rnams dag gis lha la mchod par bya //
analyzed: gar dang rnam mang mchog gi gos dang rnga yab dang ni gdugs rnams dag gis lha la mchod par bya //
translated: dance, various excellent garments, yak-tail fans, and parasols.

original: de ltar rab gnas byas nas rnam mang mchog gi ro rnams dag gis dge 'dun mchog ston rab tu sbyin //
analyzed: de ltar rab gnas byas nas rnam mang mchog gi ro rnams dag gis dge 'dun mchog ston rab tu sbyin //
translated: Having thus consecrated, one should give the supreme assembly the best of many tastes.

original: khron pa rdzing dang mtshe 'ur phyogs dang phyogs bral du ni klu yi rgyal po nor rnams dgod par bya //
analyzed: khron pa rdzing dang mtshe 'ur phyogs dang phyogs bral du ni klu yi rgyal po nor rnams dgod par bya //
translated: In the directions and intermediate directions, one should place the treasures of the nƒÅga kings in wells, ponds, and lotus ponds.

original: chu gter bdun po rang gi sa bon gyis te sbrang rtsi chu dang ldan pa'i dri lnga gzhug par bya //
analyzed: chu gter bdun po rang gi sa bon gyis te sbrang rtsi chu dang ldan pa'i dri lnga gzhug par bya //
translated: One should place the seven water treasures with one‚Äôs own seed syllables, and the five scents together with honey water.

original: sbyin sreg mthar ni rdzing bu la sogs dag la chu lha dkar po phyag na zhags pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sbyin sreg mthar ni rdzing bu la sogs dag la chu lha dkar po phyag na zhags pa bsgom par bya //
translated: At the end of the fire sacrifice, in a pond and so forth, one should visualize white Varu·πáa with a noose in his hand.

original: skyed mos tshal du shing gcig dpag bsam ljon pa mtha' dag shing la gnas par dbang ni bskur nas so //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal du shing gcig dpag bsam ljon pa mtha' dag shing la gnas par dbang ni bskur nas so //
translated: In a pleasure grove, on a single tree, a wish-fulfilling tree, and all trees, one should confer empowerment.

original: cod pan dar dpyangs dag dang do shal gdu bu dang ni de bzhin rna cha ska rags la sogs pa //
analyzed: cod pan dar dpyangs dag dang do shal gdu bu dang ni de bzhin rna cha ska rags la sogs pa //
translated: A crown, hanging silk, necklaces, bracelets, and likewise earrings, belts, and so forth

original: slob dpon la ni rab tu sbyin byar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yon yang bdag nyid nus pas so //
analyzed: slob dpon la ni rab tu sbyin byar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po yon yang bdag nyid nus pas so //
translated: should be given to the master by the lord of men, and the master should give the fee according to his ability.

original: sbyin bdag gis ni bsod nams slad du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la gzhan don don du gnyer bya ste //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ni bsod nams slad du mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs la gzhan don don du gnyer bya ste //
translated: For the sake of merit, the patron should strive for the benefit of others in the entire assembly of the family.

original: bsod nams 'di yis @99a *//
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis @99a *//
translated: By this merit,

original: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni bla med byang chub thob par shog /
analyzed: rnam gsum srid pa la gnas sems can rnams ni bla med byang chub thob par shog /
translated: may all beings dwelling in the three existences attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ji srid phyogs kyi lo ni gcig phu rnam ba bcu ru 'gyur te blta ba dang ni reg par bya //
analyzed: ji srid phyogs kyi lo ni gcig phu rnam ba bcu ru 'gyur te blta ba dang ni reg par bya //
translated: For as long as the directions are one yojana in size, they should be seen and touched.

original: de nas 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter g-yo ba la sogs rnams ni bsten par bya //
analyzed: de nas 'khyud par bya ste ro dang bcas pa'i chu gter g-yo ba la sogs rnams ni bsten par bya //
translated: Then one should embrace her, and the one with the water of passion, etc., should be attended to.

original: lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste  khro bo 'byung po lha min cha //
analyzed: lo ni nyi shu yan chad phyag rgya mchog tu 'jigs byed ma ste  khro bo 'byung po lha min cha //
translated: The twenty-year-old and above is the supreme mudra, Bhairavi, the wrathful one, the demon, the asura,

original: dbang gi don du drug dang bzhi ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gzhan ni bsgom pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dbang gi don du drug dang bzhi ste bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba gzhan ni bsgom pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of empowerment, the six and four, bestowing the fruit of the bliss of equality, the other for the sake of meditation.

original: dpal ldan shes rab nu ma la yang dang por reg pa gang yin bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
analyzed: dpal ldan shes rab nu ma la yang dang por reg pa gang yin bum pa'i dbang ni de nyid do //
translated: That which is the first touching of the glorious wisdom's breast is the vase empowerment.

original: gsang ba dag las ri bong 'dzin pa myang ba dang ni blta ba dag gis gsang ba'i dbang du 'gyur //
analyzed: gsang ba dag las ri bong 'dzin pa myang ba dang ni blta ba dag gis gsang ba'i dbang du 'gyur //
translated: From the secret, the tasting and seeing of the rabbit-holder is the secret empowerment.

original: shes rab ye shes dbang la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs kyi yan lag zhal gyis sbyang ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes dbang la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs kyi yan lag zhal gyis sbyang ba byas nas ni //
translated: In the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, having purified all the limbs of the Victor's family,

original: rgyal ba dag kyang 'dir ni bla mas dbang por byas nas slob ma la ni phyag rgya sbyin par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba dag kyang 'dir ni bla mas dbang por byas nas slob ma la ni phyag rgya sbyin par bya //
translated: The Victor, having made the guru the lord here, gives the mudra to the disciple.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad dang ldan zhun ma'i gser dang mtshungs shing bcu gnyis lo lon mdzes pa'i bu me ni //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad dang ldan zhun ma'i gser dang mtshungs shing bcu gnyis lo lon mdzes pa'i bu me ni //
translated: The girl, who is endowed with all ornaments, is like refined gold, and is twelve years old.

original: khrag dang ldan la shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid dag gis rang gi rdo rje nor bus 'dod spyad nas //
analyzed: khrag dang ldan la shes rab thabs kyi bdag nyid dag gis rang gi rdo rje nor bus 'dod spyad nas //
translated: Having enjoyed with her, with the nature of wisdom and means, one‚Äôs own vajra gem,

original: sa bon dang bcas rdo rje dag kyang slob ma dag par shes nas kha ru 'phang pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas rdo rje dag kyang slob ma dag par shes nas kha ru 'phang pa byas nas ni //
translated: and having made the vajra with the seed syllable, one should place it in the mouth of the disciple, knowing him to be pure.

original: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya sbyin bya de nas slar yang gzhan ni du ba'i lam sogs ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya sbyin bya de nas slar yang gzhan ni du ba'i lam sogs ldan pa'o //
translated: Then one should give one‚Äôs own consort, and again another who possesses the path of smoke, and so on.

original: skrag dang rnam @99b bar 'khrul pa'i sems ldan g-yo sgyu gzhan dbang 'gro ma nad dang ldan dang bu skyes ma //
analyzed: skrag dang rnam @99b bar 'khrul pa'i sems ldan g-yo sgyu gzhan dbang 'gro ma nad dang ldan dang bu skyes ma //
translated: One who is frightened, confused, deceitful, under the power of others, sick, or has given birth,

original: khro khengs nor la sred dang mi bden rtsod pa la dga' rang gi yan lag dman dang rnam dag min //
analyzed: khro khengs nor la sred dang mi bden rtsod pa la dga' rang gi yan lag dman dang rnam dag min //
translated: angry, arrogant, greedy for wealth, untruthful, quarrelsome, with inferior limbs, or impure‚Äî

original: shes rab 'di dag dbang la shin tu mkhas pa'i bla ma dag gis spang bar bya 'o mi yi dbang //
analyzed: shes rab 'di dag dbang la shin tu mkhas pa'i bla ma dag gis spang bar bya 'o mi yi dbang //
translated: these wisdom consorts should be abandoned by the guru who is very skilled in the empowerment, O lord of men.

original: sngar brjod sangs rgyas la gus bla ma'i dam tshig 'dzin ma rnams ni phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod par bya //
analyzed: sngar brjod sangs rgyas la gus bla ma'i dam tshig 'dzin ma rnams ni phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod par bya //
translated: The previously mentioned [vowels] are the homage and worship of the Buddhas and the holding of the commitments of the guru.

original: 'dod pa skyod par byed pa 'gro ba rang gi yid la 'o gang ba dag ni gang ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa skyod par byed pa 'gro ba rang gi yid la 'o gang ba dag ni gang ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The desire-producing [vowels] fill the mind of the world with their own [bliss].

original: gang ba yan lag mchog dag las ni ri bong 'dzin pa khu bar byas nas thig le bzang po 'dzag /
analyzed: gang ba yan lag mchog dag las ni ri bong 'dzin pa khu bar byas nas thig le bzang po 'dzag /
translated: From the supreme limbs of the filled [vowels], the excellent bindu drips, having been made into the essence of the rabbit-holder [i.e., the moon].

original: aoddas bkug pa mchog gi bde ba rang bzhin gyis ster thig le grol ba dag ni gsum gyi mthar //
analyzed: aoddas bkug pa mchog gi bde ba rang bzhin gyis ster thig le grol ba dag ni gsum gyi mthar //
translated: The bindu, which is released at the end of the three, naturally bestows the supreme bliss of the summoned gods.üîΩThe bliss that drips from seeing, touching, and embracing is divided into joy and so forth.

original: blta dang reg dang 'grogs la 'dzag pa'i bde ba 'di dag dga' ba'i dbye ba la sogs dag gis so; ;'dod pa dga' bar byed de dang po dag kyang mi rnams kyi ni mig gis blta ba dag la 'o //
analyzed: blta dang reg dang 'grogs la 'dzag pa'i bde ba 'di dag dga' ba'i dbye ba la sogs dag gis so; ;'dod pa dga' bar byed de dang po dag kyang mi rnams kyi ni mig gis blta ba dag la 'o //
translated: Desire is delightful, and at first it is the eyes of humans that see.

original: phyi nas gang ba rab tu sbyar ba la ste slar yang mchog gi dga' ba nyid do rang lus la //
analyzed: phyi nas gang ba rab tu sbyar ba la ste slar yang mchog gi dga' ba nyid do rang lus la //
translated: Later, it is applied to the filled [vowels], and again it is the supreme joy itself in one's own body.

original: 'bar ba thig le 'dzag pa dang ni dga' ba yang ste khyad par dga' ba rdo rje padma la //
analyzed: 'bar ba thig le 'dzag pa dang ni dga' ba yang ste khyad par dga' ba rdo rje padma la //
translated: The blazing, the dripping of the drop, and the joy, and also the special joy, are in the vajra and lotus.

original: aodda thig le gsum gyi mtha' ru 'gyur ba la gnas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rdo rje byed //
analyzed: aodda thig le gsum gyi mtha' ru 'gyur ba la gnas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rdo rje byed //
translated: The three drops are at the end of the oddi, and the innate joy is in the vajra.

original: 'dod dang dga' ba dang ni 'dar dang 'gyur med dag dang bzhi po yis ni sbyor ba de gcig ste //
analyzed: 'dod dang dga' ba dang ni 'dar dang 'gyur med dag dang bzhi po yis ni sbyor ba de gcig ste //
translated: Desire, joy, trembling, and immobility are the four in that union.

original: gang ba dang ni nus dang skye ba dag dang mchog gi dga' ba nyid ni gnyis par nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang ba dang ni nus dang skye ba dag dang mchog gi dga' ba nyid ni gnyis par nges par 'gyur //
translated: The full, the able, the born, and the supreme joy are the second.

original: 'bar ba dang ni thig le brgyal ba dag @100a *//
analyzed: 'bar ba dang ni thig le brgyal ba dag @100a *//
translated: The blazing, the drop, the fainting,

original: dang slar yang khyad par dga' ba nyid ni gsum pa 'o //
analyzed: dang slar yang khyad par dga' ba nyid ni gsum pa 'o //
translated: and again the special joy are the third.

original: aodda dang ni n'a da dag dang gnyid dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba nyid ni bzhi par 'gyur //
analyzed: aodda dang ni n'a da dag dang gnyid dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba nyid ni bzhi par 'gyur //
translated: The oddi, the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´, sleep, and the innate joy are the fourth.

original: sems kyi bsam pa yis ni ma ru 'gyur te reg pa dang ni blta ba dag gis srid me 'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa yis ni ma ru 'gyur te reg pa dang ni blta ba dag gis srid me 'o //
translated: The mind‚Äôs intention is the mother, and the union of the two is the son.

original: rdo rje zhugs pas bu mo byed pa dang bcas shin tu dga' bas tsha mo dag ni de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje zhugs pas bu mo byed pa dang bcas shin tu dga' bas tsha mo dag ni de bzhin nyid //
translated: The vajra having entered, the girl, with the act of the son, is very much pleased, and the niece, in the same way.

original: thig le lhung na chung ma gzhan gyi regs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma ni 'dod chags nyams las so //
analyzed: thig le lhung na chung ma gzhan gyi regs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma ni 'dod chags nyams las so //
